However, with the rise of Urshifu-S, Tera Fairy is a viable option to resist Wicked Blow and Fighting-type moves while also being neutral into the majority of the metagame. Be careful using this, however as Teratallized Urshifu-R threatens a 2HKO with Surging Strikes, and Landorus can easily pin you with Earth Power and Sludge Bomb.

  • The Special Defense investment allows Registeel to almost always survive Timid Earth Power from Landorus. The rest of the Defense EVs along with an Impish nature maximize its damage output.

Latias.overview:
• Latias is an exceptional Tailwind setter thanks to its great bulk, defensive typing, Levitate, and solid Speed. It also checks common threats such as Landorus and Urshifu-R.

  • Assault Vest Kingambit is a great partner, beating most of Latias's counters like Flutter Mane, Gholdengo, and, to an extent, Incineroar. It also makes great use of Tailwind, and Latias beats most of its counters as well.

  • Latias can be very tough to remove especially if it Terastallizes into a Poison-type, which, when combined with Levitate, has only one weakness and many valuable resistances. This becomes extra apparent when using Recover, which lets it clean up late-game when positioned well, especially if Mist Ball gets some Special Attack drops.

Bulky Tailwind Setter.description:
• Ice Beam is great coverage in general and very important for OHKOing Landorus, one of Latias's best and most important matchups.

  • Rocky Helmet lets Latias punish common and important moves like Fake Out and U-turn. It also breaks Chien-Pao's Focus Sash if it opts to run Ice Spinner and heavily discourages the prevalent Urshifu-R from attacking it.

  • The Speed EVs allow it to outspeed max Speed Landorus, the Special Attack EVs let it OHKO Urshifu-R and Landorus more consistently, and the rest of the EVs are used to optimize its bulk.

  • Tera Poison, when paired with Levitate, makes Latias very difficult to break, as Psychic-types, besides opposing Latias, are not common, and the Poison typing offers resistances to many relevant offensive types, the most important of which being Fairy, because of Flutter Mane.

Offensive.description:
Latios is an offensive Pokemon with speed control that sets itself apart by being a check to Amoonguss, Urshifu-R, and Koraidon, being able to OHKO them with Soul Dew-boosted Luster Purge and wall the latter two. Icy Wind is a really good last move on Latios because it provides speed control for Latios and its partners to take advantage of while also breaking opposing Focus Sash. The aforementioned Soul Dew helps Latios get the crucial KOs it needs to against foes such as Amoonguss and Koraidon with Luster Purge. Tera Steel is preferred on Latios because it lets it completely wall Calyrex-I and Landorus while providing resistances to Flutter Mane's Moonblast, Chien-Pao Ice STAB, and Miraidon's Draco Meteor.

Latios, even with Tera Steel, still struggles against Pokemon like Calyrex-S, Chi-Yu, and Incineroar due to their ability to threaten Latios before Terastallization with Astral Barrage, Dark Pulse, and Knock Off, respectively. In addition, these Pokemon also threaten Latios after Tera with another STAB move. Dark-types that have Sucker Punch, such as Chien-Pao, help Latios deal with Calyrex-S by KOing it before it can attack. Wide Guard users such as Zamazenta-C and Pelipper can also help Latios in the Calyrex-S matchup by protecting Latios from Astral Barrage, forcing Calyrex-S to use Draining Kiss, Psyshock, or Psychic, all of which Tera Steel Latios resists. Both Pelipper and Zamazenta-C threaten to OHKO Chi-Yu and Incineroar, and, in Zamazenta-C's case, OHKO Flutter Mane with Heavy Slam. Latios also provides for its partners by countering Koraidon, which Zamazenta-C struggles against, and Urshifu-R, which Chien-Pao struggles against. The other way Latios helps its partners is by lowering the Speed of their foes with Icy Wind, which lets Chien-Pao outspeed Speed Booster Energy Flutter Mane and Zamazenta-C outspeed Miraidon.

Calm Mind.description:
Calm Mind Kyogre aims to find opportunities to set up and nuke foes with Origin Pulse, which doesn't rely on Kyogre's HP stat like Water Spout does. Ice Beam provides coverage for Grass- and Dragon-types like Rillaboom, Amoonguss, Raging Bolt, and Miraidon, which resist Origin Pulse. Calm Mind allows Kyogre to not only pick up more KOs on foes like Tera Fire Calyrex-I but also helps Kyogre survive attacks that would KO it such as boosted Astral Barrage from Calyrex-S. Leftovers provides passive recovery, further adding to the bulk of this Kyogre set. With the HP and Special Defense investments, Kyogre is capable of surviving a Helping Hand-boosted Choice Specs Astral Barrage from Calyrex-S. The EVs put into Special Attack let Kyogre OHKO Koraidon with Ice Beam after a Calm Mind boost. The Speed investment lets Kyogre outspeed maximum Speed Incineroar. Tera Grass provides resistances to Grass- and Electric-type attacks from the likes of Rillaboom and Raging Bolt while also allowing Kyogre to block Spore from the likes of Amoonguss.

Even with Ice Beam and Tera Grass, Kyogre can still struggle with common Pokemon such as Rillaboom and Raging Bolt, threatening Kyogre before and after Terastallizing. Koraidon and Miraidon are also scary for Kyogre, with Koraidon overriding rain and dealing big damage with Collision Course and Miraidon nuking Kyogre with Draco Meteor or Electro Drift. Wide Guard from foes such as Pelipper and Zamazenta-C is also an annoyance, as it denies Origin Pulse. Amoonguss helps Kyogre by chunking Rillaboom with Sludge Bomb and shutting down Raging Bolt with Rage Powder or Spore. With Tera Fairy, Amoonguss can also redirect Draco Meteor from Miraidon. Spore can also help stop Wide Guard users. Roaring Moon provides Tailwind support, allowing Kyogre to outspeed aforementioned foes like Koraidon and Miraidon, while threatening Koraidon with Tera Flying Acrobatics. Fake Out support from Pokemon such as Rillaboom and Incineroar grants opportunities for Kyogre to use Calm Mind or attack without the annoyance of Wide Guard.

Assault Vest.description:
Kyogre is a strong and bulky attacker in VGC, being able to KO metagame staples such as Incineroar and Chi-Yu with ease. Water Spout provides a super powerful option, while Origin Pulse helps if Kyogre gets whittled down. Thunder hits annoying Water-types such as opposing Kyogre, Urshifu-R, and Pelipper. Ice Beam hits Grass- and Dragon-types like Amoonguss and Miraidon. Assault Vest helps Kyogre in surviving super powerful attacks such as Modest Choice Specs Volt Switch from Miraidon. The EV spread allows Kyogre to survive a Guts-boosted Headlong Rush from Ursaluna, pick up KOs on Pokemon such as Assault Vest Incineroar, and outspeed Choice Scarf Urshifu-R and Calyrex-S if Tailwind is activated. Tera Grass is able to patch up Kyogre's Electric- and Grass-type weaknesses while also granting an immunity to Spore.

Kyogre tends to struggle against specially bulky Pokemon that can hit it hard such as Rillaboom, Iron Hands, and Raging Bolt. Wide Guard users such as Zamazenta-C and Pelipper can also be an issue, blocking Kyogre's Water Spout and Origin Pulse. Other faster and super strong Pokemon that can quickly whittle down Kyogre like Miraidon can also prove to be challenging. Wo-Chien is a good partner because it's able to keep Kyogre healthy with Pollen Puff, allowing for a full-power Water Spout, while also helping Kyogre pick up KOs thanks to its Ruination. Tablets of Ruin is able to help Kyogre's Defense, making it harder to remove. Tailwind support with a Pokemon such as Tornadus or Iron Jugulis can also be helpful, threatening Grass-types such as Rillaboom with Bleakwind Storm and Hurricane, respectively, and letting Kyogre outspeed some of its major threats. Incineroar and Grimmsnarl are great partners, as they can mitigate damage with Will-O-Wisp + Intimidate and dual screens, respectively. Grimmsnarl also has the added bonus of hindering opponents with Thunder Wave, giving Kyogre more opportunities to launch a powerful Water Spout before foes can do anything.

Bulky 3 Attacks.description:
Kyogre is one of the top Restricted Pokemon in the metagame due to its high Special Attack and access to some of the strongest STAB moves in Water Spout and Origin Pulse, which can OHKO top threats like Incineroar, Ogerpon-H, Flutter Mane and bulkless Zacian-C. Its ability, Drizzle, takes its offensive output to outrageous levels while also facilitating the rain offense archetype. Its base 90 Speed allows it to function in both Tailwind and Trick Room. Origin Pulse allows Kyogre to deal consistent damage if it loses HP, which reduces the power of Water Spout. Hydro Pump is another great option, which allows Kyogre to have a strong Water-type move which isn't spread, allowing it to play better against Wide Guard. Ice Beam can threaten Grass- and Dragon-types like Amoonguss and Koraidon, which take resisted damage from Kyogre's Water-type STAB moves. Mystic Water allows Kyogre to OHKO Calyrex-S and Kingambit with Water Spout, which also allows Kyogre to use defensive Tera type. The EV spread allows Kyogre to survive a -1 Wood Hammer from Rillaboom and take two Life Orb-boosted Astral Barrages from Calyrex-S. The investment in Special Attack allows it to 2HKO Zamazenta-C with Origin Pulse. Tera Grass helps Kyogre defensively against Pokemon like Rillaboom and Raging Bolt as well as providing a Spore immunity.

Kyogre matches up poorly against Pokemon like Rillaboom, Raging Bolt and Ogerpon-W. Landorus is a great partner, as it takes on all of these with Earth Power and Sludge Bomb. It also struggles against faster Tailwind teams, which can threaten early damage, weakening its Water Spout significantly. This can be patched up by using Urshifu-R, which outspeeds most of the metagame with a Choice Scarf and threatens high damage. Amoonguss is quite annoying for Kyogre as well, threatening Spore while taking resisted damage. However, Tornadus, a great partner to Kyogre, can shut it down with Taunt while also providing Prankster Tailwind and Rain Dance, which can be used to reset weather against Groudon and Terapagos-S. Archaludon has great defensive synergy with Kyogre, switching into Rillaboom and Raging Bolt, as well as taking the opportunity to start setting up with Electro Shot.

Clear Amulet.description:
Groudon's role is that of a powerful attacker that uses Drought to power up Heat Crash and Precipice Blades for a STAB spread move. Its Ground typing gives it an immunity to Miraidon's Electric-type STAB moves and a super effective STAB move into some of the top Restricted Pokemon such as Miraidon, Zacian-C, and Zamazenta-C. Groudon uses Swords Dance to set up and be able to OHKO foes such as Zamazenta-C and Calyrex-I. Groudon can also utilize Thunder Punch to hit rain setters like Tornadus, Pelipper, and Kyogre. Helping Hand allows lets Groudon to further boost its teammate's damage output. Groudon's ability to set sun benefits Pokemon such as Flutter Mane or and Raging Bolt. Groudon uses Clear Amulet mainly to block Incineroar's Intimidate and Parting Shot. The Speed investment allows Groudon to outspeed -1 Ogerpon and Calyrex-S in Tailwind. The Defense EVs let Groudon live two Urshifu-R Mystic Water-boosted Surging Strikes in sun, as well as surviving a Wood Hammer from Rillaboom and the Ogerpon formes and +1 Zamazenta-C Body Press. The Attack investment allows Heat Crash to OHKO Amoonguss, Flutter Mane, and Tornadus with sun up, as well as almost always OHKO Miraidon with Precipice Blades. Groudon will also be able to OHKO Urshifu-R with +2 Precipice Blades. The Special Defense EVs let Groudon survive a Choice Specs Tera Fairy Flutter Mane Moonblast and a +1 Spell Tag Calyrex-S Astral Barrage.

Some counters to Groudon include Kyogre and Terapagos, which can remove Groudon's weather. Lunala is another bad matchup for Groudon, as it can easily take a boosted Precipice Blades while moving before it in Trick Room. Groudon has to be very careful around Calyrex-I, since it threatens to OHKO Groudon if it doesn't Terastallize. Some good non-Restricted Pokemon counters such as Pelipper and Landorus can work because of their immunity to Precipice Blades. Pelipper can additionally remove the sun from Groudon, significantly weakening its Heat Crash. Some good teammates for Groudon are Flutter Mane, Raging Bolt, and Walking Wake because the Protosynthesis ability allows them to get faster or stronger, and Groudon setting sun allows for these abilities to be activated. Raging Bolt helps Groudon deal with Kyogre and Pelipper, while Flutter Mane deals with the Ogerpon formes. Other good teammates for Groudon are Incineroar, which provides Fake Out and Intimidate, Amoonguss, which provides Spore and Rage Powder support, and Rillaboom, which is another Fake Out user that provides Grassy Terrain recovery so Groudon can stay on the field longer and set up with Swords Dance. Amoonguss also helps in the Trick Room matchup against Calyrex-I.

Assault Vest.description:
Groudon serves as a bulky attacker that leverages its Assault Vest and natural bulk to withstand physical and special attacks while maintaining strong offensive pressure; therefore, performing well against key special attackers like Miraidon, Calyrex-S, and Terapagos by leveraging its enhanced special defense to withstand their attacks. Heat Crash benefits from Groudon's high weight, enabling it to inflict greater damage on threats like Amoonguss and Flutter Mane. Thunder Punch punishes Pelipper and Tornadus, allowing Groudon to pressure common weather setting support Pokemon that might otherwise hinder its effectiveness. High Horsepower provides a single-target alternative to Precipice Blades, bypassing Wide Guard and providing greater reliability. Stomping Tantrum doubles in power if Groudon's previous move fails, making it useful in situations where it gets flinched by Fake Out or if it misses an attack like Precipice Blades, allowing it to hit back harder the next turn. The invested Speed EVs allow Groudon to outspeed key threats under Tailwind, including Timid Calyrex-S, and common Choice Scarf users like Urshifu-R and Chi-Yu. Assault Vest further enhances its special bulk, enabling it to survive powerful hits such as Astral Barrage from a +2 Choice Specs Calyrex-S. Tera Fire boosts its Fire-type attacks and prevents burns from moves like Incineroar's Will-O-Wisp. With 108 Attack EVs and a Tera Fire, Groudon's Heat Crash guarantees an OHKO on standard Landorus and Ogerpon-H.

Calyrex-I can OHKO Groudon unless it Terastallizes, while Kyogre, Terapagos, and Pelipper can override its sun, weakening its Fire-type moves and leaving it vulnerable to Water-type attacks. Tornadus often carries Rain Dance to disrupt Groudon's weather control. Incineroar is another major obstacle due to the combined effect of Intimidate, Knock Off removing its Assault Vest, and Fake Out preventing Groudon from attacking. To mitigate these weaknesses, Groudon benefits from strong team support from the likes of Volcarona and Gouging Fire, which make excellent partners, with Volcarona providing Tailwind to boost Groudon's Speed and Rage Powder to protect it from attacks. Gouging Fire benefits from sun with Protosynthesis, hitting hard with Flare Blitz while supporting the team with Howl and Breaking Swipe. Flutter Mane and Raging Bolt appreciate the Protosynthesis activation from sun, which helps Flutter Mane against Calyrex-S, while Raging Bolt pressures Kyogre, Pelipper, and Tornadus, which are common threats to Groudon. Chien-Pao is a strong partner that can increase the damage of physical attacks while using its high Speed and access to Sucker Punch to check faster threats. Urshifu-S is an effective partner for Groudon against Terapagos, using powerful Fighting-type attacks such as Close Combat to pressure it.

Garchomp.comments:
Teambuilding

  • Garchomp fits well onto a variety of teams. It isn't capable of surviving multiple strong attacks, so it relies on partners that allow it to attack without receiving a lot of damage in return. Priority Tailwind setters like Talonflame and Whimsicott are great partners, and they both provide additional Taunt support to disrupt Trick Room setters like Porygon2. Fake Out users like Incineroar disrupt foes for Garchomp. Incineroar additionally provides damage reduction via Intimidate and Parting Shot. Garchomp also works well on balance teams featuring Porygon2, as Garchomp threatens Gholdengo and Incineroar, both of which Porygon2 and its common partners struggle to damage. Garchomp additionally performs well on beatdown teams featuring Dragonite, as Garchomp can freely attack with Earthquake without damaging it.
  • Amoonguss and Vivillon provide redirection and sleep support; Amoonguss is bulkier and has a more consistent way of putting foes to sleep, while Vivillon is faster and is immune to Garchomp's Earthquake. Garchomp pairs well with Porygon2; Porygon2 setting Trick Room can allow Garchomp to attack before threats like Dragapult. Porygon2 additionally deals significant damage to Grass- and Flying-types with Ice Beam and can comfortably survive Earthquake while regaining the lost HP with Recover. Dragonite also synergizes well with Garchomp. Dragonite can deal strong damage with Extreme Speed, allowing Garchomp to secure KOs with Earthquake and removes Grass-types like Rillaboom, which Garchomp struggles to KO, with Tera Blast Flying.
  • Garchomp is threatened by Dragon-, Fairy-, and Ice-type attacks like Dragon Darts and Outrage from Dragapult, Moonblast from Clefable, and Blizzard from Alolan Ninetales. All of these attacks can be switched into by Steel-type partners such as Gholdengo and Kingambit. Garchomp also struggles to damage Flying-types like Pelipper, especially when it isn't using Rock Slide, so a partner like Alolan Ninetales easily threatens Flying-types with Blizzard and Freeze-Dry.

Strategy Comments

  • As a glass cannon, Garchomp's task is to deal as much damage as possible uninterrupted. Garchomp performs best when it outspeeds its foes and when it is supported by redirection, allowing Garchomp to attack freely.
  • Garchomp excels at being an early-game sweeper as well as a late-game cleaner. Garchomp primarily attacks using Earthquake to damage both foes. It uses Stomping Tantrum when Garchomp's partner is vulnerable to the damage from Earthquake or when Grassy Terrain is active. Dragon Claw and Rock Slide are used to damage foes that resist Earthquake and Stomping Tantrum.
  • Dragapult outspeeds and threatens Garchomp. To beat Dragapult, Garchomp needs Tailwind or Trick Room support, allowing it to threaten Dragapult with Dragon Claw before it attacks. A partner Kingambit can also survive an attack from Dragapult and threaten it in return with Kowtow Cleave or before Dragapult attacks with Sucker Punch. Rillaboom is also troublesome for Garchomp, as Grassy Terrain weakens the damage of Earthquake. Garchomp is very reliant on partners like Talonflame and Dragonite to remove Rillaboom, as it struggles to deal threatening spread damage when Grassy Terrain is active.

Glass Cannon.description:
• Garchomp utilizes its high Attack and good Speed to outspeed and greatly weaken foes with powerful spread damage.
  • Using both Stomping Tantrum and Earthquake allows Garchomp to switch between dealing single-target and spread damage. Earthquake, however, is used most effectively when Garchomp's partner is able to use Protect or is immune to Ground-type attacks. Rock Slide is most commonly used by Choice Band Garchomp to threaten Flying-types like Talonflame and Pelipper. It is used as an alternative spread damage attack that doesn't affect Garchomp's partner and is unhindered by Grassy Terrain set by a partner Rillaboom.
  • Life Orb boosts Garchomp's damage, allowing it to threaten an OHKO onto +1 Defense Sneasler with Stomping Tantrum or Earthquake and Dragonite with Dragon Claw. Clear Amulet is used to block Intimidate and Parting Shot from Incineroar. Choice Band provides a greater damage increase than Life Orb, allowing it to threaten an OHKO onto Gholdengo with Stomping Tantrum or Earthquake at the cost of being unable to switch between attacks. The item choice greatly affects Garchomp. Life Orb and Choice Band sets are subject to having its Attack dropped by Incineroar cycling Intimidate and Parting Shot, while the damage from Clear Amulet sets is less.
  • Tera Steel inverts Garchomp's weaknesses to Fairy-, Dragon-, and Ice-type attacks such as Moonblast from Clefable, Outrage from Dragonite, and Blizzard from Alolan Ninetales; additionally, it allows Garchomp to resist Choice Specs-boosted Tera Steel Make It Rain from Gholdengo. Tera Ground increases the damage of Stomping Tantrum and Earthquake, allowing Garchomp to OHKO Gholdengo. Tera Fire provides similar resistances as Tera Steel while not granting a weakness to Fighting-type attacks, and it provides an immunity to burn.

Gallade.comments:
Teambuilding

  • Gallade isn't a particularly bulky Pokemon, so it is often paired with partners more capable of setting up Trick Room while Gallade threatens foes that threaten its partners. Gallade also can be paired with redirection that allows it to set up Trick Room.
  • Hatterene pairs well with Gallade, as it is more capable of setting Trick Room up thanks to its bulk, while Gallade threatens foes such as Incineroar and Kingambit that Hatterene struggles to damage in return. Hatterene additionally threatens physically defensive foes that Gallade struggles to OHKO such as Amoonguss and provides powerful spread damage with Dazzling Gleam, which complements Gallade when it fails to achieve an OHKO. Indeedee-F provides redirection, allowing Gallade to safely set up Trick Room. It is additionally capable of setting up Trick Room itself while Gallade provides Wide Guard support. Indeedee-F setting up Psychic Terrain further supports Gallade by preventing Fake Out disruption and increasing the damage of Psycho Cut.
  • Amoonguss threatens to put Gallade to sleep with Spore, often forcing it to Terastallize into a Grass-type. A partner Torkoal threatens Amoonguss with Eruption and Weather Ball and outspeeds it while Trick Room is active. Gholdengo is difficult for Gallade to remove and threatens to deal significant damage with its STAB attacks. Torkoal and Ursaluna can survive Gholdengo's attacks and threaten it in return with Eruption and Headlong Rush. Basculegion-M threatens Gallade with its STAB attacks, so a partner Kingambit is capable of surviving these attacks and threatening it with Sucker Punch and Kowtow Cleave.

Strategy Comments

  • Gallade is a sweeper and a support Pokemon for Trick Room teams. It performs best early-game by removing threats preventing Trick Room from being set up or setting up Trick Room itself.
  • Gallade should always be led with a partner capable of setting Trick Room such as Hatterene or Indeedee-F. If paired with Hatterene, Gallade can be used to remove threats such as Kingambit and Incineroar. When facing Gholdengo, it can use Wide Guard to protect Hatterene from Make It Rain. If Gallade is paired with Indeedee-F, it can set Trick Room as Indeedee-F redirects attacks with Follow Me. However, there may be situations where Indeedee-F can be used to set up Trick Room itself while Gallade removes an opposing threat like Kingambit. Gallade can also use Wide Guard while Indeedee-F sets up Trick Room, protecting both Pokemon from attacks like Eruption from Hisuian Typhlosion.
  • Gallade is checked by Ghost-types and threatened by their attacks like Shadow Ball and Last Respects. As a result, Gallade is very reliant on redirection from Indeedee-F or switching to it if Indeedee-F is not lead. Gallade also relies on Kingambit to threaten them.
  • Foes with Imprison like Indeedee-M disrupt Trick Room teams and are often difficult for Gallade to remove, so it relies on partners like Ursaluna and Kingambit for this. If the opponent pivots around to stall out Trick Room turns, getting KOs while Trick Room is active becomes difficult for Gallade and its partners. To mitigate this, overwhelming the foes with powerful attacks from teammates like Ursaluna helps to reduce the effectiveness of the switches.

Offensive Trick Room Sweeper.description:
• Gallade is an offensive threat thanks to Sharpness and its ability to set Trick Room up for itself and its partners.
  • Sacred Sword ignores the Defense boosts of foes like Archaludon and Dondozo. Psycho Cut is used as a consistent Psychic-type STAB move that is also boosted by Sharpness. Its damage can be boosted further by a partner's Psychic Terrain. Wide Guard protects Gallade and its partner from spread attacks such as Make It Rain and Eruption.
  • Clear Amulet prevents Gallade's Attack from being hindered by Intimidate and Parting Shot, allowing it to always deal threatening damage to metagame staples such as Incineroar.
  • Tera Grass provides Gallade with an immunity to Spore, Sleep Powder, and Rage Powder while allowing it to resist Electro Shot from Archaludon. Tera Fire, unlike Tera Grass, removes Gallade's weakness to Flying-type attacks such as Hurricane from Pelipper without gaining a weakness to Poison-type attacks such as Dire Claw from Sneasler, and it also allows Gallade to resist Make It Rain from Gholdengo. Tera Fire additionally provides an immunity to burn.

Trick Room Abuser.description:
• Psycho Cut and Sacred Sword are the highest base power moves that take advantage of Sharpness.

  • The Defense EVs allow Gallade to survive a Wicked Blow and Surging Strikes from Urshifu-S and Urshifu-R, respectively.

  • Tera Grass allows Gallade to ignore powder moves from Amoonguss, a common Trick Room counter, and resist common physical attackers such as Rillaboom. Alternatively, Tera Fire can be used to resist common anti-Trick Room leads such as Chi-Yu and Flutter Mane, as well as giving Gallade a Fairy resist.

Heatran.overview:
• Heatran is a niche bulky offensive threat thanks to its solid stats and great typing, bolstered by Flash Fire. This makes Heatran have an incredible matchup against most of the metagame, such as Flutter Mane and Gholdengo.

  • Rillaboom is a great partner for Heatran, as it resists Heatran's prominent weaknesses, while also hitting Pokemon like Ogerpon-W and Urshifu-R for huge damage. Heatran also pairs well with Ogerpon-W, which supports Heatran with Follow Me, as well as threatening Urshifu-R and Landorus.

  • Although Heatran resists a lot of attacks with its typing, it's weak to both of the Urshifu formes, Ogerpon-W, Landorus, and Iron Hands. Heatran also faces tough Fire- and Steel- competition, especially with Incineroar.

Bulky Attacker.description:
• The combination of Heatran's STAB moves, Heat Wave and Flash Cannon, can hit a lot of Pokemon in the metagame super-effectively, while Earth Power is a good coverage move that can hit Pokemon that resist Heatran's STAB combination, like Incineroar. Magma Storm is also another option as a Fire-type attack, as it traps the opponent, which works well with Leftovers.

  • Leftovers is a good item choice for Heatran, as it can live two Shadow Balls from Flutter Mane with a Special Attack-Booster Energy, and with Rillaboom's Grassy Surge, Heatran can constantly restore HP. Life Orb can increase Heatran's damage output, making it more of a threat.

  • 228 HP, 84 Defense EVs, and 20 Special Defense EVs allow Heatran to take an Ivy Cudgel from Ogerpon-W, almost always survives a Sludge Bomb from Landorus after Heatran Terastallizes and Life Orb recoil, and finally, with 20 Speed EVs, Heatran outspeeds both Urshifu formes after a Speed drop.

  • Tera Grass is an excellent Tera type for Heatran, allowing it to resist Water- and Ground-type moves from the likes of Pokemon like Urshifu-R and Landorus. Tera Fairy can allow Heatran to resist Urshifu-S's STAB moves and be a neutral type against the metagame.

Cresselia.overview:
• Cresselia shines in VGC as an incredibly bulky Trick Room setter with access to Lunar Blessing. Cresselia is a great check to Amoonguss and Urshifu-R, nullifying Spore with Lunar Blessing and pressuring the latter with a 2HKO.

  • Cresselia's strongest partner is Ursaluna, as it's a strong Trick Room sweeper that appreciates Lunar Blessing negating the burn chip damage. Cresselia's Levitate also allows Ursaluna to freely click Earthquake. Cresselia also appreciates Pokemon like Amoonguss and Iron Hands, which help get up Trick Room and act as threats under Trick Room themselves.

  • Cresselia struggles against Incineroar, as Fake Out can allow Incineroar's partner to get off another hit, which can be the difference between setting up Trick Room and not. Cresselia also faces issues against Farigiraf, which can reverse or Imprison Trick Room. Tornadus can also prove to be difficult, as Taunt prevents Trick Room from going up and takes advantage of Cresselia's passivity.

Trick Room Support.description:
• Cresselia uses Moonblast to hit more of the metagame for super effective damage, including Urshifu-S, while Ice Beam can be used to threaten the Landorus formes and Dragonite. Cresselia may opt for Psychic for the extra power before Terastallization.

  • Helping Hand allows Cresselia to more actively support its partners, especially Ursaluna and its Earthquake. Cresselia can use Ally Switch to provide game-deciding mind games and a way to protect its partners in a pinch.

  • Cressellia uses Safety Goggles to protect itself from Amoonguss's Spore and be able to consistently protect its teammates with Lunar Blessing.

  • The EV spread allows Cresselia to almost always survive two Mystic Water Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R, and always avoid the 2HKO from Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast.

  • Tera Fairy is the most consistent for Cresselia, as it provides a resistance to the common Dark-type moves such as Urshifu-S's Wicked Blow or Kingambit's Kowtow Cleave, as well as gaining STAB on Moonblast. Tera Poison is a generally good defensive typing further bolstered by Levitate, and it provides key resistances to Flutter Mane's Moonblast and Rillaboom's STAB moves.

Covert Cloak.description:
Whimsicott is a potent Tailwind setter in the Regulation G metagame thanks to Prankster in conjunction with its good supporting movepool, and its typing lets it take on staples such as Raging Bolt and both Urshifu formes. Moonblast lets Whimsicott consistently damage bulky Pokemon such as the aforementioned Raging Bolt while also chipping down Rillaboom and Incineroar. It also lets Whimsicott take full advantage of its good matchup against both Urshifu formes, threatening Urshifu-R with a 2HKO and Urshifu-S with an OHKO once its Focus Sash is broken. Whimsicott's ability to punish passive play like Protect via Encore allows fast-paced teammates like Choice Specs Miraidon and Choice Scarf Chi-Yu to safely output huge damage. Encore also has other immensely useful applications like forcing non-Dark-type Fake Out users like Rillaboom and Iron Hands to switch out if they choose to use the move and reversing Trick Room in the face of threats such as Calyrex-I; this is crucial, as Tailwind teams inherently struggle against Trick Room, especially when they have multiple Pokemon weak to the aforementioned Calyrex-I. Light Screen helps bolster Whimsicott and its allies' bulk against threats such as Calyrex-S and Choice Specs Terapagos. Covert Cloak lets Whimsicott safely ignore Fake Out and set up Tailwind, allowing it to threaten with Encore on the following turn. The physical bulk investment allows Whimsicott to avoid an OHKO from -1 Zamazenta-C's Heavy Slam while never being 2HKOed by +1 Body Press. The special bulk investment enables Whimsicott to never be OHKOed by Choice Specs Tera Stellar Terapagos-S's Tera Starstorm and Mystic Water Kyogre's Water Spout in rain even at full power. Maximum Speed is run in order to let Whimsicott have the best chance to force opposing Whimsicott to repeatedly use Tailwind with Encore, which is an interaction that can also be put to use against the slower Tornadus. Tera Fire rids Whimsicott of its weakness to Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash and Incineroar's Flare Blitz among other powerful moves like Calyrex-I's Glacial Lance and Koraidon's sun-boosted Flare Blitz, crucially never getting 2HKOed by Glacial Lance. Alternatively, Tera Water lets it retain its initial resistance to Kyogre's Water Spout and Origin Pulse in addition to the resistances provided by Tera Fire in exchange for sacrificing the positive defensive matchup against Rillaboom and Raging Bolt. Tera Water also provides Whimsicott with a better matchup against Calyrex-I and Pelipper.

Whimsicott, being rather frail, is vulnerable to many relevant Pokemon, most notably Tornadus, as not only does it compete with Whimsicott as a Prankster Tailwind user on nearly every team apart from Miraidon hyper offense, but it also threatens an OHKO with Bleakwind Storm because Whimsicott lacks a Focus Sash. Thus, Miraidon makes for a good partner, as it can easily OHKO Tornadus. Whimsicott supports Choice Specs Miraidon exceptionally well, letting it dish out massive amounts of damage with Tera Electric uncontested under Tailwind. Encore punishes opposing Fake Out users, allowing Choice Specs Miraidon to stay on the field more safely. Whimsicott also helps Chi-Yu do great amounts of damage onto foes thanks to Tailwind and checks Raging Bolt for both it and Miraidon thanks to Beads of Ruin; this is of great value, as Miraidon is otherwise forced to lock into Draco Meteor. Whimsicott is susceptible to being removed by faster Pokemon like Calyrex-I under Trick Room and Chien-Pao, so you should be wise with managing its health and speed control. Iron Hands allows this to happen quite well, not only taking advantage of Trick Room with its low Speed but also heavily threatening Chien-Pao. Its good bulk, access to Fake Out, and healing from Drain Punch allow it to keep Whimsicott safe for multiple turns.

Focus Sash.description:
Whimsicott is an excellent Tailwind setter with a deep support movepool, mainly setting itself apart from Tornadus with its higher Speed, access to Encore and Helping Hand, and useful typing that gives it defensive utility against staples like Miraidon, Kyogre, Rillaboom, Raging Bolt, and both Urshifu formes. Moonblast provides a reliable STAB move that lets Whimsicott deal solid damage to common Fairy-weak Pokemon like Miraidon, Koraidon, Chien-Pao, and the Urshifu formes. Encore is Whimsicott's most infamous support option, letting it punish setup sweepers like Calm Mind Terapagos, IronPress Zamazenta-C, and Nasty Plot Calyrex-S for attempting to boost in front of it; the move also punishes foes from trying to stall out Tailwind turns with Protect, and it discourages Rillaboom from using Fake Out lest it be locked into it. Additionally, it forces Trick Room setters like Calyrex-I to untwist the dimensions. Taunt is a similarly useful disruption tool that can be used with or in place of Encore, notably allowing Whimsicott to deny Tailwind from other setters like Tornadus and Lunala unless they use Tera Dark. Protect helps Whimsicott keep itself on the field and stay in a position to use its other moves repeatedly, especially in the face of Fake Out users, but the last moveslot can also be spent on more aggressive options like Helping Hand, which is useful with any attacker, or Fake Tears, which is especially devastating alongside strong special threats like Chi-Yu. Whimsicott enjoys holding a Focus Sash to make up for its poor bulk, and Tera Ghost is useful to prevent the item from being wasted by Fake Out.

Whimsicott's reliable Tailwind support is a blessing to almost every Restricted Pokemon, especially those with middling Speed tiers such as Groudon and Terapagos, as well as Pokemon that want to be faster against opposing Tailwind teams such as Miraidon and Calyrex-S. All four of those Pokemon also benefit from Encore, which can create space for them to set up with Swords Dance, Nasty Plot, and Calm Mind. Clear Amulet Koraidon is another notable partner that reliably discourages opponents from bringing Incineroar, which is easily the worst Pokemon for Whimsicott to face in a battle. Other strong attackers that benefit from Tailwind support are also great with it; Landorus and Urshifu-S both fall into this category, and Chi-Yu is a standout example because it augments Whimsicott's modest damage output with Beads of Ruin. Other setup Pokemon that enjoy Encore are especially useful to justify using Whimsicott on a team over Tornadus, including Calm Mind Raging Bolt, Swords Dance Ogerpon-H, and Nasty Plot Gholdengo. It's important to make sure Whimsicott has teammates that can deal with problematic Dark-types like Chi-Yu, Ting-Lu, and Kingambit due to their Prankster immunity, and a Fighting-type like Urshifu-R or Iron Hands can help with that significantly.

Tailwind Support.description:
• Whimsicott is a staple on hyper offense teams due to its ability to set Tailwind with its Prankster ability. Whimsicott also provides valuable support to its team through the use of Encore to disrupt opposing strategies or Helping Hand and Sunny Day to boost its partner's damage output.
  • Encore is generally preferred to be able to pin opposing Pokemon into positions where they cannot use Protect, dissuade setup, and lock opposing Pokemon into moves such as Fake Out or Tailwind. Helping Hand is the preferred last move on Whimsicott for most teams because it provides a damage boost to any of Whimsicott's partners. Sunny Day is used on certain hyper offense teams to boost Hisuian Typhlosion's Eruption and provide weather control against Pelipper. Protect is almost always used on Focus Sash sets to block Fake Out without the need to Terastallize into a Ghost-type. Beat Up is specifically used with Annihilape to boost its Rage Fist; this, in conjunction with Tailwind, makes it into a threat as quickly as possible.
  • Covert Cloak is generally preferred on Whimsicott to block the effects of Fake Out, allowing Whimsicott to get Tailwind off without having to run Protect. However, Focus Sash is sometimes used on teams that want Whimsicott's support on the field for longer. Focus Sash also allows Whimsicott to set Tailwind in front of Talonflame, which would otherwise KO Whimsicott before it can set Tailwind with Brave Bird in conjunction with Gale Wings.
  • Tera Water can be used to give Covert Cloak Whimsicott an extra turn on the field against common Pokemon such as Incineroar, Hisuian Typhlosion, and Gholdengo, though it must watch out for Rillaboom's now supereffective priority Grassy Glide. Tera Ghost gives Whimsicott an immunity to common priority moves, namely Fake Out and Extreme Speed and is usually seen on Focus Sash sets, as they are susceptible to Fake Out. Tera Fire offers similar defensive benefits to Tera Water while still resisting Rillaboom's Grassy Glide after Terastallization. However, Tera Fire makes Whimsicott weak to common moves such a as Primarina's Liquid Voice Hyper Voice and Pelipper's Weather Ball under rain. Tera Dark is a niche option on Focus Sash sets that gives Whimsicott an immunity to opposing Prankster moves from the likes of Murkrow and opposing Whimsicott.
  • The first spread for Covert Cloak Whimsicott maximizes HP investment over damage output to live attacks that would otherwise prevent it from setting Tailwind. Focus Sash sets, on the other hand, invest more into Special Attack.

Sun Setter.description:
• Moonblast keeps Whimsicott from being passive and hits threats like Raging Bolt and Urshifu-S for super effective damage.

  • Whimsicott can opt for Beat Up instead, allowing it to trigger Annihilape's Rage Fist and Terrakion's Justified ability.

  • Sunny Day activates Pokemon like Flutter Mane and Raging Bolts's abilities, making them more potent threats, as well as weakening Urshifu-R and Ogerpon-W.

  • The fourth move slot is customizable; Fake Tears allows Whimsicott to weaken Pokemon for partners like Flutter Mane and Landorus, Encore locks foes into unfavorable moves like Protect and Fake Out, Taunt helps shut down more passive Pokemon like Amoonguss and opposing Whimsicott.

  • The EV spread allows Whimsicott to live Tornadus's Bleakwind Storm and outspeed Maximum Speed Tornadus.

  • Tera Water grants Whimsicott valuable resistances to Fire-, Ice-, and Steel-types like Incineroar, Chien-Pao, and Kingambit while generally being a great defensive typing.

  • Covert Cloak allows Whimsicott to be immune to Fake Out.

Offensive Utility.description:
• Protect is valuable for dealing with Fake Out, but it does not allow fitting Sunny Day.

  • Tera Ghost makes Whimsicott immune to common priority moves like Fake Out and Extreme Speed as well as providing a resistance to Poison-type moves like Landorus' Sludge Bomb.

  • Focus Sash allows Whimsicott to have another chance to set up Tailwind or support its team later on in the game, as its mediocre defensive stats and plethora of weaknesses otherwise leave it potentially OHKOd by most Pokemon in the metagame.

  • Note that if Whimsicott is running Beat Up, an EV spread of 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 Spe with a Jolly Nature is more optimal.

Supportive Trapper.description:
Gothitelle's Shadow Tag and vast supportive movepool provide it with a unique niche in Regulation G, allowing its partners to take full advantage of lead matchups. Gothitelle utilizes Foul Play as its offensive move to threaten the Calyrex formes. Taunt helps Gothitelle trap and shut down support Pokemon like Amoonguss and Clefairy. Helping Hand can make up for Gothitelle's lack of offensive pressure; however, Protect can be used instead on Safety Goggles sets to protect against Fake Out. Covert Cloak protects Gothitelle from Fake Out, while Safety Goggles allows Gothitelle to ignore Spore and Rage Power from Amoonguss. The EV spread lets Gothitelle survive Flutter Mane's Choice Specs Shadow Ball and Adamant Koraidon's Flare Blitz, as well as avoid the 2HKO from Choice Specs Tera Starstorm from Terapagos-S. Tera Dark is used to grant Gothitelle a resistance to Calyrex-S's Astral Barrage, Incineroar's Knock Off, and Chi-Yu's Dark Pulse, as well as an immunity to Prankster Taunt from Tornadus. Tera Dark also boosts Foul Play, allowing Gothitelle to threaten an OHKO on Calyrex-S and +1 Attack Calyrex-I.

Gothitelle partners especially well with hyper offensive teams, as Shadow Tag makes it easier to remove crucial pieces from the opponent's team. This is especially prevalent with Koraidon, as Gothitelle prevents Pelipper from switching in and significantly weakening Koraidon. Gothitelle trapping Pokemon that struggle to threaten Koraidon like the Ogerpon formes also allows Koraidon to set up for a sweep through Flame Charge. Choice Specs Terapagos also appreciates Gothitelle, as Gothitelle can trap the opponent's Fake Out user and Taunt Amoonguss, minimizing issues for Terapagos throughout the game. Gothitelle can also utilize its own Fake Out to help Terapagos remove Urshifu-R, which is otherwise problematic. Raging Bolt can pick off Pokemon with Thunderclap and shut down special attackers with Snarl significantly easier thanks to Gothitelle's trapping. Gothitelle struggles with Flutter Mane and Pokemon that can pivot like Rillaboom and Incineroar, as it can't trap them and does minimal damage with Foul Play. The aforementioned Koraidon can remove all of these checks reliably.

Bulky Support.description:
Amoonguss's great typing, access to Regenerator, and excellent toolkit allow it to function as a top-notch support Pokemon with the ability to check and, with Spore, shut down Raging Bolt, Urshifu-R, and Zamazenta-C throughout the game. Amoonguss uses Pollen Puff to heal its teammates, providing its team the upper hand in longer games. However, Sludge Bomb can be used instead of Pollen Puff or Protect to 2HKO the Ogerpon formes that can redirect Spore. Amoonguss uses Rocky Helmet to better answer Urshifu-R and break Focus Sash on Mienshao, Chien-Pao, and Urshifu-S. Amoonguss can opt for Covert Cloak to obtain a Fake Out immunity. Mental Herb can be used instead to protect against Taunt from Tornadus and Incineroar. Sitrus Berry can also be used for burst healing, allowing Amoonguss to avoid the 2HKO from Tornadus's Bleakwind Storm. The EV spread with a Bold nature allows Amoonguss to survive Adamant Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash and, with Sitrus Berry, avoid the 2HKO from Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball. A Calm nature lets Amoonguss avoid the 2HKO from Calyrex-S's Astral Barrage and survive Chien-Pao's Ice Spinner. 27 Speed IVs make Amoonguss slower than Calyrex-I, so it can use Spore before Calyrex-I moves under Trick Room. Amoonguss prefers Tera Fairy to check Miraidon and have a neutral matchup against the majority of the metagame. Tera Water is to answer Koraidon and Calyrex-I while keeping the resistance to Water. This is good because it allows Amoonguss to take on common duos like Chien-Pao + Urshifu-R. Tera Dark can be used to resist Calyrex-S's Astral Barrage and gain an immunity to Tornadus's Prankster Taunt.

Amoonguss struggles against Pokemon that ignore Spore and Rage Powder such as Rillaboom, Ogerpon-H, Safety Goggles Incineroar, and Tera Grass Calyrex-I. This makes Incineroar a great partner, as it can threaten the Grass-types and use Knock Off to remove opposing Safety Goggles. Pelipper helps Amoonguss with rain and Wide Guard, protecting it from Calyrex-I's Glacial Lance. Pelipper can also use Hurricane and Weather Ball to pressure the aforementioned Amoonguss checks. Amoonguss can help Incineroar and Pelipper by redirecting Urshifu-R's and Raging Bolt's threatening STAB moves, respectively.

Offensive Utility.description:
Mienshao is a fast Pokemon with a good support movepool that matches up well into Incineroar, since it is immune to Fake Out and Intimidate. Mienshao can use Fake Out on or OHKO Incineroar with Close Combat before it moves. Feint breaks opposing Wide Guard and Protect, enabling its partner to attack freely while breaking Focus Sashes or KOing opponents brought down to their Focus Sash. Wide Guard protects Mienshao and its partner from common powerful spread moves such as Astral Barrage, Glacial Lance, and Tera Starstorm and spread stat-reducing attacks such as Snarl and Icy Wind. Mienshao uses Focus Sash for extra longevity, allowing it to continue to support its partners. A Jolly nature lets Mienshao outrun Chi-Yu, while an Adamant nature gives Mienshao a high chance to OHKO uninvested Ursaluna-B. Tera Fighting allows Mienshao to guarantee an OHKO onto Ursaluna-B and Choice Specs Terapagos-S and a 2HKO on Zamazenta-C before it Terastallizes.

Mienshao struggles into Ghost-types such as Calyrex-S, Flutter Mane, and Lunala, since it is unable to damage them. This makes Calyrex-S and Chi-Yu great partners, as they can threaten them with their STAB Astral Barrage and Dark Pulse, respectively, with Calyrex-S outspeeding them and Chi-Yu withstanding their attacks. Calyrex-S and Chi-Yu, in return, appreciate Mienshao's support, with Fake Out allowing Calyrex-S to set up Nasty Plot and Feint breaking opposing Wide Guard and Protect, allowing both to freely attack. Mienshao's Wide Guard protects Calyrex-S from opposing Astral Barrage and Tera Starstorm and protects Chi-Yu from Water Spout, Origin Pulse, and Precipice Blades. Mienshao further supports Calyrex-S and Chi-Yu by matching up well against threats such as Incineroar and Terapagos. This, in turn, lets Calyrex-S's other common partners like Clefairy and Rillaboom support Calyrex-S more effectively.

Hydreigon.comments:
Teambuilding

  • Hydreigon is fast and offensive, so it works best on offensive teams. It appreciates having physical attackers next to it that can break down the special walls that Hydreigon struggles to break through, like Tyranitar and Sylveon. Hydreigon also enjoys having Tailwind and redirection support; Tailwind lets Hydreigon outspeed key threats like Dragapult, and redirection moves keep away threats like a Moonblast from Primarina. Choice Specs sets work even better with hyper-offensive playstyles due to the immense damage it can output.

  • Hydreigon appreciates Clefable, as it can support Hydreigon with Follow Me, absorbing dangerous Fairy-, Fighting-, and Dragon-type attacks like Moonblast, Outrage, and Close Combat. Hydreigon works well with powerful Ground-type attackers such as Garchomp and Ursaluna that can hit the Pokemon that Hydreigon cannot such as Archaludon with Earthquake, which Hydreigon is unaffected by. It also enjoys the presence of Gholdengo, which can switch in against status moves or Fake Out and threaten Fairy-types. Tailwind support from Talonflame or Whimsicott is also favored by Hydreigon for boosting Speed.

  • Hydreigon's main weakness is its inability to outspeed faster Dragon-types without Tailwind and its dangerous 4x weakness to Fairy. It also has a hard time hitting special walls like Tyranitar and Primarina. To mitigate this, it's important to have strong physical attackers on the team like Garchomp and Annihilape that can quickly empty the opposing team of special walls; to deal with faster Dragon-types, a Tailwind setter like Murkrow is necessary, and a Steel-type like Gholdengo will quickly rid the opposing team of Fairy-types.

Strategy Comments

  • Hydreigon fulfills its main role on teams as a damage dealer through its great stats and typing. It absolutely shines the most during the early-game, when it can spread heavy damage, then switch out and clean up other pieces late-game.

  • Hydreigon is best used when the opposing team no longer has any healthy special walls so that it can use its respectable Special Attack to pick off everything else.

  • Hydreigon has its biggest problems against Pokémon that hard check and threaten it, such as Primarina and Archaludon. It's best to position your team to where these walls are either gone or heavily damaged before sending Hydreigon out to deal with them. Redirection from Clefable is also very appreciated to allow Hydreigon to spread damage uncontested.

Glass Cannon.description:
• Hydreigon uses its high Special Attack stat and good Speed stat to make it one of the faster and stronger threats in the current metagame. With its good offensive typing, Hydreigon ends up being a large threat to much of the metagame, such as Gholdengo and Garchomp.

  • Heat Wave provides Hydreigon with coverage against Kingambit, Rillaboom, and Tera Steel Gholdengo. Snarl gives Hydreigon a STAB option that lowers damage from foes like Archaludon.

  • Life Orb allows Hydreigon to use Protect and switch moves, whereas Choice Specs makes way for more damage but is less flexible. For instance, Choice Specs guarantees an OHKO on Ursaluna-B with a Draco Meteor, but Life Orb only guarantees a 2HKO.

  • Tera Poison and Tera Fire pair extremely well with Hydreigon due to both of them flipping some of Hydreigon's weaknesses into resistances. Tera Fire synergizes well with Heat Wave, providing a damage boost and letting Hydreigon resist Make It Rain's from Gholdengo; meanwhile, Tera Poison completely walls out Sneasler. Both options benefit from Levitate, negating the Ground weakness and making the Ursaluna formes and Garchomp less threatening.

Quiver Dance.description:
Quiver Dance Volcarona is a very interesting Pokemon in Regulation G because of its amazing setup potential, good bulk, and respectable damage after Quiver Dance. Volcarona does well against Zamazenta-C and Calyrex-I, since it can 2HKO both of them with Flamethrower. The Special Defense investment allows Volcarona to almost always survive a Life Orb Blood Moon from Ursaluna-B and three non-Terastallized Choice Specs Moonblasts from Flutter Mane. The Speed investment allows it to outspeed Pokemon with base 135 Speed after a Quiver Dance, and a Timid nature lets Volcarona outspeed Calyrex-S after one Quiver Dance as well. 92 Defense EVs allow it to survive 2 Icicle Crashes from Chien-Pao and two Behemoth Blades from Zacian-C after Leftovers recovery. Flame Body is a great ability, as being able to burn an opposing Pokemon is very valuable in case you are facing down Pokemon such as Urshifu-R and Zamazenta-C. Volcarona loves to run Tera Dragon to give it helpful resistances to Water- and Electric-type moves such as Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R and Electro Drift from Miraidon.

Volcarona can, however, have some tough matchups. Kyogre specifically is a horrible matchup for it, as Water Spout is a guaranteed OHKO against a Volcarona that is not Terastallized. Both Kyogre and Pelipper can dampen Volcarona's damage output as well, forcing it to rely on Bug Buzz, which does not threaten Kyogre or Pelipper in the slightest. Koraidon and the Ogerpon formes can all do massive damage to it as well. The aforementioned Urshifu-R is also a check to Volcarona, since it can OHKO Volcarona that is not Terastallized with Surging Strikes. Pelipper and Tornadus are also threats since they can hit Volcarona for super effective damage with their STAB moves. A lot of these bad matchups are why it is so important to run Miraidon next to Volcarona, as Miraidon can OHKO the aforementioned checks. Incineroar, Rillaboom, and Iron Hands can all help with setting up Quiver Dance with Fake Out, and Whimsicott can help set up Quiver Dance with Encore or provide speed control with Tailwind in case Quiver Dance isn’t the best option in the current game state.

Bulky Support.description:
Volcarona can be used as an effective support Pokemon that is capable of redirecting attacks for its partners and weakening opponents. Volcarona matches up well into powerful special attackers such as Terapagos, Raging Bolt, and Ursaluna-B, as it can lower their Special Attack with Struggle Bug. Volcarona also has great matchups into physical threats such as Calyrex-I, Zacian-C, and Zamazenta-C, as it is capable of surviving their attacks and crippling them with a burn with Flame Body or Will-O-Wisp. Overheat is used to deal significant damage to Calyrex-I and Zacian-C, while Flamethrower is used for more consistent damage. Bug Buzz can be a great alternative when Volcarona is paired with Kyogre to deal consistent, unhindered damage to Grass-types threatening Kyogre such as Rillaboom, as well as allowing it to damage Incineroar, Farigiraf, and Raging Bolt sufficiently. Safety Goggles provides Volcarona with immunity to opposing Rage Powder and Spore, while Covert Cloak is used to gain immunity from Fake Out flinching, allowing it to continue supporting its teammates unhindered. Rocky Helmet synergizes with Volcarona's redirection by dealing chip damage, allowing it to break Focus Sash or KO Pokemon brought down to 1 HP with Focus Sash. This is especially effective against Urshifu-R after Volcarona Terastallizes, with Rocky Helmet and Flame Body working in tandem to deal significant damage and burn Urshifu-R, punishing Surging Strikes. The defensive investment allows Volcarona to frequently survive Flare Blitz from Koraidon and makes High Horsepower from Calyrex-I and Behemoth Blade from Zacian-C only 3HKO, while the Speed investment allows Volcarona to outrun Smeargle. Tera Water offers resistance to Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R and Water Spout from Kyogre as well as a resistance to Flare Blitz from Koraidon, while Tera Grass provides an immunity to Spore and Rage Powder while also resisting the aforementioned Water-type attacks.

Volcarona pairs well with Terapagos, as Volcarona can burn the Fighting-types that threaten Terapagos such as Urshifu-R, Iron Hands, and Zamazenta-C and redirect attacks, allowing Terapagos to set up with Calm Mind. Volcarona struggles against Water-types like Urshifu-R and Kyogre as well as Flying-types like Tornadus and Pelipper, as it cannot damage them sufficiently and is threatened by their STAB attacks. As a result, Rillaboom is a great partner, as it can threaten these Water-types as well as provide Grassy Terrain recovery, boosting Volcarona's longevity. Volcarona also struggles against Fire-types and Pokemon that usually utilize Tera Fire such as Incineroar and Koraidon, as it can neither burn nor deal significant damage to them. Urshifu-R and Kyogre therefore pair well with Volcarona, both of which threaten Incineroar and Koraidon with their STAB Water-type attacks; Kyogre also overrides Koraidon's sun with its own rain, further hindering Koraidon. In return, Volcarona threatens checks to the aforementioned Water-types such as Rillaboom and Raging Bolt, as it can burn Rillaboom with Will-O-Wisp or through Flame Body and redirect Raging Bolt's Electric STABs with Rage Powder.

Bulky Setup Sweeper.description:
• Volcarona utilizes the bulk, power, and Speed granted by Quiver Dance; its useful coverage; and Terastallization, which lets it work its way around its checks, to become difficult to take down and take over games as a result.
  • Tera Blast Fairy lets Volcarona defeat Dragon-types that can stand up to Heat Wave; Giga Drain hits Water- and Rock-types while providing additional recovery to let Volcarona stay on the field longer. Tera Blast is used only on Tera Fairy sets, whereas Giga Drain sees play on Tera Grass and Tera Dragon sets.
  • Covert Cloak lets Volcarona ignore Fake Out to set up or throw out its attacks more freely, and it prevents Snarl, Icy Wind, and Dire Claw from impeding its sweep. Leftovers gives Volcarona passive recovery, augmenting the recovery that Giga Drain provides to be at higher HP to survive more attacks.
  • Tera Fairy lets Volcarona bypass Dragon-type attacks like Dragapult's Dragon Darts and Dragonite's Scale Shot and maintain a resistance to Fighting-type attacks like Sneasler's Close Combat. Tera Grass gives Volcarona a resistance to Water- and Electric-type attacks like Basculegion's Wave Crash and Archaludon's Electro Shot, makes it immune to Amoonguss's Spore, and powers up Giga Drain, turning +1 Giga Drain from a 2HKO into an OHKO on Basculegion and doing the same with +2 Giga Drain for Primarina. This additionally lets it restore more HP in the process, making it more likely to sweep games. Tera Dragon gives Volcarona similar defensive benefits and doesn't make it weak to Pelipper's Hurricane, Sneasler's Dire Claw, and Fire-type attacks like Armarouge's Armor Cannon and Incineroar's Flare Blitz, though it becomes weak to Dragon-type attacks like Dragapult's Dragon Darts and Dondozo's Order Up.
  • 180 Speed EVs and a Timid nature ensure that Volcarona will outspeed Annihilape, as well as other mid-speed Pokemon like Gholdengo and Archaludon. With 164 Special Attack EVs, Tera Blast Fairy will OHKO offensive Dragapult, as well as maximum HP Annihilape after a Quiver Dance. The bulk investment ensures that Volcarona survives a Tera Normal Blood Moon from Life Orb Ursaluna-B after a Quiver Dance and, after Terastallizing, two Rock Slides from Tyranitar if Leftovers or Rillaboom's Grassy Terrain are in play to neutralize sandstorm damage.
  • Alternatively, Volcarona can lean into its bulk with maximum HP investment, which can benefit from the recovery offered by Giga Drain. After the aforementioned Speed investment to outspeed Annihilape, the rest of the EVs are put into Defense, letting Volcarona survive physical priority moves like Black Glasses Kingambit's Tera Dark Sucker Punch and Choice Band Dragonite's Tera Normal Extreme Speed. Even with minimal Special Defense investment, Volcarona has enough special bulk to survive Pelipper's Hurricane; after a Quiver Dance, it will take a Blood Moon from Tera Normal Life Orb Ursaluna-B or a Choice Scarf Tera Fire Overheat from Hisuian Typhlosion in sun, assuming it hasn't Terastallized into a Grass-type.

Tailwind Support.description:
Tornadus is used as a support Pokemon that can set Tailwind for its team and deal semi-consistent damage with Bleakwind Storm. It is very good into Grass-types such as Amoonguss and Rillaboom, as Tornadus can easily use Taunt or threaten them with Bleakwind Storm. Tornadus can make use of its weather-setting abilities to help itself hit Bleakwind Storms or support its teammates by boosting or reducing the damage of Water- or Fire-type moves. Icy Wind provides a secondary form of speed control for Tornadus and helps against other Tailwind-based teams. Protect can also help against Fake Out if it holds Rocky Helmet. Covert Cloak allows Tornadus to shine as a supportive piece, as it stops it from being flinched by the common Fake Out. It also prevents it from having its Special Attack lowered by Snarl. Rocky Helmet acts more as a repellent for attacks like Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes and Chien-Pao's Ice Spinner. It also can make Pokemon more wary of using Fake Out, as they will be constantly taking chip damage. The EV spread on this Tornadus allows it to take a Tera Water Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R. This can be really impactful on the Rocky Helmet set, as it forces Urshifu-R down to 50% of its health upon hitting it. It can also take an Astral Barrage from Choice Specs Calyrex-S. Tera Dark is mainly used to stop other Tornadus from using Taunt or Whimsicott from using Encore on it. It can also be used as a defensive Tera against Calyrex-S, as it resists or is immune to both of its STAB attacks. Tera Steel can be used to resist attacks from Pokemon such as Chien-Pao and the occasional Rock-type. It also removes a weakness to Electric, which can make it fare better against Raging Bolt.

Tornadus is a good partner for many Pokemon thanks to its ability to support them through speed control and weather. One example of this is Chi-Yu, which makes use of Tornadus's ability to set sun and Tailwind to blast through opposing teams. Chi-Yu also helps Tornadus's Bleakwind Storms do more damage. Kyogre is another good partner, as Tornadus allows it to outspeed non-Tailwind teams with its below average Speed stat. Tornadus can also help to stop other weather teams from outdamaging Kyogre while letting Kyogre deal with opposing weather attackers. Tornadus benefits other Pokemon with its weather as well such as Urshifu-R, Koraidon and Archaludon. It can also provide a check to weather-setting Pokemon like Koraidon and Groudon with opposing weather. Checks to Tornadus include Miraidon and Raging Bolt. Their ability to resist its attacks and fire back with powerful Electric-type STAB moves can threaten both Tornadus and its common partners. One other check is Kingambit. Often, Tornadus cannot attack with Bleakwind Storm due to the threat of Defiant being activated. It can easily set up in front of Tornadus or, if it has Assault Vest, threaten its partner. Landorus, however, can help to beat some of these checks with strong Sandsear Storms in Rain while being immune to Miraidon's and Raging Bolt's Electric-type STAB moves. Trick Room teams are also a bad matchup, as they flip the Speed stats and make Tailwind useless. Calyrex-I is especially tough for Tornadus, as it can target it down with strong Glacial Lances or set Trick Room right in front of it.

Bulky Tailwind.description:
• Bleakwind Storm provides good damage into Rillaboom and Ogerpon-W. Tailwind is the most effective speed control Tornadus has access to. Taunt helps shut down Amoonguss and helps to manage certain Trick Room Pokemon like Porygon2 and Dusclops, but Protect can be run instead to ensure Tailwind goes up. Rain Dance and Sunny Day serve as weather control, which enables your sweepers and disables opposing weather-based sweepers. Rain Dance pairs well with Urshifu-R and Ogerpon-W while Sunny Day powers up Chi-Yu and Flutter Mane.

  • This given EV spread focuses on bulk, surviving Mystic Water Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R and Tera Fairy Choice Specs Moonblast from Flutter Mane. The low Speed investment ensures that Tornadus sets up its own weather.

  • Rocky Helmet helps against Urshifu-R mirrors and provides good chip into opposing physical attackers making contact. Covert Cloak prevents Fake Out flinches from Incineroar and Rillaboom. It also negates any secondary effects from moves like Rock Slide and Icy Wind. This ensures that Tailwind goes up. Mental Herb helps to shrug off one Taunt.

  • Tera Dark provides an immunity to Prankster Taunt, guaranteeing Tailwind. Tera Steel provides useful resistance to Chien-Pao and Flutter Mane's STAB moves. Both Tera types improve matchups into Psyspam and against Electric-type moves from Pokemon like Raging Bolt, Iron Hands and Archaludon.

Offensive Tailwind.description:
• Focus Sash ensures Tornadus survives one attack and set up Tailwind. Protect becomes important to avoid Fake Out without committing the Tera early.

  • Tornadus rarely Terastallizes, but Tera Ghost can ensure that it can more reliably set up Tailwind by negating Fake Out from Pokemon like Incineroar and Rillaboom, and Extreme Speed from Pokemon like Dragonite and Entei. Tera Flying increases its offensive pressure.

Support.description:
Thundurus is a good support Pokemon that is capable of disrupting teams like few other Pokemon can. Eerie Impulse can slow down powerful special attackers more effectively than other forms of damage control like Snarl or Vessel of Ruin, which means that Thundurus can completely neutralize the likes of Calyrex-S, Terapagos, Ursaluna-B, and Miraidon. Thunder Wave is a form of speed control that, unlike Tailwind, can generate free turns for Thundurus and its teammates. Taunt shuts down support Pokemon such as Amoonguss, preventing them from messing with Thundurus's team. Rain Dance allows Thundurus to both disrupt sun teams dependent on weather from Groudon or Koraidon and power up its teammate's Water-type attacks. Covert Cloak prevents Thundurus from being stopped by Fake Out from the likes of Incineroar and Rillaboom, so it does not fear them on the first turn and can use its support moves unperturbed. With 252 HP EVs, 156 Defense EVs, and a Bold nature, Thundurus will be able to take Tera Water Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R or a sun- and Orichalchum Pulse-boosted Flare Blitz from Koraidon, giving it just enough survivability to get off a final support move. 92 Special Defense EVs still give it room to survive many powerful special attacks, including Choice Specs Calyrex-S's Astral Barrage and Choice Specs Beads of Ruin Terapagos-S's Tera Starstorm. Tera Dark gives Thundurus an immunity to Prankster, letting it still get off its support options in the face of faster Prankster Tornadus and Whimsicott. It also gives it a resistance to Calyrex-S's STAB moves, letting it take a move in a pinch.

Unlike Tornadus, Thundurus's form of speed control is both less useful and easier to stop; Thunder Wave can only affect the relative Speed of a single Pokemon on the field, whereas Tailwind will affect both Pokemon. What's more, Dark-, Ground-, and Electric-types, such as Chi-Yu, Landorus, and Miraidon, are completely immune to Thundurus's Thunder Wave, so they can threaten it and its team easily. Chien-Pao deserves a special mention, as it ignores Thunder Wave and threatens Thundurus with an OHKO. Fighting-types like Zamazenta-C and Urshifu-R are great partners for Thundurus because they deal with Dark-types very effectively. Zamazenta-C is able to boost its physical bulk with Iron Defense and benefits from Thundurus reducing the special damage from their foes, making it difficult to bring down. Urshifu-R appreciates the fact that Thundurus can summon rain to boost the power of Surging Strikes. Both appreciate Taunt, which shuts down Amoonguss. Rillaboom is a common partner to assist Thundurus in shutting down Miraidon by replacing the Terrain; it also deals with Ground- and Electric-types that irritate Thundurus by resisting their attacks and threatening them in return with its strong STAB moves and High Horsepower, respectively. Indeedee-F and Farigiraf have the ability to block Prankster support moves, so a Dark-type that scares them away is appreciated; Incineroar and Chien-Pao are common choices for such a role. Calyrex-S is also a solid partner for Thundurus, as it appreciates Thundurus's speed control and damage control, the ability to shut down sun teams with Rain Dance, and the fact that Thundurus answers Amoonguss with Taunt. Eerie Impulse is generally helpful against Terapagos-S, which can give Calyrex-S issues. Though both Calyrex-S and Thundurus dislike Dark-types, Calyrex-S can Terastallize Fairy and use Draining Kiss to improve the matchup. Thundurus's Thunderbolt also doesn't do a lot of damage, so foes can ignore it completely if it is unable to utilize its support moves.

Life Orb.description:
Landorus is one of the strongest Pokemon in the metagame thanks to its access to strong Ground-type STAB moves in Earth Power and Sandsear Storm, which are further boosted by its ability, Sheer Force. In conjunction with Life Orb, Landorus can OHKO top metagame Pokemon like Incineroar, Zacian-C and Kingambit. Sludge Bomb allows Landorus to OHKO Ogerpon-H while threatening huge damage to Assault Vest Rillaboom and Ogerpon-W. Substitute allows Landorus to stay on the field longer and avoid Amoonguss's Spore, which allows it to deal continuous damage. Tera Poison allows Landorus to OHKO Ogerpon-W with Sludge Bomb, while shedding weaknesses to common attacks like Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R and Ice Spinner from Chien-Pao; it also allows Landorus to deal great damage to common Tera Fairy users, like Raging Bolt and Flutter Mane. Tera Steel allows Landorus to resist Ice while also giving a neutrality against Water-type STAB moves from common Pokemon like Urshifu-R and Ogerpon-W. The EV spread allows it to survive Tera Water Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R while Terastallized and Moonblast from Choice Specs Flutter Mane. The investment in Special Attack allows it to OHKO uninvested Urshifu-R safely.

Landorus has a poor matchup against Chien-Pao, Calyrex-I, and Kyogre, which can all OHKO Landorus. It also struggles against Tailwind teams, which can remove it before it can deal significant damage. Once Terastallized, Ogerpon-W threatens huge damage on Landorus, while also taking reduced damage from Sludge Bomb. Kyogre sets up rain with Drizzle, allowing Landorus to spam Life-Orb boosted Sandsear Storm without any accuracy drawbacks. Tornadus sets up Tailwind, letting Landorus move before non-Tailwind teams. In return, Landorus threatens Raging Bolt, which generally threatens both Tornadus and Kyogre.

Choice Scarf.description:
Landorus is a strong special attacker that can threaten metagame staples such as Miraidon, Incineroar, Raging Bolt, and Zamazenta-C thanks to its good Speed tier, ability, and powerful STAB moves. Sandsear Storm is a spread option but is less consistent than Earth Power. Sludge Bomb hits Grass-types such as Rillaboom and Fairy-type Pokemon like Flutter Mane and Tera-Fairy Calyrex-S, while U-turn allows Landorus to pivot out of a bad position. Choice Scarf allows it to outspeed most Pokemon, such as Miraidon, Chien-Pao, Calyrex-S, and Zamazenta-C. A Timid nature can be opted for to outspeed Choice Scarf Urshifu-R and Chi-Yu, even if they have a Speed-boosting nature, while a Modest nature allows Landorus to further boost its damage output. Tera Ground allows Earth Power to pick up OHKOs on bulkier Pokemon such as Zamazenta-C and Zacian-C.

Chien-Pao, Flutter Mane, and Calyrex-I are common Pokemon that threaten Landorus. Chien-Pao threatens an OHKO with Ice Spinner or Icicle Crash, Flutter Mane can nullify its Choice Scarf Speed boost with Icy Wind while doing a lot of damage, and Calyrex-I OHKOes Landorus with Glacial Lance and can set up Trick Room. Kyogre, especially with Assault Vest, can soak up hits from Landorus and threaten to OHKO it with Water-type attacks such as Origin Pulse and Water Spout. Rillaboom is a good partner for Landorus because of its positive matchup against Flutter Mane and Kyogre, with Wood Hammer OHKOing them. Kyogre helps against Chien-Pao, Flutter Mane, and Calyrex-I, as it can easily take their attacks while responding with tons of damage with its STAB moves while also setting up rain for Sandsear Storm. Both Rillaboom and Kyogre appreciate Landorus being a check to Pokemon that threaten them, such as Chi-Yu and Miraidon, respectively. Raging Bolt is a great counter to Kyogre, because of its natural typing and ability to threaten it with Thunderclap and Thunderbolt. Tornadus can set up Tailwind for Landorus to further bolster its Speed, use Rain Dance to boost Sandsear Storm's accuracy, and has a spread move in Bleakwind Storm that hits Grass-types such as Rillaboom and Amoonguss that benefits from rain.

Landorus-Therian.overview:
• A great STAB combination, a sky-high Attack stat, and Intimidate allow Landorus-T to function well in many different roles. These make it a great Choice Band sweeper, threatening many common metagame threats such as Raging Bolt and Flutter Mane. Landorus-T can also function as a Intimidate pivoter, using its great STAB combination and movepool to provide utility.

  • More offensive Landorus-T sets appreciate speed control support from Tornadus and Icy Wind Flutter Mane, with the former being more consistent by providing Tailwind support and hitting the Grass-types that resist Ground such as Rillaboom, while the latter has excellent offensive synergy. Redirection support from Ogerpon-W and Amoonguss is also appreciated, with both benefiting from Intimidate and Ogerpon-W specifically handling the Ice- and Water-types that give Landorus-T trouble. Choice Scarf Landorus-T partners well with all of the above options; however, it doesn't rely on speed control compared to Choice Band variants.

  • Rillaboom and Ogerpon-W are difficult for Landorus-T to handle, with the former having Fake Out. which is even more potent because Landorus-T almost exclusively runs Choice items, and halving the damage of Earthquake, while the latter has super effective Water-type STAB moves and a way to redirect its Stomping Tantrum; both of these also resist Ground. Incineroar is also an issue, as even though it's weak to Ground, Intimidate and Parting Shot let it constantly debuff Landorus-T, removing the its potential to OHKO many Pokemon. Landorus-T also finds itself difficult to slot into many teams, as each of its individual strong points are better found in other options, such as Incineroar generally being a strong Intimidate pivot and the other Landorus forme being a better offensive threat.

Offensive Sweeper.description:
• Stomping Tantrum is the best single target Ground-type move available, while Earthquake is used to dish out damage to more foes and bypass Follow Me. Rock Slide hits the Flying-types that are immune to Ground, while U-turn is a strong pivot option that also hits Ground-resistant Grass-types, even having a chance to OHKO frailer Ogerpon formes.

  • Choice Band allows Landorus-T to function as a sweeper, partially negating the low Base Power of its Ground-type moves and giving it rolls to OHKO many prevalent threats such as Raging Bolt, Kingambit, and Flutter Mane.

  • The Defense investment allows Landorus-T to survive a Wicked Blow from Tera Dark Urshifu-S, Kowtow Cleave from a +1 Attack Black Glasses Kingambit, and Ivy Cudgel from Ogerpon-W. The Special Defense investment allows Landorus-T to survive a Moonblast from Choice Specs Flutter Mane. The Speed investment outspeeds Adamant Chien-Pao at -1, with the rest being put into Attack.

  • Tera Fairy is generally preferred for being a stronger neutral type into the current metagame. It also resists Sucker Punch from Kingambit, which threatens big damage thanks to its ability Defiant, and other Dark-type attackers, allowing it to wall Urshifu-S.

Damage Oriented Pivot.description:
• Stomping Tantrum is used as the strongest Ground-type move available, with Rock Slide being coverage for Flying-types and U-turn for general utility. Tera Blast Flying gives Landorus-T a Flying-type move, despite coming at a high cost, allowing it to hit the Grass-types that otherwise resist Stomping Tantrum, as well as generally having more flexibility in the matchups it can be brought to.

  • Choice Scarf gives Landorus-T the jump on many of its counters such as Chien-Pao and Ogerpon-W and helps it pivot more easily with U-turn.

  • The EV spread still survives Wicked Blow from Tera Dark Urshifu-S and Ivy Cudgel from Ogerpon-W, with the Attack investment guaranteeing an OHKO on Rillaboom with Tera Blast Flying.

  • Tera Flying is used to give Landorus-T a Flying-type STAB move with Tera Blast and remove its Water-type weakness.

Talonflame.comments:
Teambuilding

  • Talonflame is most common as the main supportive option on teams that aim to overwhelm the opponent and win quickly, such as hyper offense, where priority speed control in the form of Tailwind is especially valuable. Its most common partner by far is Choice Specs Gholdengo, which, when paired with Covert Cloak Talonflame, prevents Fake Out and makes it difficult to stop a turn one Tailwind + Tera Steel Make it Rain. This duo is also particularly strong with Dondozo and Commander Tatsugiri, softening up teams for Dondozo to clean up in the endgame.
  • Talonflame doesn't particularly need any partners to function well; it instead serves to complement its teammates.
  • Talonflame's main competition is Whimsicott, which doesn't have to worry about about losing access to priority moves thanks to Prankster, as well as having better enabling tools such as Sunny Day for Hisuian Typhlosion and Delphox and Beat Up for Annihilape. Talonflame has more general utility tools with Will-O-Wisp and non-Prankster Taunt, is faster, and can OHKO it first with priority Brave Bird, but it generally isn't as support-oriented as Whimsicott.

Strategy Comments

  • Talonflame's biggest strength is immediate turn one pressure. Take advantage of that. You generally always want to be leading Talonflame and setting up Tailwind; going for an attack is risky before Tailwind is up, as you lose Gale Wings and a significant chunk of Talonflame's health. Once Tailwind is up, sacrificing it for a free switch is usually the play. If you have the opportunity for a safe switch, however, take it, as Talonflame's coverage and Speed makes it a great late-game cleaner.
  • The only real reason to use Talonflame over Whimsicott is coverage and damage, functioning almost like a glass cannon with access to priority Tailwind. Flying- and Fire-type coverage is excellent into the metagame, and its Speed means it's always a credible threat. Go for damage whenever possible after setting up Tailwind.
  • The best way to handle Talonflame is to nullify either its damage or priority speed control. Pokemon with Intimidate severely hamper Talonflame's offensive pressure, and even Pokemon like Electabuzz and Primarina that can eat one of its attacks and return back for strong damage are difficult matchups. Alternatively, nullifying its priority or Speed advantage also works well. Priority attacks like Fake Out and Extreme Speed break Gale Wings, with the former often completely preventing Tailwind from being set up on non-Covert Cloak sets. Priority blocking abilities like both Indeedee's Psychic Surge are difficult but not common. Incineroar is likely the biggest pain spot for Talonflame teams, as it walls Gholdengo, can break Gale Wings with Fake Out, and has Intimidate to cripple Talonflame offensively.
