*Draco Meteor allows Regidrago to pick OHKOs when Dragon Energy isn't dealing much damage at low HP, and Earth Power allows it to damage to Steel types like Gholdengo and Kingambit.

*Regidrago boosts its damage output with Dragon Fang that stacks on Dragon Maw and does insane damage.

*Tera Steel is a great defensive Tera that allows it to resist its original weaknesses.

Bulky Trick Room Sweeper.description:
Calyrex-I utilizes its high bulk and Attack, combined with its spread move Glacial Lance, to be a strong bulky attacker. Calyrex-I can spiral out of control quickly thanks to Chilling Neigh Attack boosts, while its access to Trick Room and low Speed stat allow it to operate as both a Trick Room setter and sweeper. Calyrex-I runs High Horsepower for coverage, letting it hit Fire- and Steel-types that resist Glacial Lance, such as Incineroar and Gholdengo. Calyrex-I runs Clear Amulet for an immunity to Intimidate and Incineroar's Parting Shot. Tera Fire will give it an immunity to Will-O-Wisp and improve its match up into Gholdengo. Tera Water grants Calyrex-I a better match up into both Kyogre and Gholdengo, while Tera Grass provides an immunity to Spore and Rage Powder from Amoonguss along with a stronger match up into Kyogre. The allocated EV spread allows Calyrex-I to survive an Electro Drift from Choice Specs Miraidon, while the allocated Attack allows Calyrex-I to OHKO Rillaboom.

Calyrex-I pairs well with Fake Out users and redirection support, which can allow it to set up Trick Room more easily, such as Incineroar and Amoonguss. Amoonguss is an especially strong partner, as the Grass-types that are immune to Spore are weak to Glacial Lance. Amoonguss can use Spore and Rage Powder against Zamazenta, which can otherwise set up Iron Defense and wall Calyrex-I, and use Spore and offer Pollen Puff recovery against Kyogre, which otherwise has a favourable damage trade against Calyrex-I. Calyrex-I also pairs well with Pelipper, as the rain reduces damage from Fire-type attacks, and it provides Wide Guard support, which can protect it against Calyrex-S's Astral Barrage and Kyogre's Water Spout. Non-Tera Grass Calyrex-I will struggle against Amoonguss, as it can underspeed it in Trick Room and use Spore, while non-Tera Fire variants will be vulnerable to Incineroar's Will-O-Wisp.

Setup Sweeper.description:
Calyrex-S uses its incredible Speed and Special Attack stats to snowball games when they're paired with Nasty Plot or Calm Mind to boost its Special Attack. Calyrex-S matches up well against Calyrex-I and Zamazenta-C because of its ability to force Calyrex-I to Terastallize and wall Zamazenta-C when paired with any form of physical damage reduction. Psychic is a strong Psychic-type attack that isn't blocked by Wide Guard while threatening Amoonguss, Iron Hands, and Zamazenta-C. Psyshock is used for the matchup against Calm Mind users like Terapagos and Kyogre and Assault Vest users like Raging Bolt and Rillaboom; however, it is weaker against Zamazenta-C and Electric Seed Farigiraf. Draining Kiss is only used on Tera Fairy sets, but it allows Calyrex-S to both threaten the Dark-types that resist Astral Barrage like Roaring Moon, Chien-Pao, and Urshifu-S and recover HP while still threatening Wide Guard Zamazenta-C. Nasty Plot gives Calyrex-S a massive boost to its Special Attack, letting it OHKO or 2HKO most of the metagame, including OHKOing Iron Hands with Psyshock and 2HKOing Assault Vest Raging Bolt with Astral Barrage. Calm Mind takes longer to setup than Nasty Plot, generally requiring more careful planning and positioning, but the Special Defense gained is beneficial against the special attacking Restricted Pokemon like Terapagos and Kyogre. Life Orb boosts all of Calyrex-S's attacks, letting it OHKO Raging Bolt and Miraidon with Astral Barrage after a Nasty Plot. Covert Cloak prevents stat drops from moves like Snarl from Choice Scarf Chi-Yu, Electroweb from Regieleki and Raging Bolt, and Icy Wind from Booster Energy Flutter Mane as well as Fake Out's flinching effect from Pokemon like Incineroar and Rillaboom after Calyrex-S Terastallizes, letting it sweep unimpeded. The EVs allow Calyrex-S to survive a Draco Meteor from Protosynthesis-boosted Raging Bolt and OHKO Rillaboom and Terastallized Calyrex-I with Astral Barrage after either two Nasty Plot boosts or one Nasty Plot and a Helping Hand boost. A Tera type of Normal gives Calyrex-S an immunity to Ghost-type attacks like Shadow Ball from Flutter Mane and Astral Barrage from opposing Calyrex-S while not having many weaknesses. Tera Dark can be used to resist the aforementioned Ghost-type attacks while also resisting Dark-type attacks, improving Calyrex-S's matchup against both opposing Calyrex-S and Dark-types like Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu. Tera Dark does come with more substantial drawbacks though, letting Flutter Mane threaten it before and after Terastallizing. While the other two Tera types are better against the mirror matchup due to taking reduced damage from Astral Barrage, Tera Fairy gives Calyrex-S another layer of depth by boosting Draining Kiss to deal almost double the damage. This lets Calyrex-S run Calm Mind and use Draining Kiss's recovery combined with the Special Defense boosts to spread damage without having to worry about getting chipped down. An important thing to note is that the three Tera types almost form a matchup triangle; Tera Dark Calyrex-S either resists or is immune to all of the attacks that Tera Normal sets run while being able to hit them with Psychic, while a Tera Fairy variant is good against Tera Dark sets because of the pin with Astral Barrage and Draining Kiss before and after the opposing Calyrex-S Terastallizes, but it struggles against Tera Normal Calyrex-S because of the inability to spam Astral Barrage.

Due to its lack of coverage, Calyrex-S often has to pick which Pokemon it is unable to threaten. If it opts for Astral Barrage with a Psychic-type coverage move, then it is unable to threaten Dark-types like Incineroar and either specially bulky Pokemon like Calm Mind Terapagos and Kyogre or physically bulky Pokemon such as Wide Guard Zamazenta-C. Calyrex-S can get around this with partners like Urshifu-R that can take advantage of the free turns created by Wide Guard or an opposing Pokemon setting up. Draining Kiss sets lack immediate damage, which can be annoying against Zamazenta-C because of its high bulk and Wide Guard or against hyper offensive Pokemon like Miraidon and Urshifu-R; however, partners like Ogerpon-H and Clefairy help with this by redirecting attacks and giving Calyrex-S multiple turns to set up. Dark- and Normal-types that resist or are immune to Astral Barrage like Farigiraf and Chi-Yu can be annoying for Calyrex-S to remove. The Urshifu formes help by threatening the aforementioned Pokemon while also discouraging Protect, allowing Calyrex-S to start boosting its Special Attack faster. In general, Calyrex-S pairs well with partners that let it do one of two things: set up and sweep or come in after foes have been weakened then sweep. Urshifu-R and Ogerpon-H help with spreading damage early-game and letting Calyrex-S get boosts through Grim Neigh, while Incineroar, Rillaboom, and the aforementioned redirection users give Calyrex-S free turns to boost its Special Attack through Nasty Plot or Calm Mind. Trick Room can be annoying for Calyrex-S because of its high Speed; however, a partner Clefairy with After You can flip the matchup. Spore Amoonguss and Taunt Urshifu-R can also help by preventing Trick Room from going up in the first place.

Glass Cannon.description:
Calyrex-S aims to outspeed foes and dish out devastating damage early-game to soften them up for its partners. This set can additionally be used as a late-game cleaner. Calyrex-S has a positive matchup against Calyrex-I, which is threatened by Astral Barrage, and Calyrex-S has a favorable matchup against ability-reliant teams such as those based around Miraidon when it is paired with Galarian Weezing. Psychic is the primary Psychic-type STAB move for Calyrex-S; however, Expanding Force is preferred over Psychic when Calyrex-S is paired with Indeedee-F, granting it a strong Psychic-type STAB spread attack. Hyper Beam allows Calyrex-S to achieve crucial OHKOs against foes such as Miraidon with a Tera Normal boost. Pollen Puff allows Calyrex-S to threaten Farigiraf and Indeedee-F as well as sufficiently damaging Dark-types like Roaring Moon. Pollen Puff also allows Calyrex-S to sufficiently damage opposing Calyrex-S before and after Terastallizing. Pollen Puff can additionally heal Calyrex-S's ally in a pinch. Shadow Ball is used instead of Protect on Choice Specs sets, granting them a Ghost-type STAB attack unaffected by Wide Guard. Life Orb allows Calyrex-S to OHKO Amoonguss with Psychic; meanwhile, Choice Specs provides a greater damage increase, allowing Calyrex-S to OHKO Calyrex-I with Astral Barrage at the cost of move flexibility. Offensive Calyrex-S sets often maximize Special Attack and Speed; however, an alternative EV spread of 124 Def / 132 SpA / 252 Spe can be used to survive Surging Strikes from Tera Water Urshifu-R and threaten an OHKO in return. Tera Normal provides Calyrex-S with an immunity to Ghost-type attacks such as Astral Barrage from opposing Calyrex-S. Tera Normal additionally increases the damage of Hyper Beam, allowing Calyrex-S to OHKO Farigiraf, Groudon, and Amoonguss. Tera Dark provides Calyrex-S with resistances to opposing Calyrex-S's STAB attacks and Dark-type attacks like Knock Off from Incineroar and Roaring Moon. Tera Ghost is only used when Calyrex-S is using Choice Specs to maximize the damage of Astral Barrage, OHKOing bulk-invested Ogerpon-H and Whimsicott.

Calyrex-S is easily threatened by foes that can move before it attacks like Choice Scarf Urshifu-R as well as priority attacks like Sucker Punch from Chien-Pao. Dark-types like Incineroar and Roaring Moon can withstand Calyrex-S's offensive pressure and OHKO it in return. Farigiraf is difficult for Calyrex-S to damage with its immunity or resistance to Calyrex-S's STAB attacks. Calyrex-S also struggles against opposing Calyrex-S because it is forced to Terastallize to ensure it is not KOed if it moves after the opposing Calyrex-S. Offensive Calyrex-S is most commonly used on teams featuring Galarian Weezing as well as the combination of Dondozo and Tatsugiri. On these teams, Calyrex-S is usually lead with Galarian Weezing in order to deal significant damage to the opposing team with Calyrex-S, while Galarian Weezing disrupts them with Neutralizing Gas, which Calyrex-S is unaffected by. Dondozo and Tatsugiri are then brought in the back and sent onto the field to clean up late-game once Calyrex-S and Galarian Weezing have removed their threats. The partners used alongside Galarian Weezing, Dondozo, and Tatsugiri vary. Ogerpon-C is a great partner for Calyrex-S, providing redirection and easily threatening Urshifu-R, Chien-Pao, and Incineroar with its STAB attacks. Indeedee-F also provides redirection as well as setting Psychic Terrain to prevent threats from priority attacks and turn Calyrex-S's Expanding Force into a powerful spread attack. Iron Hands and Urshifu-R pair exceptionally well with Calyrex-S. Iron Hands can use Fake Out to disrupt foes, allowing Calyrex-S to easily KO them, and Urshifu-R often holds Choice Scarf, allowing it to keep up with threats that outspeed Calyrex-S. Both Iron Hands and Urshifu-R threaten Dark-types with Drain Punch and Close Combat respectively, while Calyrex-S threatens Ghost-types with Astral Barrage for Iron Hands and Urshifu-R. Roaring Moon can easily threaten Farigiraf and opposing Calyrex-S with Knock Off, and it additionally provides Tailwind support.

Guts.description:
Thanks to its high Attack, respectable bulk, and its ability Guts, Ursaluna can be a devastating threat under Trick Room. It threatens huge damage with Guts-boosted STAB moves. Its slow Speed makes it move before most Pokemon under Trick Room while also Speed tying with minimum Speed Calyrex-I. Facade works in tandem with Flame Orb and Guts to dish out large amounts of damage. Earthquake is a powerful spread move, dealing a lot of consistent damage against both opponents. Swords Dance helps offset Attack drops by Intimidate. Holding a Flame Orb helps it activate Guts, enabling it to sweep in Trick Room while gaining immunity to Spore from Amoonguss. Tera Ghost makes Ursaluna immune to Fake Out from Pokemon like Incineroar and Rillaboom and Fighting-type moves from Koraidon, Urshifu-R, and Zamazenta-C while getting rid of its weakness to Glacial Lance from Calyrex-I.

Ursaluna struggles against Intimidate users like Incineroar, as Intimidate reduces its Guts-boosted Attack. Because Ursaluna takes burn damage every turn, foes can utilize Protect to put it in range of attacks or KO it if it's at low HP without risking any damage. Tera Ghost Incineroar has Fake Out, Intimidate, and Parting Shot and is immune to Facade and neutral to Headlong Rush. Focus Sash Urshifu-S is also a good Ursaluna answer, surviving a hit and firing off a Close Combat or Wicked Blow if Ursaluna has Terastallized Ghost. Meanwhile, Calyrex-I can Speed tie Ursaluna and 2HKO it with Glacial Lance. Lunala functions particularly well with Ursaluna because it has access to Trick Room and Wide Guard to block Glacial Lance while also providing a means to remove Ghost-type Pokemon from the field with its STAB moves. Other good partners for Ursaluna are Farigiraf and Indeedee-F, with both being able to set up Trick Room while blocking priority moves with Armor Tail and Psychic Surge, respectively. Calyrex-I can set up Trick Room and also does damage with its Ice- and Ground-type coverage to punish switch-ins and OHKO Amoonguss and Rillaboom and 2HKO Ghost-types like Calyrex-S. Amoonguss is also a good partner, healing Ursaluna with Pollen Puff, being able to redirect attacks with Rage Powder, and putting opponents to sleep.

Guts Attacker.description:
• Facade and Headlong Rush are used as the strongest attacks available to Ursaluna. Earthquake is used as a strong spread damage option and to bypass Follow Me from opposing Ogerpon formes. Swords Dance can also be used to punish passive play and to reverse some of the effects from Intimidate, but this forces Ursaluna to give up one of its Ground-type moves.

  • The EV spread allows Ursaluna to survive Moonblast from Choice Specs Tera Fairy Flutter Mane, Blood Moon from Life Orb Ursaluna-B, and Ivy Cudgel from Ogerpon-W, all after burn damage. The rest of the EVs are invested into Attack

  • Tera Ghost is used to give Ursaluna an immunity to Fighting-type attacks but more importantly Fake Out, removing a key method to stalling out Ursaluna's Trick Room turns. Tera Poison can be used for more resistances, notably improving the matchup against Rillaboom and Flutter Mane, which it normally struggles with; however, Ursaluna loses the Fake Out and Fighting immunity.

TailRoom Sweeper.description:
Ursaluna-B has great offensive prowess thanks to its STAB combination, threatening Pokemon like Raging Bolt, Miraidon, Incineroar, and Calyrex-S with its Normal / Ground typing and Mind's Eye ability. Blood Moon is used to OHKO Pokemon like Urshifu-R and Ogerpon-W, while Hyper Voice is a consistent Normal-type STAB spread move that can be used while Blood Moon is disabled. Earth Power threatens Pokemon like Incineroar, Miraidon, Raging Bolt, and Gholdengo while also pressuring Pokemon that run Tera Fire like Calyrex-I and Rillaboom. Life Orb allows Ursaluna-B to pick up OHKOs on Pokemon like Urshifu-R with Tera Normal Hyper Voice, while it lets Earth Power OHKO Gholdengo as well as Zacian-C. A Timid nature allows Ursaluna-B to outspeed Pokemon like Calyrex-S, Choice Scarf Urshifu-R, and Miraidon in Tailwind and threaten huge damage. Tera Normal is used to amplify Ursaluna-B's damage, allowing for guaranteed OHKOs on Flutter Mane, Amoonguss, and Incineroar, and Calyrex-S with Blood Moon while also becoming neutral to previously super effective attacks like Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R and Wood Hammer from Rillaboom.

Trick Room teams with slower Pokemon like Amoonguss create trouble for Ursaluna-B, as it can put it to sleep with Spore. Ursaluna-B also faces difficulty against Urshifu-S and Chien-Pao, as both utilize Focus Sash to survive one hit and OHKO Ursaluna-B with Close Combat and Icicle Crash respectively. Iron Hands is a good partner for Ursaluna-B, as it is able to easily tank the attacks from Urshifu-S and Chien-Pao and slow their momentum down with Fake Out. Pokemon with Prankster Tailwind like Whimsicott make for strong partners, allowing Ursaluna-B to take full advantage of its Timid nature, helping it outspeed Calyrex-S and Choice Scarf Urshifu-R. Farigiraf is a great partner for Ursaluna-B thanks to its ability to set up Trick Room for more flexibility and negate Fake Out with Armor Tail. Miraidon synergizes well with Ursaluna-B due to its immunity to Discharge while also preventing the aforementioned Spore from affecting Ursaluna-B thanks to Electric Terrain. It also OHKOes Urshifu-R and brings Pokemon like Mienshao down to their Focus Sash, helping Ursaluna-B sweep more easily.

Bulky Wallbreaker.description:
• Ursaluna-B can rip apart teams with its powerful STAB attacks augmented by its ability, Mind's Eye.
  • Blood Moon is a metagame-warping move, as it will simply drop even bulky foes like Farigiraf that are unprepared for its damage. Hyper Voice puts out powerful spread damage and still heavily damages frailer foes like Hisuian Typhlosion, Whimsicott, and Sneasler; having two Normal-type STAB moves is good to have because it lets Ursaluna-B hit Ground-resistant and -immune foes even when it cannot use Blood Moon. Mind's Eye supports both of these moves, letting Ursaluna-B throw out its Normal-type attacks without fear of Ghost-types ignoring them. Life Orb sets prefer the defensive value of Protect, whereas Assault Vest sets opt for Vacuum Wave to pick off weakened foes.
  • Life Orb maximizes Ursaluna-B's damage potential, securing OHKOes on bulky foes like opposing Ursaluna-B and Hatterene with Blood Moon and Gholdengo with Earth Power. Assault Vest gives Ursaluna-B some additional special bulk to survive attacks from the format's powerful special attackers.
  • Tera Normal is used on Life Orb sets to give Blood Moon the extra power to OHKO bulky foes like Primarina and Assault Vest Rillaboom while strengthening Hyper Voice for devastating spread damage. Tera Water is preferred on Assault Vest Ursaluna-B and is used to hold off Hisuian Typhlosion, Torkoal, and Primarina.
  • 204 Speed EVs allow Ursaluna-B to outspeed Adamant Dragapult under Tailwind, though this much Speed is only run on Tailwind teams. This and maximum Special Attack investment maximize the offensive potential of Life Orb Ursaluna-B. However, with some special bulk, Assault Vest Ursaluna-B will survive otherwise devastating special attacks like Life Orb Ursaluna-B's Tera Normal Blood Moon, Choice Specs Gholdengo's Tera Steel Make It Rain, and Life Orb Hatterene's Expanding Force in Psychic Terrain; it also is favored to survive truly absurd attacks like Choice Specs Hisuian Typhlosion's Tera Fire Eruption at maximum power and can guarantee living the move with Tera Water or Vacuum Wave.

Trick Room Sweeper.description:
• Hyper Voice provides Ursaluna-B with a more spammable Normal-type STAB attack, especially during Blood Moon's cooldown.

  • Life Orb is recommended, as it provides Ursaluna-B with a boost to its attacks, and Ursaluna-B doesn't mind the recoil due to its great bulk and ability to consistently move first under Trick Room.

  • The given EV spread lets it live a Tera Fairy Moonblast from a Special Attack Booster Energy Flutter Mane. 0 Speed IVs and a Quiet nature allow it to function better under Trick Room.

  • Ursaluna-B may opt for an EV spread of 84 HP / 252 SpA / 172 Spe to outspeed Adamant Chien-Pao under Tailwind.

  • Tera Normal can be used to boost the damage output of Blood Moon and Hyper Voice to nuclear levels.

Sneasler.comments:
Teambuilding

  • Sneasler synergizes best with other strong attackers that threaten the Poison- and Ghost-type Pokemon that Sneasler struggles to hit. Focus Sash Sneasler pairs best with both special and physical attackers, while Terrain Seed Sneasler both requires either Rillaboom or an Indeedee forme as a partner and pairs very well with them. Sneasler threatens opposing Grass- and Steel-types that resist Rillaboom's Grass-type attacks and Dark- and Steel-types that can switch into Indeedee-M's Expanding Force.
  • Kingambit and Dragapult both synergize very well with Sneasler. Dragapult enjoys Sneasler threatening Primarina, which is a common switch-in to Dragapult's attacks. Dragapult is also extremely fast, letting it and Sneasler quickly overwhelm foes. Dragapult and Kingambit both benefit from Sneasler being good against opposing Kingambit, as they struggle to hit it.
  • Sneasler's main weakness is Gholdengo, since it is immune to all of Sneasler's attacks if it isn't running Throat Chop and is often paired with Incineroar, which can lower Sneasler's Attack while also switching into Throat Chop. An allied Kingambit can help with this, as it benefits from Intimidate and resists both of Gholdengo's STAB attacks while also hitting it for super effective damage.

Strategy Comments

  • Sneasler's main role is to use its good coverage against the metagame and good offensive stats to clear the way for other attackers. Look for situations where an opposing team has limited checks to an offensive Pokemon like Dragapult and attempt to remove these checks with Sneasler.
  • Sneasler works best as an early-game attacker, as it can be lead with Pokemon with weaknesses it can cover, forcing the opponent to be weak against one or the other. Tough matchups for Sneasler can simply be resolved by not bringing it, as it shouldn't be the centerpiece of any team.
  • Sneasler's main counters are bulky Pokemon and Pokemon that it lacks the coverage to hit. Sneasler's best partners tend to have a good matchup against most Pokemon that resist its attacks in addition to covering Sneasler's type-based weaknesses as well.

Glass Cannon.description:
• Sneasler uses its high Speed and good offensive typing to do large amounts of damage to the opposing team and potentially spread status through Dire Claw and Poison Touch.
  • Focus Sash Sneasler is guaranteed to live one hit, giving it a better matchup against opposing Pokemon that outspeed and threaten to OHKO it such as Talonflame. -An Adamant nature boosts Sneasler's damage output, giving it a chance to OHKO Ursaluna, Ursaluna-B, and Archaludon. A Jolly nature allows Sneasler to outspeed Maushold and Alolan Ninetales.
  • Tera Stellar boosts all of Sneasler's attacks, letting Close Combat OHKO Incineroar after Intimidate and OHKO Archaludon. Tera Ghost gives Sneasler an immunity to Fake Out and Extreme Speed, which could break its Focus Sash. When paired with Garchomp, Sneasler can use Tera Flying in order to become immune to Earthquake while boosting Garchomp's Attack with Coaching.
  • Fake Out can help Sneasler's partners such as Kingambit and Gholdengo find a chance to set up. Coaching is a more niche option that does well when paired with multiple physical attackers, as Sneasler can use its high Speed stat to outspeed and boost partners such as Garchomp and Kingambit, allowing them to immediately fire off a boosted attack.
  • Poison Touch pairs well with Fake Out, allowing Sneasler to both prevent a foe from moving and have a chance to chip them throughout the game. Unburden is less consistent with Focus Sash than with a Terrain Seed but can work well against hyper offense teams that pair a strong attacker spamming spread moves with a priority Tailwind setter.
  • Focus Sash Sneasler can use its ability to live any hit to OHKO Pokemon like Primarina even when they are paired with a Pokemon that is faster than Sneasler like Dragapult.
  • Focus Sash Sneasler can't reliably activate Unburden, so it is slower than most Pokemon when they have Tailwind activated, which, when paired with Sneasler's poor bulk, can be a problem.

Terrain Attacker.description:
• Grassy or Psychic Seed Sneasler uses its high Speed that can be boosted by Unburden to outspeed opposing Pokemon even if they have Tailwind set up or if Sneasler's Speed has been lowered.
  • Fake Out lets Sneasler prevent a foe from attacking, potentially letting a partner, such as Kingambit or Gholdengo, get a turn to attack or set up. Throat Chop lets Sneasler hit Ghost-type Pokemon like Gholdengo and Basculegion-M for super effective damage as well as avoiding Psychic Terrain's blocking of Fake Out when Sneasler is paired with Indeedee-M.
  • Tera Stellar works better on Sneasler sets that aren't running Throat Chop or can afford it to be weaker. It also lets Sneasler OHKO most Incineroar with Close Combat and guarantee the OHKO on Primarina with Dire Claw. Tera Dark lets Sneasler's Throat Chop OHKO Basculegion-M almost all of the time as well as making Sneasler immune to the Psychic-type attacks that threaten it before Terastallizing.
  • Sneasler runs Grassy Seed or Psychic Seed depending on its partners; Grassy Seed works on offensive teams with Rillaboom, while Psychic Seed fits on hyper offense teams with Indeedee-M.
  • Once Sneasler has activated Unburden, it can no longer switch out without losing the Speed boost, restricting its flexibility and potentially not letting it get the full value out of Fake Out like a Focus Sash set would. Sneasler can also be vulnerable to getting OHKOed by stronger attacks without a Focus Sash.

Maushold.comments:
Teambuilding

  • Maushold can support various teams. It is most commonly used on rain and balance teams featuring Annihilape.
  • On rain teams, Maushold uses Beat Up to assist Archaludon in gaining Defense boosts from Stamina as well as increasing the damage of Rage Fist from Annihilape. It also provides redirection, allowing Annihilape to set up further with Bulk Up and other partners such as Basculegion-M to attack safely.
  • On balance teams, Maushold provides the same support to Annihilape and additionally supports partners such as Gholdengo and Kingambit with redirection, allowing them to safely set up with Nasty Plot and Swords Dance, respectively.
  • Maushold is threatened by Fighting-types such as Sneasler. Partners such as Annihilape and Gholdengo are difficult for Sneasler to KO and can easily KO Sneasler in return. Maushold is also walled by Ghost-types like Gholdengo. Incineroar can comfortably survive attacks from Gholdengo and threaten it with Knock Off. Taunt easily disrupts Maushold, requiring Maushold to switch out to remove the effect.

Strategy Comments

  • Maushold performs best when it redirects attacks and enabling its partners to set up safely and sweep. Leading Maushold is often a great choice, allowing its partners to take early-game KOs.
  • Maushold can be used flexibly. Follow Me is vital for granting its partner a turn to safely set up or take a KO at any point during the game, and the offensive set can sometimes deal just enough damage to take a surprising KO on a big opposing threat.
  • Maushold is easily disrupted by Taunt, so it needs to Taunt the opposing support Pokemon itself or rely on its partners to take out opposing Taunt users. Offensive Maushold is additionally threatened by Rocky Helmet and Rough Skin, both of which KO it after it has used Population Bomb.

Offensive Support.description:
• Offensive Maushold aims to soften up foes or take surprising KOs with Technician Population Bomb while also providing redirection and disruption support.
  • Population Bomb allows Maushold to deal devastating damage, especially with ten hits, which is enough to remove threats such as Dragonite. Taunt shuts down Trick Room setters like Porygon2 and opposing support Pokemon like Amoonguss.
  • Tera Ghost makes Maushold immune to Close Combat from Sneasler, Fake Out from Incineroar, and Extreme Speed from Dragonite. Tera Grass grants Maushold an immunity to Spore and Rage Powder. Tera Grass also provides useful resistances to Water- and Electric-type attacks such as Wave Crash from Basculegion and Electro Shot from Archaludon.
  • Wide Lens is used to increase the accuracy of Population Bomb, greatly increasing the chance of landing ten hits.
  • While this set is capable of dealing high damage, it is reliant on landing enough Population Bomb hits to take out or weaken threats. This set lacks defensive investment, so it is not expected to be able to redirect attacks throughout the battle.

Bulky Support.description:
• As a bulky support Pokemon, Maushold aims to redirect attacks for its partners as well as disrupt its foes. Maushold additionally has Friend Guard, increasing the survivability of its allies.
  • Beat Up is used to increase the power of Rage Fist from a partner Annihilape and grant Defense boosts to a partner Archaludon with Stamina; it can also be used to break Focus Sashes. Taunt disrupts Trick Room setters and opposing support Pokemon like Porygon2 and Electabuzz.
  • Tera Ghost makes Maushold immune to Close Combat from Sneasler, Fake Out from Incineroar, and Extreme Speed from Dragonite. Tera Fairy turns Maushold's weakness to Close Combat into a resistance and provides an immunity to Outrage from Dragonite. Tera Fairy is also a great defensive typing into the metagame.
  • Safety Goggles grants Maushold an immunity to Spore and Rage Powder.
  • This Maushold set is capable of taking multiple attacks; however, it is easily disrupted by Taunt, forcing Maushold to be switched out to remove the effect. The set is also very passive and deals very low damage.

Glimmora.overview:
• Glimmora is a strong offensive threat with access to a good STAB combination and the powerful move Meteor Beam, which, when used with the Power Herb, can melt many targets, such as Assault Vest Entei and Incineroar. With Toxic Debris and signature move Mortal Spin, Glimmora can punish physical attackers and passive play, and, when combined with the threat of Meteor Beam, make it impossible to ignore while also requiring careful positioning to properly handle.

  • Glimmora has traditionally fit best on Dondozo teams, as the combination of Toxic Debris and Mortal Spin means your foes almost guaranteed to be afflicted with poison, putting your opponent on a timer. Assault Vest on Glimmora is especially effective on Dondozo teams, as the extra longevity helps it spread poison better and stall out even longer, making up for the lowered damage output.

  • With Meteor Beam, Glimmora can utilize its high Special Attack stat and good offensive typing as a damage dealer. Tornadus and Ogerpon-W are good partners; Tornadus provides speed control and can launch powerful Bleakwind Storms into Fighting-types that resist Meteor Beam and Ogerpon-W redirects potential Water- or Ground-type attacks while pressuring threats like Urshifu-R and Landorus. In return, Glimmora can threaten Grass-types, which resists both Ogerpon-W's STAB moves.

  • Glimmora's poor defensive typing, combined with its middling bulk and average Speed, makes Glimmora a glass cannon. Glimmora is weak to many prominent offensive threats such as Urshifu-R, Landorus, and Gholdengo. Glimmora also struggles to handle Rock-resistant foes such as Iron Hands, Kingambit, and Urshifu-R. Even then, many of these foes will concede Toxic Spikes while taking out Glimmora; for instance, Urshifu-R will set up both layers of Toxic Spikes if it attacks Glimmora. Amoonguss is another difficult match up, as it absords Toxic Spikes and takes Glimmora's attacks comfortably, while threatening a Spore.

Meteor Beam.description:
Meteor Beam's power against most neutral targets is devastating. The Special Attack boost allows Glimmora to output offensive pressure with Sludge Bomb even after Power Herb is consumed.

  • Earth Power is used as coverage for the Steel-types that resist Glimmora's STAB combination. Energy Ball is also an option to utilize the Tera Grass STAB boost and to hit Pokemon that resist Meteor Beam such as Urshifu-R but makes it so that Steel-types resist all of Glimmora's attacks.

  • The Special Attack investment along with the Modest nature is necessary to pick up a OHKO on Landorus, Walking Wake, and Terastillized Urshifu-R with Meteor Beam. The OHKO on Landorus and Urshifu turns the match up against hyper offensive teams completely on its head, especially with speed control support from Tornadus.

  • The Defense investment is enough to guarantee surviving Rillaboom's Wood Hammer and a favourable roll of taking Kingambit's Iron Head. The Special Defensive investment lets it live Gholdengo's Make It Rain and Latias's Mist Ball. The rest of the EVs are invested into Speed, which allows Glimmora to outspeed Choice Scarf Landorus-T when in Tailwind.

  • Tera Grass has better synergy with Glimmora's original typing and provides an immunity to spore, but gives Glimmora weakness to common threats such as Chien-Pao. Tera Water, defensively, is a stronger neutral type into the metagame, but has fewer relevant resistances to common threats.

Bulky Attacker.description:
• Both Earth Power and Energy Ball are fine options, but Energy Ball can do more damage against neutral targets if Glimmora Terastallizes into a Grass type.

  • Mortal Spin is used as the final move for a more consistent method to spread poison than Toxic Debris.

  • The Assault Vest gives Glimmora much more longevity, as it allows it to comfortably tank special attacks while still dissuading physical attackers with the threat of Toxic Spikes. On teams where being able to spread poison is important, Assault Vest is a good option.

  • The special bulk allows Glimmora to live many strong super effective attacks, such as Choice Specs Gholdengo's Make It Rain; it also makes Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball a 3HKO. Glimmora still lives a Rillaboom Wood Hammer with the HP investment.

Flamigo.comments:
Teambuilding

  • Flamigo works nicely alongside Earthquake users like Ursaluna and Garchomp, threatening the Grass-types that can easily take on Earthquake while also being immune to it. Redirection can help keep Flamigo away from attacks, considering its fragility.

  • Ursaluna and Garchomp can easily threaten Electabuzz and Magmar, which redirect Flamigo's attacks away from Pokemon Flamigo is meant to threaten like Gholdengo. The aforementioned Ground-types can also avoid redirection with Earthquake. Porygon2 can hit Flying-types with Ice Beam and Thunderbolt. Gholdengo can threaten Fairy-types like Sylveon and Hatterene, which resist Flamigo's Close Combat.

  • Multi-hit moves like Scale Shot from Dragonite are a major issue, as they can OHKO Flamigo through Focus Sash. These multi-hit moves can be redirected with the help of Amoonguss, while the damage can be mitigated with Intimidate from Incineroar.

Strategy Comments

  • Flamigo's main role is to be a wallbreaker that can threaten top Pokemon like Gholdengo and Incineroar. Flamigo really shines when against Steel-types like Gholdengo and Kingambit, threatening them with Close Combat.

  • Flamigo is meant to be brought first, but it can be saved in certain matchups, such as the Psychic-type spam matchup, since Wide Guard is able to deny Expanding Force and Eruption from foes such as Indeedee-M and Hisuian Typhlosion, respectively.

  • Faster Pokemon like Dragapult are some of the biggest threats to Flamigo, as they can bring Flamigo down to Focus Sash or double target Flamigo and KO it. Physically bulky Pokemon such as Dondozo can also be an issue, as they can take hits and deal good damage back. Bulky Flying-types like Dragonite and Corviknight can take on attacks from Flamigo while hitting hard back. Powerful special attackers like Gholdengo can take down the physically bulky foes. Electric- and Ice-type attacks like Thunderbolt and Ice Beam from Porygon2 can threaten these Flying-types, while Clear Smog Amoonguss does well into Dondozo.

Glass Cannon.description:
• Flamigo both hits hard and is decently fast, doing particularly well into threats such as Incineroar, Gholdengo, and Sneasler thanks to its ability Scrappy and good offensive typing.

  • Dual Wingbeat is a respectably strong attack that is able to OHKO Pokemon through Focus Sash, notably Sneasler. Brave Bird is able to pick up OHKOes onto Pokemon such as Rillaboom and is more consistent than Dual Wingbeat, but it breaks Flamigo's own Focus Sash, leaving it vulnerable to attacks. Wide Guard can protect Flamigo and its partners from powerful spread attacks like Eruption from Hisuian Typhlosion, Make It Rain from Gholdengo, and Expanding Force from the likes of Indeedee-M and Hatterene.

  • Focus Sash allows Flamigo to guarantee surviving at least one attack, which is especially useful with its low bulk and the stat drops from Close Combat.

  • Tera Ghost lets Flamigo ignore Fake Out, being able to OHKO many sturdy threats such as Rillaboom and Incineroar without being at risk of their partner's attack. Tera Ghost also stops Extreme Speed from knocking out Flamigo when its health has been lowered, as well as preventing Extreme Speed and Fake Out from breaking Focus Sash. Tera Stellar increases Flamigo's damage output, notably OHKOing Archaludon with Close Combat.

Body Press.description:
Dondozo takes advantage of Unaware and its good natural bulk to boast a good matchup against metagame staples such as Calyrex-I and Zamazenta-C while picking away at the opponent's team for Calyrex-S to clean it up. Order Up boosts Dondozo's Body Press when paired with Tatsugiri-D and hits Dragon-types such as Tera Dragon Zamazenta-C. Body Press threatens foes such as Zamazenta-C and Terapagos, and Order Up's Defense boosts leave Dondozo untouchable to physical attackers like Calyrex-I after a few Defense boosts. Earthquake can be used over Wave Crash for a spread move. Thanks to Dondozo's heightened defenses after a Commander boost, Leftovers becomes even more valuable, making Dondozo even bulkier with passive recovery and allowing it to easily stall turns with Protect. With a Commander boost, the Defense investment lets Dondozo comfortably 2HKO Zamazenta-C and OHKO Incineroar at +3 most of the time. The Special Defense investment and Commander boost lets Dondozo survive two Thunderbolts from Raging Bolt. The Speed investment allows Dondozo to outpace Adamant Urshifu formes after Commander boosts. Tera Grass lets Dondozo resist Electric- and Grass-type attacks like Wood Hammer from Rillaboom and Thunderclap while also giving Dondozo an immunity to Spore and Rage Powder.

Dondozo tends to struggle with Fake Out users like Rillaboom, Incineroar, and Iron Hands; they can easily cycle in and out to spam Fake Out and catch Dondozo a turn after it uses Protect, forcing it to use Protect again, preventing it from dealing damage, and letting foes rack up damage. The Urshifu formes can significantly chunk Dondozo with powerful Wicked Blows and Surging Strikes that hit through its boosts with critical hits. Miraidon also threatens Dondozo with big hits like Draco Meteor and Electro Drift. Removing the aforementioned Fake Out users and the Urshifu formes allows Dondozo to come in safely and chip foes for Calyrex-S to clean up. Galarian Weezing can help by setting up Toxic Spikes and chipping foes before Dondozo gets on the field, allowing it to rack up Toxic damage with Protect and picking off foes for Calyrex-S. Galarian Weezing can also significantly chunk the Urshifu formes with Strange Steam. Calyrex-S is able to come in after Dondozo weakens the opposing team, cleaning up the game while helping Dondozo by being able to outspeed and KO Miraidon.

Commander Sweeper.description:
• Combining with Tatsugiri-C allows Dondozo to become a threatening sweeper, being able to pose a significant threat to the majority of teams. Its significant bulk and attacking prowess allow it to rip through unprepared teams and make it hard to remove without consistent answers.
  • Wave Crash is Dondozo's strongest attacking move, providing a great source of damage to neutral targets such as Gholdengo and Annihilape. Earthquake provides a spread attack that can get around redirection users such as Electabuzz, Magmar, Clefable, and Amoonguss.
  • Order Up provides a way for Dondozo to boost its Attack without Coaching, allowing it to become even more threatening if the opponent attempts to play around it passively. Order Up also provides a way to hit Dragon-types like Dragonite and Baxcalibur.
  • Heavy Slam allows Dondozo to hit Fairy-types that can otherwise check it like Primarina, Alolan Ninetales and Clefable, and it can be boosted even further by Tera Steel.
  • Tera Steel allows Dondozo to become immune to Clear Smog from opposing Amoonguss as well as boosting the power of Dondozo's Heavy Slam, allowing it to OHKO physically defensive Amoonguss at +3. Tera Grass allows Dondozo to become immune to Spore from Amoonguss as well as allowing Dondozo to resist Ground-type attacks from Garchomp, Ursaluna, and Ursaluna-B.
  • Unaware is used to ignore setup threats such as Volcarona, Gholdengo and Archaludon who could otherwise give Dondozo some issues, it also allows Dondozo to defeat other Commander Dondozo.
  • Leftovers provides Dondozo with a little bit more longevity, as its naturally high bulk paired with the +2 Defense and Special Defense boosts lets it shrug off attacks and heal them off, and this recovery tends to rack up very quickly if it's alternating between attacking and using Protect.
  • The Speed investment on this set allows it to outspeed maximum Speed Garchomp after combining with Tatsugiri-C and threaten it greatly with Wave Crash or Order Up. The Attack investment allows +3 Tera Steel Heavy Slam to get a OHKO on physically defensive Amoonguss and allows +1 Earthquake to 2HKO most Sitrus Berry Incineroar.

Bulky Yawn.description:
• This Dondozo set aims to be a much bulkier supporting piece that is used without Tatsugiri while still managing to provide a bit of offensive pressure thanks to its attacking options.
  • Yawn is Dondozo's main supporting tool, allowing it to force switches or put the enemy to sleep depending on what it goes for. This can put the opponent into an awkward position, which generates free turns for your partner Pokemon.
  • Wave Crash is Dondozo's strongest attacking move. Alternatively, Liquidation can be used to circumvent the recoil of Wave Crash and give Dondozo more longevity.
  • Fissure is used in situations where Dondozo isn't providing any pressure on the field, as Dondozo tends to be extremely passive against Pokemon naturally immune to its sleep move like Electabuzz and Gholdengo or Pokemon that like to pivot a lot naturally and don't mind taking its Water-type attack like Amoonguss, Porygon2, and other supportive Dondozo. Fissure gives Dondozo a way to provide pressure against these Pokemon that can normally wall it, and since Dondozo is so bulky, a miss often won't lose you the game.
  • Unaware allows Dondozo to check setup sweepers that could otherwise beat it such as Volcarona, Gholdengo, Kingambit and Archaludon, allowing it to take their boosted attacks and force them out with Yawn.
  • Tera Poison allows Dondozo to resist Grass-type attacks as well as gaining important resistances to Fighting and Poison, allowing it to wall Sneasler. Tera Bug and Grass allow Dondozo to resist Ground-type attacks rather than being weak to it, unlike Tera Poison; while Tera Grass allows it to gain an immunity to Rage Powder and Spore from Amoonguss, Tera Bug allows Dondozo to not be weak to Ice-type moves from Alolan Ninetales and Baxcalbur as well as Poison-type moves from Sneasler.
  • The EVs on this set allow Dondozo to survive two Electro Shots from Archaludon after Dondozo uses Protect for a turn if Grassy Terrain is up.

Offensive Sweeper.description:
• Wave Crash is Dondozo's strongest Water-type move, OHKOing Pokemon like Tornadus and Gholdengo. Earthquake bypasses Follow Me from Ogerpon-W, and provides it a strong spread move thats picks off weakened foes.

  • Rocky Helmet breaks Focus Sash on Chien-Pao and Urshifu, allowing for an OHKO. It also allows for big damage on Urshifu-R using Surging Strikes. Leftovers allows Dondozo to recover swathes of health, even more so by stalling with Protect. However, its harder to use now, as most threats to Dondozo can outdamage Leftovers recovery, especially so considering the Urshifu formes ignore Protect. Clear Amulet can be used to remove ways to weaken Dondozo, primarily Incineroar and Gouging Fire.

  • 20 Defense EVs ensure that Sacred Sword from Chien-Pao is a 4HKO and allow Dondozo to survive two Wicked Blows from Urshifu-S. 76 Special Defense EVs allow Dondozo to survive two Moonblasts from Tera Fairy Choice Specs Flutter Mane. The Attack investment ensures Wave Crash OHKOes Urshifu-S after Rocky Helmet damage and that Order Up 2HKOes Ogerpon-W and Urshifu-R.

  • Tera Grass provides resistances to Grass- and Electric-type attacks, as well as giving an immunity to Spore from Amoonguss, which is otherwise difficult to deal with.

Supportive Yawn.description:
• Dondozo can utilize its strong natural bulk and typing to function as a supportive wall with Yawn.

  • Yawn Dondozo pairs best with Ting-Lu, as a combination of Sand Tomb and Yawn can reliably slow down foes and Ting-Lu's Vessel of Ruin helps with Dondozo's frailer Special Defense.

  • Dondozo struggles against Rillaboom and Amoonguss, as both resist Wave Crash, and it is harder to make damage over time stick with Grassy Terrain and Pollen Puff respectively. Additionally, the former threatens super effective damage on Dondozo and the latter threatens Spore.

  • Leftovers recovery gives Dondozo additional staying power in slower-paced battles compared to recovery Berries.

  • Oblivious prevents Dondozo from being shut down with Taunt from Pokémon such as Tornadus or affected by Intimidate from foes like Incineroar.

  • The invested bulk allows Dondozo to survive Thunderbolt from Raging Bolt, as well as surviving two Earth Powers from Landorus and OHKOing in return with Wave Crash. Heavy Slam is used to OHKO Flutter Mane.

Commander.description:
Tatsugiri-D's main role is to be beside Dondozo and give it a boost thanks to Commander and Order Up boosting Dondozo's Defense stat. When not beside Dondozo, it can support partners with Helping Hand and deal spread damage with Muddy Water, which can swing games by having a chance to lower the foes' accuracy. Draco Meteor is a strong Dragon-type attack that can threaten other Dragon-types like Miraidon and Roaring Moon. Helping Hand can be used to boost the attacks of partners like Calyrex-S and Chi-Yu. With Helping Hand, Calyrex-S can KO Raging Bolt with Astral Barrage, while Chi-Yu can KO Flutter Mane with Heat Wave. Focus Sash allows Tatsugiri-D to survive an attack and fire back or support its partners. With a Modest Nature, Tera Stellar Tatsugiri-D can OHKO both Urshifu formes, Calyrex-S, and most Assault Vest Raging Bolt with Draco Meteor and Chi-Yu with Muddy Water. Tatsugiri-D can run a Timid nature, making it deal less damage but letting it outspeed threats like Modest Terapagos and Regidrago.

Tatsugiri is solely used to combine with Dondozo, and shouldn't be picked outside of that purpose.

Commander Support.description:
• Tatsugiri only appears on teams to enable Dondozo with its Commander ability and potentially offer some support and damage.
  • Icy Wind offers speed control and considerable damage into the likes of Garchomp and Dragonite, though it only appears on Choice Scarf sets. Draco Meteor is a high-damage STAB option with drawbacks, while Dragon Pulse offers consistent damage. Taunt can stop status moves like Spore from Amoonguss; Follow Me from Electabuzz, Magmar, and Maushold; and Trick Room from Porygon2 and the Indeedee formes. Taunt in combination with Safety Goggles can ignore Rage Powder to stop opposing setup. The status moves are not intended for a Choice Scarf set. Protect appears on Focus Sash and Safety Goggles sets, and it can be used to bait attacks into Tatsugiri before Dondozo is sent out, drawing damage away from Tatsugiri's partner.
  • Choice Scarf lets Tatsugiri outspeed the entire metagame if the opponent does not have Speed boosts, though it is less flexible. Focus Sash aids survivability for Tatsugiri, with its low defensive presence, but the set lacks speed control. Safety Goggles stops Tatsugiri from getting punished by a slow Spore on the turn Dondozo faints. The Safety Goggles set has mediocre Speed and bulk and can be taken out by fast offensive threats.
  • Tera Ghost is useful for blocking moves like Fake Out and Extreme Speed, which will quickly break a Focus Sash. Tera Steel turns Tatsugiri's weaknesses to Dragon, Fairy, and Freeze Dry into resistances and adds other useful resistances, such as to Grass- and Normal-type moves like Wood Hammer, Blood Moon, and Hyper Voice. Tera Stellar boosts general offense, given that Focus Sash Tatsugiri is likely to survive a turn.

Choice Scarf Support.description:
• Icy Wind is used as a late-game speed control option. Dragon Pulse is a more consistent STAB move compared to Draco Meteor and Muddy Water, at the cost of damage. Sleep Talk allows Tatsugiri to better answer Amoonguss, while Tera Blast hits Flutter Mane and Chien-Pao in the rare circumstances where Tatsugiri is Terastallized.

  • Choice Scarf allows Tatsugiri to clean up late-game once Dondozo is down, either serving as speed control with Icy Wind to support its partner or dealing damage with Muddy Water and Draco Meteor.

  • The given EVs allow Tatsugiri to outspeed Choice Scarf Landorus-T and survive an Icicle Crash from Chien-Pao and a Wicked Blow from Urshifu-S.

  • Tera Steel gives Tatsugiri a resistance to Dragon and Fairy and a generally better defensive profile. Tera Water can be used to boost Muddy Water's damage and remove its weakness to Flutter Mane's Fairy-type STAB moves, which is useful in some end-game scenarios.

Choice Scarf.description:
Annihilape finds a good niche in the metagame, as it fares well against Pokemon such as Chi-Yu, Incineroar, and Zamazenta-C. Final Gambit deals immense damage if Annihilape cannot pick up an OHKO. Shadow Claw deals decent damage without needing to be hit like Rage Fist. Coaching has the ability to boost the power of allies like Calyrex-I, while U-turn helps with positioning, chipping Rillaboom in the process. Choice Scarf allows Annihilape to outspeed and deal damage to faster foes such as Calyrex-S, which faints to a Shadow Claw. Tera Grass allows it to ignore Spore and Rage Powder from Amoonguss, which can survive a Final Gambit and support its allies.

Choice Scarf Annihilape struggles against strong priority moves like Raging Bolt's Thunderclap and Rillaboom's Grassy Glide, which weaken Final Gambit. Farigiraf is also an issue, as it is a bulky Pokemon that is immune to Shadow Claw, deals great damage to Annihilape with Psychic, and has enough HP to survive a Final Gambit. Calyrex-I is a great partner for Annihilape, as Annihilape is able to either give it a Coaching boost or remove an annoying or powerful foe to Calyrex-I like Zamazenta-C or Calyrex-S with Final Gambit or Shadow Claw, respectively. In return, Calyrex-I is able to threaten Raging Bolt and Rillaboom for great damage. Smeargle is also a favorable partner, as it can redirect attacks away from Annihilape with Follow Me, allowing for a full-HP Final Gambit.

Bulky Setup Sweeper.description:
• As a bulky setup sweeper, Annihilape aims to stick around for a long time by boosting its stats and snowballing mid- or late-game.
  • Drain Punch provides a consistent Fighting-type STAB move and recovery, increasing Annihilape's longevity. Rage Fist provides a Ghost-type STAB move that deals devastating damage mid- or late-game.
  • Safety Goggles provides Annihilape with an immunity to Spore, Rage Powder, and Sleep Powder, which allows it to ignore opposing support Pokemon such as Amoonguss. Leftovers provides HP recovery, increasing Annihilape's longevity. Leftovers is often selected when Annihilape's partners are capable of removing disruptive supports, allowing it to set up uninterrupted. Leftovers additionally transforms some 2HKOs into 3HKOs; for example, Dire Claw from Sneasler becomes a 3HKO, and Freeze-Dry from Alolan Ninetales has a very low chance to 2HKO Tera Water Annihilape after Leftovers recovery.
  • Tera Water provides Annihilape with a good defensive typing against the metagame with notable resistances to powerful Fire-, Steel-, and Water-type attacks such as Eruption from Hisuian Typhlosion, Make It Rain from Gholdengo, and Wave Crash from Basculegion-M. Tera Fire provides Annihilape with the same resistance to Fire- and Steel-type attacks with an additional resistance to Fairy-type attacks like Moonblast from Clefable as well as an immunity to burn.
  • The given EV spread allows Annihilape to survive sun-boosted Choice Specs Heat Wave from Timid Charizard as well as Blood Moon from Ursaluna-B. This set additionally outruns Gholdengo.
  • While the bulky setup sweeper set can deal devastating damage late-game, Annihilape deals pitiful damage early-game when it is not set up. However, this set is capable of surviving longer than Choice Scarf sets.

Bulky Support.description:
Farigiraf's main role is as a bulky support piece and Trick Room setter, and its ability to block priority is incredibly valuable in a format full of moves like Fake Out, Grassy Glide and Thunderclap. Due to its typing, it has a good matchup into Calyrex-S, and its Psychic-type STAB moves are generally good into the metagame but especially into Amoonguss and Urshifu-R. Tera Blast is often used in the second moveslot, as both before and after Terastallization, it gives Farigiraf a consistent single-target STAB move. Foul Play is used to give Farigiraf a way to hit both Calyrex formes for super effective damage, being able to 2HKO both. Electric Seed is used in tandem with Miraidon and gives Farigiraf more bulk, allowing it to stick around longer to support the team with Helping Hand and Armor Tail. Sitrus Berry allows Farigiraf to disrupt the opponent for longer than it would be able to without it. It can also help it take some double-ups to help safely get Trick Room up, such as Surging Strikes + Knock Off from Urshifu-R and Incineroar. Safety Goggles is viable if your team has a particularly bad matchup into Amoonguss and you want Farigiraf to be able to set up Trick Room without being put to sleep without Electric Terrain support from Miraidon. The HP and Special Defense EVs allow Farigiraf to tank a Choice Specs Beads of Ruin single-target Tera Starstorm from Terapagos, and the rest is put into Defense. Tera Ground is used next to Miraidon to allow it to freely use Discharge, and Tera Fairy allows it to resist the Dark- and Bug-type moves it'd otherwise be weak to like Knock Off and U-turn from Incineroar and Rillaboom, while also resisting Fighting-type attacks and gaining an immunity to Dragon-type moves, like Collision Course and Draco Meteor from Koraidon and Miraidon, respectively.

Farigiraf really doesn't like Restricted Pokemon that can OHKO it and potentially prevent Trick Room, such as Kyogre or Tera Fire Koraidon. It also struggles against fast Taunt users, such as Speed Booster Energy Flutter Mane, due to them being able to prevent Trick Room from going up, and bulky Dark-types like Incineroar, as Farigiraf can't hit them very hard without Tera Ground. Incineroar in particular can force it to Terastallize with Knock Off. Miraidon and Farigiraf are great partners for each other, as Farigiraf stops Miraidon from being interrupted by Fake Out, which is particularly important for the Choice Specs set, and Miraidon can activate the Electric Seed to make Farigiraf even bulkier; furthermore, as previously mentioned, Farigiraf can even Tera Ground so Miraidon can freely click Discharge next to it, while the Electric Terrain makes Farigiraf immune to Amoonguss's Spore. Farigiraf itself benefits from partners that can help it set Trick Room, such as bulky Fake Out users like Incineroar and Rillaboom as well as redirectors like Amoonguss and the Ogerpon formes. Trick Room sweepers also like having Farigiraf as a partner; for example, Calyrex-I loves the boost from Helping Hand, and so does Ursaluna-B. Another great partner is Iron Hands on the aforementioned Miraidon teams, as Farigiraf enjoys having a Fake Out user as a partner, and its Helping Hand lets Iron Hands do insane levels of damage with Quark Drive.

Throat Spray.description:
Farigiraf functions well as a supportive and offensive Pokemon. After a Throat Spray boost, Psychic OHKOes Amoonguss and 2HKOs Flutter Mane. Twin Beam reliably OHKOes Focus Sash and Psychic-weak Pokemon like Urshifu-R and Mienshao. Hyper Voice deals consistent damage and activates Throat Spray. The EV spread allows Farigiraf to survive Adamant Koraidon’s Flare Blitz and Kyogre’s Water Spout. Throat Spray powers up Farigiraf's already powerful attacks after a Hyper Voice. This allows it to then pick up KOs on foes like Koraidon. Tera Fairy is used on Farigiraf to resist powerful super effective attacks from Dark-types like Urshifu-S and Chi-Yu along with Fairy being a great neutral type in the metagame. Tera Normal sheds Farigiraf's Dark weakness and allows it to deal massive damage with Hyper Voice, 2HKOing on Pokemon like Miraidon and Clefairy.

Farigiraf has to be careful of powerful Dark-type attacks from Chi-Yu and Incineroar. A great partner for Farigiraf is Kyogre because it appreciates Farigiraf blocking powerful Grassy Glides and Thunderclaps as well as Fake Out. Other Pokemon like Incineroar and Rillaboom are also great partners, as they offer Fake Out support, allowing Farigiraf to set up Trick Room and, through Hyper Voice, Throat Spray. Urshifu-R is another amazing partner because it can hit the annoying Steel- and Dark-types that keep Farigiraf in check while also synergizing well with the aforementioned partners. It also appreciates Farigiraf's nullification of Fake Out, Thunderclap, and Grassy Glide as well as it removing Amoonguss.

Offensive.description:
• Hyper Voice activates Throat Spray to inflict a lot of damage and boost subsequent Psychics. Psyshock deals less damage than Psychic overall, but it allows Farigiraf to hit Flutter Mane and Assault Vest Pokemon like Rillaboom harder.

  • Throat Spray allows Farigiraf to put really good amounts of pressure unlike other Trick Room setters. Life Orb allows for more immediate damage and more pivoting ability, as you wont lose the damage boost when switching out, but provides less damage overall.

  • The HP and Special Defense EVs allow Farigiraf to survive Tera Fairy Moonblast from Choice Specs Flutter Mane, Tera Normal Helping Hand-boosted Hyper Voice from Life Orb Ursaluna-B, as well as non-Tera Life Orb Blood Moon. The heavy amount of Special Attack investment allows Farigiraf to serve its role as an offensive Pokemon very well, especially after a Throat Spray boost. The Defense investment allows Farigiraf to take Surging Strikes from Tera Water Choice Scarf Urshifu-R.

Assault Vest.description:
Kingambit is a slow attacker that uses its good bulk and typing to tank hits from Pokemon like Calyrex-S, Lunala, and Terapagos, then respond with Dark- and Steel-type STAB attacks. Sucker Punch gives Kingambit a priority attack that it can use to get around its low Speed and that threatens Pokemon like the Calyrex formes. Tera Blast pairs with Tera Fairy to hit the Pokemon that wall Kingambit such as Urshifu-R and Iron Hands as well as Pokemon like Miraidon and Urshifu-S, while Low Kick is used to hit Pokemon that resist Steel- and Dark-type attacks such as Incineroar and Zamazenta-C. Assault Vest lets it survive attacks like Mystic Water Kyogre's Water Spout as well as getting 4HKOed by Calyrex-S's Astral Barrage most of the time. Tera Fairy gives Kingambit a resistance to Fighting-type attacks in addition to being a good defensive type that is neutral to most of the metagame.

Kingambit struggles into bulky Pokemon like Amoonguss and Incineroar that can easily survive an attack and respond with status moves like Will-O-Wisp or Spore. Offensive partners like Ursaluna-B and Miraidon help with this by threatening to OHKO Amoonguss and Incineroar, allowing Kingambit to clean up an endgame with Sucker Punch. Urshifu-R is another check for Kingambit, as it resists Kingambit's STAB attacks and can threaten it with Close Combat. Miraidon can threaten Pokemon like Mienshao and the Urshifu formes that threaten Kingambit. Miraidon also has the added benefit of blocking Spore from Amoonguss with Electric Terrain, which allows Kingambit to play more offensively. Calyrex-S is a good partner for Kingambit, as it appreciates Kingambit helping into opposing Calyrex-S and opposing Incineroar while Calyrex-S can threaten the Fighting-types that Kingambit struggles with like Mienshao. Calyrex-I can set Trick Room that Kingambit works well in while Calyrex-I threatens Amoonguss. Farigiraf is a good partner for Kingambit, as it prevents Fake Out and can set Trick Room for Kingambit while Incineroar, a Pokemon Farigiraf struggles with, doesn't want to switch into Kingambit and give it a Defiant boost.

Offensive.description:
• Kingambit is easily able to steamroll through teams, having a great typing both offensively and defensively and easily defeating metagame staples like Gholdengo as well as decimating foes thanks to Swords Dance. Swords Dance bolsters Kingambit's Attack such that it can pick up OHKOs on bulky Pokemon such as Rillaboom, Ursaluna-B, and Amoonguss using Kowtow Cleave, with the latter two requiring Tera Dark.

  • Sucker Punch compensates for Kingambit's low Speed while also immediately either forcing out or pinning Choice item attackers and Assault Vest users. On top of that, Sucker Punch can cause mind games, with Kingambit potentially just using Kowtow Cleave while forcing a switch with the threat of Sucker Punch. Low Kick can defeat Tyranitar and opposing Kingambit as well as Incineroar. Iron Head can be used as coverage for Dark-resistant Pokemon like Primarina and Sneasler, but it's generally harder to pilot and use.

  • Black Glasses is used to boost the main two moves on Kingambit, Kowtow Cleave and Sucker Punch. It allows +2 Kowtow Cleave to OHKO Rillaboom outright and Archaludon with Tera Dark as well as letting Kingambit pick off Volcarona with a +2 Sucker Punch. Safety Goggles stops Sucker Punch from getting redirected and negated by Rage Powder, which can be a huge issue for Kingambit. Safety Goggles can also deny Spore, allowing Kingambit to use Amoonguss to set up. Safety Goggles can miss key OHKOs on the Pokemon shown in the aforementioned calculations.

  • Tera Dark boosts Kingambit's damage further, allowing for OHKOs on Maushold and Gholdengo with Sucker Punch, as well as removing Kingambit's Fire weakness and 4x Fighting weakness, proving to be useful against threats like Incineroar, which Kingambit otherwise struggles to get rid of, and certain Fighting-type coverage and Pokemon like opposing Kingambit's Low Kick and Annihilape, which otherwise OHKO Kingambit.

  • Kingambit is really difficult to stop after a Swords Dance boost and Terastallizing, OHKOing Ursaluna with Kowtow Cleave. This set struggles with four-moveslot syndrome, as having to pick between the flexibility of Swords Dance and a coverage move is difficult. Another issue that this set has is that it can be really difficult to take Dark-resistant Pokemon down, such as Incineroar. For this, setting up in front of another Pokemon or removing the Dark-resistant Pokemon can help Kingambit thrive.

Bulky Attacker.description:
• The given EV spread allows Kingambit to survive Life Orb Ursaluna-B's Earth Power or an Ivy Cudgel from Ogerpon-H as well as avoid the 3HKO from Raging Bolt's Thunderbolt. The Speed investment allows Kingambit to outspeed Landorus in tailwind.

  • Low Kick allows Kingambit to threaten Dark-Types such as Incineroar and opposing Kingambit; however, Tera Blast can also be used to cover for Dark- and Fighting-Types at the cost of needing to Terastallize.

Bulky Disruption.description:
Scream Tail is a bulky support Pokemon that uses its high Speed and disruption moves to punish opponents that hamper setup from Scream Tail's teammates. Encore allows Scream Tail to lock foes into passive moves such as Protect, Fake Out, and Taunt, giving its teammates opportunities to setup or attack as well as discouraging opponents from using the latter two moves to hinder setup. Disable is used similarly but can instead prevent opponents from going for attacks that would hit Scream Tail or its partners for large amounts of damage; Encore also disables moves that Pokemon are forced to use, either through Choice items or Scream Tail using Encore. Dazzling Gleam and Play Rough give Scream Tail a way to deal chip damage: Dazzling Gleam can bypass redirection from Pokemon like Amoonguss, while Play Rough can hit Pokemon such as Pelipper that use Wide Guard; both also potentially break a Focus Sash. Booster Energy allows Scream Tail to outspeed Pokemon like Calyrex-S and Choice Scarf Urshifu-R and threaten to use Disable and Encore. The Special Defense EVs allow Scream Tail to survive Calyrex-S's Astral Barrage or a Shadow Ball from Choice Specs Flutter Mane, while the Defense EVs let Scream Tail almost always survive one Wood Hammer from Choice Band Rillaboom. The Speed EVs let Scream Tail outspeed Adamant Choice Scarf Urshifu as well as Calyrex-S. Tera Grass allows Scream Tail to become immune to Spore and Rage Powder from Amoonguss.

Scream Tail partners well with Terapagos because it is a bulky setup sweeper that benefits from Scream Tail slowing down the pace of the game and discouraging opponents from using Fake Out, Taunt, and other moves that would prevent it from setting up Calm Mind. Raging Bolt, Rillaboom, and Incineroar are strong with Scream Tail, as it discourages opponents from using Protect in front of Protect, Grassy Glide, and Fake Out, respectively. Scream Tail struggles against Pokemon that carry Taunt, such as Incineroar and Tornadus, as they make it functionally useless and force Scream Tail to switch out, burning its Booster Energy. It is also extremely passive and reliant on its teammates to cover for its lack of damage output.

Support.description:
• Booster Energy allows Scream Tail to outspeed most of the metagame and launch fast Encores and Disables.

  • Dazzling Gleam is used to chip low-health targets. Disable and Encore are great supportive tools to disrupt foes and can punish passive play.

  • The EV spread allows it to survive Choice Specs Flutter Mane Shadow Ball while comfortably taking a Tera Water Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R and Tera Dark Wicked Blow from Urshifu-S.

  • Tera Dark is preferred for Prankster Taunt immunity and a Ghost resistance. Alternatively, Tera Grass can be used to provide immunity to powder moves from Amoonguss.

Offensive Speed Control.description:
Flutter Mane's excellent Ghost / Fairy typing that offers an immunity to Fake Out, its Protosynthesis ability and Booster Energy allowing it to gain a Speed boost, and its vast movepool including Speed-reducing moves such as Icy Wind and Thunder Wave help Flutter Mane function as an excellent speed control Pokemon in Regulation G. Flutter Mane is especially effective against Pokemon that rely on their speed, such as Choice Scarf Urshifu-R and Calyrex-S, as it can threaten to OHKO or slow them down before they move. Taunt can be used instead of Shadow Ball to shut down support Pokemon like Amoonguss and Clefairy, as well as prevent Terapagos from setting up. Flutter Mane can also opt for Thunder Wave to reduce the Speed of Clear Amulet and Covert Cloak Pokemon such as Koraidon and Calyrex-S. Icy Wind is mandatory for Flutter Mane to play as speed control, slowing down both opposing Pokemon while also breaking Focus Sash from the likes of Chien-Pao and the Urshifu formes. Booster Energy allows Flutter Mane to outspeed the entire metagame and become a stronger form of speed control. The EV spread enables Flutter Mane to survive strong physical attacks such as Calyrex-I's Glacial Lance, Adamant Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash, and almost always Adamant Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes. The Special Defense lets it take Volt Switch from Modest Choice Specs Miraidon and Blood Moon from Ursaluna-B. Meanwhile, the Speed investment lets Flutter Mane outspeed neutral nature base 135 Speed Pokemon like Miraidon and Chien-Pao. Tera Fairy is great on Flutter Mane to shed its weakness to Ghost-type attacks such as Astral Barrage from Calyrex-S and boost its damage output, allowing Flutter Mane to threaten a potential OHKO on Miraidon and ensure a 2HKO on Raging Bolt.

Flutter Mane struggles against bulky physical attackers like Assault Vest Rillaboom and Iron Hands, which can sponge its attacks, don't mind becoming slower, and threaten an OHKO in return. Zacian-C and Zamazenta-C are major issues in a similar way, but they don't enjoy having their Speed reduced. Flutter Mane also struggles to keep up with more immediate speed control, specifically Prankster Tailwind from Tornadus and Whimsicott, that may allow slower Pokemon like Urshifu-R and Miraidon to threaten it. Flutter Mane pairs well with a variety of Pokemon, namely offensive Pokemon that can utilize its speed control. Chi-Yu exploits this especially well, threatening Zacian-C, Zamazenta-C, and Rillaboom with Heat Wave and Overheat. Chi-Yu also makes up for Flutter Mane's lack of offensive investment with Beads of Ruin and appreciates Flutter Mane's ability to threaten Dragon-types. Choice Specs Terapagos is an excellent asset for this duo, as it takes advantage of how often Flutter Mane and Chi-Yu can force Terastallization. Zamazenta-C can protect Flutter Mane from threatening spread moves such as Astral Barrage and Glacial Lance from the Calyrex formes. Terapagos and Zamazenta-C also appreciate Flutter Mane's speed control making up for their mediocre speed tiers, and its Fairy typing that threatens Koraidon.

Glass Cannon.description:
Flutter Mane is a supportive special attacker that functions well on sun teams. Since Flutter Mane is immune to Fake Out, it can ignore the threat of Fake Out to use Taunt on Pokemon such as Calyrex-I or Amoonguss as well as being able to attack without having to fear the chip damage that the move does. Flutter Mane can use support moves such as Taunt over Shadow Ball to prevent opposing Pokemon like Calyrex-I or Amoonguss from setting Trick Room or using moves like Spore, respectively. When paired with Pokemon that set sun such as Koraidon or Groudon, Flutter Mane can use Protosynthesis to boost its Speed and use Icy Wind as a form of speed control, outspeeding and slowing down Pokemon such as Calyrex-S. Dazzling Gleam gives Flutter Mane a spread option that it can boost with Terastallization. Focus Sash lets Flutter Mane live a hit without needing to invest EVs in bulk. Tera Fairy and Stellar both allow Flutter Mane to OHKO Raging Bolt; Tera Stellar allows Shadow Ball to pick up KOs like those against all opposing Flutter Mane. However, Tera Fairy is more consistent, since it can use Fairy-type STAB moves without worrying about losing the boost.

Choice Scarf Urshifu-R threatens Flutter Mane when paired with Pokemon such as Tornadus or Pelipper that can set rain for it, removing both Flutter Mane's Speed boost and the sun. Assault Vest Rillaboom can take Flutter Mane's attacks, threaten it with Wood Hammer, and finish it off on the subsequent turn with Grassy Glide. Flutter Mane pairs well with Pokemon that can redirect attacks away from it such as Ogerpon and Amoonguss, since this allows it to maintain its Focus Sash and stay on the field longer. In addition to redirecting attacks, Amoonguss matches up well into Urshifu-R. Raging Bolt can remove Pokemon such as Urshifu-R that threaten Flutter Mane while also reliably switching into Rillaboom's Wood Hammer and Grassy Glide. Chi-Yu also benefits from Icy Wind speed control and threatens Rillaboom while also boosting Flutter Mane's damage with Beads of Ruin.

Choice Specs.description:
Flutter Mane works well as an offensive threat due to its great offensive typing and Speed, allowing it to outspeed most of the metagame and do notable damage to Pokemon like Koraidon, Miraidon, and both Calyrex and Urshifu formes. Shadow Ball and Moonblast are strong STAB moves, and Dazzling Gleam provides strong spread damage. Power Gem provides good coverage for Fire-type Pokemon like Incineroar and Ogerpon-H, Taunt is a good way to shut down support Pokemon like Amoonguss and Farigiraf, and Icy Wind is great speed control. Choice Specs increases Flutter Mane's offense even further, as it can OHKO Pokemon such as Assault Vest Raging Bolt. The EV spread allows Flutter Mane to outspeed Chien-Pao, Koraidon, and Miraidon without Speed-boosting natures and live an Ice Spinner from Adamant Chien-Pao. Tera Fairy is great both offensively and defensively, as Flutter Mane could output more damage, resist Dark-type moves from the likes of Chien-Pao and Urshifu, and give Flutter Mane a neutrality to Ghost, allowing it to survive an Astral Barrage from Calyrex-S.

Pokemon that can outspeed and OHKO Flutter Mane, like Choice Scarf Urshifu-R and Calyrex-S, and Pokemon that can survive Flutter Mane STAB moves like Amoonguss are good checks to Flutter Mane. Flutter Mane's physical fraility is also a huge weakness, mostly fainting against a plethora of physical moves. Incineroar is a good teammate for Flutter Mane, as Intimidate can help Flutter Mane shore up its poor Defense while also having a resistance against Dark- and Ghost-type moves. Pokemon with the ability to set up the sun like Groudon and Koraidon are also good teammates for Flutter Mane, as it allows Protosynthesis to activate and heighten Flutter Mane's Speed stat.

Offensive.description:
• Flutter Mane is an effective cleaner thanks to Moonblast, which is its strongest STAB move, and Dazzling Gleam, which provides spread damage.

  • Special Attack Booster Energy is Flutter Mane's strongest boosting item if it wants to keep Protect. Fairy Feather can be used instead, allowing it to retain its offensive boosts when switching at the cost of damage.

  • The EV spread is built to survive an Ice Spinner from Jolly Chien-Pao and to outspeed Tornadus, with the remaining EVs boosting Flutter Mane's Special Attack

  • Flutter Mane appreciates Tera Fairy to further boost its damage on Moonblast and Dazzling Gleam . This also removes its Ghost weakness and makes it resist Dark-type attacks, allowing it to better deal with opposing Flutter Mane and survive a potential Sucker Punch from Pokemon like Kingambit.

Speed-Boosting Support.description:
• Flutter Mane requires Icy Wind to accomplish its role as speed control, forcing it to pick between Dazzling Gleam and Moonblast.

  • Speed Booster Energy allows Flutter Mane to outspeed the majority of the metagame.

  • With Booster Energy, Flutter Mane can outspeed opposing Chien-Pao at -1 and Modest Gholdengo in Tailwind. The defensive investment lets it survive Adamant Chien-Pao's Ice Spinner and Gholdengo's Make It Rain.

  • Tera Fairy is appreciated to gain more of an offensive presence and helps against opposing Flutter Mane, as Speed Booster Energy Flutter Mane is unable to OHKO opposing Flutter Mane with Shadow Ball.

Fast Support.description:
Iron Bundle finds itself a niche in the meta as an exceptionally fast supportive Pokemon, outspeeding Booster Energy Flutter Mane with Quark Drive while providing speed control and disruptive options. Icy Wind provides a consistent form of speed control, taking full advantage of Iron Bundle's role as one of the fastest Pokemon in the game. Encore threatens to punish Fake Out users as well as any setup attempts from the likes of Calyrex-S and Terapagos. Focus Sash is used to make up for Iron Bundle's lack of bulk, allowing it to survive an attack. Tera Ghost enables Iron Bundle to ignore Fake Out, preserving Focus Sash and allowing it to support the team unhindered.

Priority attackers like Rillaboom and Raging Bolt can threaten to KO Iron Bundle before it can move. Bulky Pokemon like Iron Hands don't care about Speed drops from Icy Wind, wall Iron Bundle's STAB moves, and are capable of OHKOing it, while Pokemon holding Clear Amulet or Covert Cloak like Koraidon and the Calyrex formes are unaffected by Iron Bundle's speed control. Miraidon compliments Iron Bundle exceptionally well by providing Electric Terrain to activate Quark Drive as well as threatening Koraidon and the Calyrex formes with Draco Meteor and Electro Drift, respectively. Meanwhile, Miraidon appreciates the speed control provided by Iron Bundle, allowing it to outspeed common threats such as Choice Scarf Tera Ground Chi-Yu, Zacian-C, and Calyrex-S after an Icy Wind, with Iron Bundle also punishing Fake Out, Protect, and setup attempts via Encore. Farigiraf is another great partner to block the aforementioned priority attacks, reverse opposing Trick Room, and threaten the Calyrex formes with Foul Play. Iron Hands, similar to Iron Bundle, takes advantage of Electric Terrain to bolster its offensive capabilities, but it also can use its amazing defenses to not only tank Raging Bolt's STAB moves while recovering with Drain Punch but also use its slow Speed to compete against Trick Room, which Iron Bundle struggles against.

Glass Cannon.description:
• Icy Wind is used for speed control, Hydro Pump is used as the main Water-STAB move, and Freeze-Dry is preferred to threaten common Water-types like Urshifu-R and Ogerpon-W.

  • Booster Energy is used to raise its Speed, which allows it to outspeed threats like Choice Scarf Urshifu-R, Booster Energy Flutter Mane, and Regidrago and Modest Landorus under Tailwind.

  • Tera Ghost is used for an immunity to threatening priority moves like Fake Out and Extreme Speed.

Bulky Attacker.description:
Iron Hands functions as a bulky attacker and pivot that provides support options such as Fake Out, and its STAB moves can handle prominent metagame staples like Incineroar and Urshifu formes. Iron Hands has a solid matchup against opposing Miraidon teams, as it is one of the few Pokemon capable of surviving a Hadron Engine-boosted Draco Meteor from Choice Specs Miraidon. In addition to that, Iron Hands matches up well against Terapagos and threatens it with Drain Punch. It also helps deal with Calyrex-I Trick Room teams by providing Fake Out support and utilizing its low speed to outspeed and KO Incineroar in Trick Room as well as trade decently with Calyrex-I in Electric Terrain by utilizing its Tera. Wild Charge is used over Thunder Punch, as it OHKOes Urshifu-R and, in Electric Terrain, 2HKOes Calyrex-I. The recoil damage can be compensated through Drain Punch recovery. Close Combat can be used on more offensively oriented teams to get some quick OHKOs on the likes of Incineroar, and Terapagos in Electric Terrain. Volt Switch is used so Iron Hands can be a slow pivot, which helps as a positioning tool. Ice Punch provides a way to 2HKO Amoonguss and Raging Bolt as well as OHKO the occasional Landorus.
