Meanwhile, Heavy Slam functions as a way to get quick KOs against the likes of Flutter Mane and Tera Fairy Calyrex-S outside of Electric Terrain. Assault Vest boosts Iron Hands's mediocre Special Defense stat. The defensive investment helps Iron Hands survive two Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R as well as two Body Presses from Zamazenta-C. Iron Hands's Special Defense is maximized to take full advantage of Assault Vest, while the Speed investment allows Iron Hands to outspeed Regidrago under Tailwind. The Attack EVs, meanwhile, ensure Quark Drive boosts its Attack stat even after an Intimidate. Tera Grass can be used to gain immunity to Spore and Rage Powder as well as a resistance to Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes and Landorus's Earth Power, whereas Tera Water gives Iron Hands an excellent defensive typing, allowing it to resist Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R and Glacial Lance from Calyrex-I. Tera Fairy is a solid defensive typing that is neutral into most of the metagame. Its immunity to Dragon helps as well when facing Miraidon and Regidrago.

Iron Hands is particularly weak to faster setup teams, with foes like Tera Grass Clefairy and Amoonguss that can take hits from Iron Hands and redirect its moves, allowing Calyrex-S to set up with Nasty Plot. Ground-type Pokemon such as Landorus and Groudon can wall Iron Hands and threaten to 2HKO it. As a physical attacker, Iron Hands naturally struggles against Intimidate users like Incineroar as well as Defense-boosting Pokemon like Zamazenta-C that can set up Iron Defense, essentially walling Iron Hands. Miraidon naturally complements Iron Hands thanks to its Hadron Engine, as well as functioning as a fast offensive attacker capable of OHKOing all of the aforementioned checks. Meanwhile, a Trick Room setter such as Farigiraf provides excellent speed control to take advantage of Iron Hands's mediocre Speed tier. Farigiraf prevents any opposing Pokemon from using Fake Out thanks to Armor Tail while also having access to Helping Hand, which further boosts Iron Hands's offensive capabilities. Slower powerhouses like Ursaluna-B complement Iron Hands by threatening Incineroar and Zamazenta-C, as well as forming a solid Trick Room core with Farigiraf. Pokemon that fit well on a slower playstyle like Incineroar and Amoonguss also work well with Iron Hands by providing Fake Out, Intimidate, redirection and recovery to form a well-rounded balance core.

Offensive Pivot.description:
• Drain Punch is used, as Assault Vest Iron Hands wants to keep staying on the field, Wild Charge is used as the most consistent Electric-Type STAB move, and finally Heavy Slam is used as coverage for Flutter Mane and as a strong neutral option.

  • The 252 Special Defense EVs are used to minimize the damage taken from threatening special attacks like Earth Power from Landorus or Moonblast from Flutter Mane. The Speed EVs are used to outspeed the Urshifu formes and Adamant Ogerpon formes in Tailwind.

  • Assault Vest helps Iron Hands's low Special bulk and allows it to take super effective hits better.

  • Tera Grass is used to resist moves from Electric-resistant Ground- and Grass-type foes such as Landorus, Rillaboom, and Ogerpon-W while also providing a powder move immunity from Amoonguss. Tera Fire can also be used to resist Fairy- and Fire-type moves from Flutter Mane and Ogerpon-H; however, this keeps the weakness to Landorus as well as adding a Water-type weakness.

Booster Energy.description:
Iron Jugulis's combination of good support tools in Snarl and Tailwind, great offensive typing, and powerful Hurricane make it a versatile utility attacker that works well in rain. Snarl provides Iron Jugulis with a damage reduction option that not only supports its team but also gives it a favorable matchup against the likes of Calyrex-S and Terapagos. Hurricane's pairing with rain gives Iron Jugulis the ability to consistently threaten Pokemon like the Urshifu formes and Rillaboom. Tailwind is a strong speed control option to help support both itself and its teammates. The Speed investment along with Booster Energy allows Iron Jugulis to outspeed Choice Scarf Urshifu-R. The defensive investment allows Iron Jugulis to survive Flare Blitz from Koraidon in sun, Moonblast from non-Choice Specs Flutter Mane, and Thunderbolt from Assault Vest Raging Bolt. Tera Water provides Iron Jugulis with a better defensive typing against matchups like Calyrex-I and Urshifu-R.

Iron Jugulis typically struggles versus powerful Electric-types like Miraidon and Booster Energy Raging Bolt, both of which threaten to OHKO it. Urshifu-R can also be a somewhat problematic matchup, threatening huge damage under rain with Surging Strikes and forcing Iron Jugulis to Terastallize. Assault Vest Kyogre is Iron Jugulis's best partner, providing rain for its Hurricane and benefitting greatly from Iron Jugulis's Tailwind. Kyogre's superb special bulk allows it to become untouchable on the special side when paired with Snarl, and, with Tera Grass, it can reliably deal with Electric-type threats. Urshifu-R is another great partner, as both it and Iron Jugulis are strong weather abusers that appreciate weather control, with Iron Jugulis covering for the Grass-types that Urshifu-R typically struggles against. Urshifu-R is a great beneficiary of Tailwind, which allows it to fire off fast Surging Strikes next to Iron Jugulis to exert offensive pressure. Iron Jugulis also pairs well with Incineroar thanks to Intimidate + Snarl being a particularly strong damage-reducing combination to cover a multitude of threats alongside Fake Out, which allows Iron Jugulis to set up Tailwind safely.

Tailwind Support.description:
• Snarl is helpful to slow down the plethora of strong special attackers in the format.

  • Booster Energy allows Iron Jugulis to fire off fast attacks like Snarl into opposing special attackers and set up Tailwind more easily, as well as outspeed threats such as Chien-Pao.

  • The bulk allows Iron Jugulis to survive a Extreme Speed from Choice Band Tera Normal Dragonite with Sword of Ruin active, as well as an Icicle Crash from a -1 Attack Chien-Pao. After a Snarl, Iron Jugulis lives a Dazzling Gleam from Choice Specs Tera Fairy Flutter Mane, as well as Thunderbolt from Raging Bolt.

  • Both Tera Poison and Steel are viable, but Poison is generally preferred thanks to the Fighting resistance and generally better synergy with Iron Jugulis's original type. In comparison, Tera Steel gives more resistances to powerful moves in the format like Blood Moon and Make It Rain, but it is weak to more types than Tera Poison.

Baxcalibur.overview:
• Baxcalibur's massive Attack stat, solid bulk, and STAB Ice-type moves allow it to apply immediate offensive pressure or set up to sweep. Landorus, Raging Bolt, Rillaboom, and Amoonguss fear its Ice-type STAB moves, and Incineroar and Ogerpon-W struggle to damage Baxcalibur, which opens up setup opportunities.

  • Incineroar, Rillaboom, Ogerpon-W, and Amoonguss are great teammates for Baxcalibur, providing Intimidate, Fake Out, Grassy Terrain, and redirection support to give it opportunities to set up Swords Dance and fire off its attacks. Baxcalibur also functions well on Pelipper + Archaludon rain teams, as it threatens Raging Bolt, Amoonguss, Landorus, and Rillaboom, all of which rain struggles against.

  • Steel-types like Kingambit and Gholdengo resist Baxcalibur's STAB attacks, which can hinder its ability to sweep or punch holes. In addition, the prevalence of Flutter Mane, Urshifu-R, and Urshifu-S can pressure it to Terastallize. Baxcalibur's low Speed can also make it struggle to keep up with offensive pressure from the opposing side.

Clear Amulet.description:
• With the given EV spread, Baxcalibur can outspeed -1 Landorus and survive Choice Band Wicked Blow from Urshifu-S, a Tera Stellar Sacred Sword from Chien-Pao, and a Dazzling Gleam from Choice Specs Flutter Mane.

  • Glaive Rush is Baxcalibur's best Dragon-type STAB because of its massive Base Power, with Protect offsetting the drawback. Ice Shard makes up for Baxcalibur's middling Speed tier and threatens Landorus. Icicle Crash is a good Ice-type STAB that has a chance to flinch the target. Swords Dance grants Baxcalibur a boosting move that makes it a more threatening Pokemon to the opposition.

  • Tera Poison grants Baxcalibur a to resistance Urshifu's Close Combat and Flutter Mane's Fairy-type moves while also being a great neutral type against the majority of the metagame.

  • Clear Amulet gives Baxcalibur an immunity to Intimidate from the likes of Incineroar and Hisuian-Arcanine. It also helps against Icy Wind from Flutter Mane and ElectroWeb from Assault Vest Raging Bolt.

  • Thermal Exchange prevents Baxcalibur from being burned by Wil-O-Wisp users like Incineroar in addition to deterring Ogerpon-H and Chi-Yu from using their Fire-type STAB moves.

Nasty Plot.description:
Nasty Plot Gholdengo is an amazing setup sweeper thanks to its excellent defensive typing, Make It Rain, and Good as Gold, which gives it an invaluable immunity to Spore from Amoonguss and Taunt. Gholdengo has good matchups into common Restricted Pokemon such as Calyrex-I and Zamazenta-C. Nasty Plot is used to allow Gholdengo to set up and sweep opposing teams. Leftovers gives Gholdengo more longevity, while Metal Coat is used so it can OHKO Flutter Mane with unboosted Make It Rain. The Special Attack investment allows Gholdengo to always 2HKO Zamazenta-C with +2 Shadow Ball, while the defensive investment allows Gholdengo to survive Origin Pulse from Mystic Water Kyogre and Flare Blitz from Incineroar. The Speed investment allows Gholdengo to outspeed Pelipper. Tera Normal is used to give Gholdengo an immunity to threatening Ghost-type moves such as Astral Barrage from Calyrex-S and Shadow Ball from Flutter Mane, while Tera Water is used because it is a good defensive typing overall while allowing Gholdengo to resist Fire-type attacks.

Common checks to Gholdengo consist of Incineroar, Chi-Yu, Assault Vest Raging Bolt, and Calyrex-S. Chi-Yu and Calyrex-S outspeed and threaten to OHKO Gholdengo. Assault Vest Raging Bolt easily shrugs off attacks from Gholdengo, while Incineroar walls it and can hit back with super effective Knock Off and Flare Blitz. Common partners for Gholdengo include Amoonguss, Incineroar, and Ogerpon-C, which help Gholdengo defensively by aiding in its setup with redirection and Pollen Puff healing as well as Fake Out and Intimidate, respectively. Urshifu-R and Pelipper are also great partners, as they can deal with Calyrex-S, Chi-Yu, and Incineroar thanks to Pelipper's combination of Drizzle, Wide Guard, and Weather Ball and Urshifu-R's ability to outspeed and threaten all three of them with Surging Strikes. Calyrex-I and Koraidon are strong Gholdengo partners, since Gholdengo can help deal with threats such as Zamazenta-C and Zacian-C and appreciates how the two threaten Incineroar. Koraidon especially appreciates Gholdengo, as it can take on Calyrex-I + Amoonguss teams incredibly well.

Choice Specs.description:
Gholdengo is a strong special attacker that uses its great ability to switch into moves like Amoonguss's Spore and Incineroar's Parting Shot, allowing it to attack without being slowed down. Gholdengo is also used as a check to Pokemon like Zamazenta-C and Zacian-C, since it walls them. Trick is used to cripple support and setup Pokemon like Amoonguss and Terapagos or force Pokemon that set Trick Room such as Calyrex-I to switch out. Nasty Plot gives Gholdengo the option to set up once it has used Trick. Power Gem hits Fire-types that resist Make It Rain such as Incineroar, Chi-Yu, and Ogerpon-H. Alternatively, Dazzling Gleam threatens Pokemon like Miraidon and Koraidon. Choice Specs allows Gholdengo to use its strong Steel- and Ghost-type attacks to immediately threaten Pokemon like Calyrex-I, especially if it uses Tera Steel. The EV spread allows Gholdengo to survive Choice Specs Miraidon's Volt Switch, Incineroar's Flare Blitz, and Kyogre's Mystic Water-boosted Origin Pulse and OHKO bulky Flutter Mane sets with Shadow Ball. The Speed EVs let it outspeed the Ogerpon formes when they are at -1. Tera Steel lets Gholdengo OHKO Landorus and Tera Fairy Assault Vest Raging Bolt, and if Gholdengo is paired with speed control providers such as Tailwind Tornadus and Icy Wind Flutter Mane, it can run it to boost Make It Rain even further. Tera Dragon allows Gholdengo to resist Fire-type attacks such as Koraidon's Flare Blitz and Groudon's Heat Crash as well as Miraidon's Electro Drift and Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes. Tera Water also lets Gholdengo resist Fire- and Water-type attacks like Kyogre's Water Spout and Koraidon's Flare Blitz while not making it weak to Ice- and Fairy-type attacks such as Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash and Flutter Mane's Moonblast.

Incineroar resists Gholdengo's STAB combination while threatening it with Flare Blitz and Knock Off. Chi-Yu similarly checks Gholdengo while also outspeeding and threatening an OHKO on it with Dark Pulse or Overheat. Assault Vest Raging Bolt resists Make It Rain and avoids the 2HKO from Shadow Ball. As for teammates, Gholdengo pairs well with Terapagos, since Gholdengo walls Zamazenta-C, while Terapagos matches up well against Calyrex-S and can switch into Ghost-type attacks. Gholdengo also pairs well with Calyrex-I, since it can check Zamazenta-C and Zacian-C, which Calyrex-I struggles with. Gholdengo additionally has great synergy with Pelipper due to rain reducing Gholdengo's weakness to Fire and Pelipper threatening Fire-types that resist Make It Rain such as Incineroar and Chi-Yu. Finally, Chien-Pao and Calyrex-I are both good partners for Gholdengo, since they can threaten Raging Bolt.

Bulky Setup Sweeper.description:
• Gholdengo leverages its immunities and resistances from its typing and ability to set up with Nasty Plot and sweep with Make It Rain.

  • Leftovers increases Gholdengo's survivability, while Metal Coat and Life Orb allow Gholdengo to start attacking without needing a turn to setup. Metal Coat is preferred on sets that still lean on Nasty Plot, while Life Orb sets play more like a Choice Specs set that has the option to switch moves and punish passive turns with Nasty Plot.

  • Tera Dragon allows Gholdengo to resist Fire- and Water-type attacks like Flare Blitz from Incineroar and Wave Crash from Basculegion, allowing it to set up with Nasty Plot or to start attacking after getting a boost. Tera Steel Gholdengo is typically run with Life Orb to let it pick up OHKOs on Pokemon like Primarina and Amoonguss when paired with Nasty Plot.

  • The Speed investment lets Gholdengo outspeed bulky Volcarona, while the bulk investment lets it survive Wave Crash from Choice Band Basculegion-M and Tera Dark Throat Chop from Sneasler. A Modest nature lets Metal Coat Gholdengo OHKO Ursaluna-B with Make It Rain, while a Timid nature paired with 164 Speed EVs allows it to outspeed all opposing Modest Gholdengo.

  • Pros:

  • Setup Gholdengo can easily run away with the game if its given a turn to set up.

  • Setup Gholdengo can also afford to run more bulk investment, as it can increase its Special Attack.

  • Cons:

  • Requiring a turn to set up can lead to Gholdengo being OHKOed or heavily chipped before it can start doing damage.

  • Teams featuring Nasty Plot Gholdengo often have to include more support Pokemon such as Amoonguss and Electabuzz in order to get the most value out of it, as they ensure Gholdengo will have a safe chance to set up.

All Out Attacker.description:
• Choice Specs Gholdengo uses its high Special Attack stat, decent Speed, and powerful spread move to severely dent the opposing team.

  • Thunderbolt is a good coverage option for Gholdengo to threaten Water-types that resist Make It Rain like Pelipper. Power Gem also allows Gholdengo to threaten Incineroar while still threatening Pelipper. Trick works well with Gholdengo's immunity to Fake Out to allow it to shut down setup strategies or to force Trick Room setters like Porygon2 to switch out.

  • Tera Steel maximizes Gholdengo's damage output with Make It Rain, letting it do as much damage as possible before being knocked out and allowing it to pick up OHKOs on Pokemon such as Ursaluna-B.

  • A Timid nature lets Gholdengo outspeed Modest Glimmora and Basculegion, while a Modest nature guarantees the OHKO against bulky Annihilape with Shadow Ball.

  • Pros:

  • Choice Specs Gholdengo has a very high initial damage output, not requiring the setup turn that plagues the Nasty Plot set.

  • Teams without a bulky Pokemon that resists Make It Rain can quickly be blown away.

  • Cons:

  • Choice Specs Gholdengo's inability to switch moves and lack of setup can cause its Special Attack to quickly plummet if it tries to spam Make It Rain against Pokemon like Incineroar and Kingambit. This causes it to often have to switch out, losing momentum.

Bulky Support.description:
Wo-Chien is a multifaceted support Pokemon that uses its ability and support toolkit to neutralize opposing threats. Leech Seed and Ruination allow it to chip down foes. Pollen Puff lets Wo-Chien do the reverse and heal up its allies. Snarl weakens special attackers unaffected by Tablets of Ruin, breaks Focus Sashes, and deals serious chip damage to Calyrex-S. Foul Play punishes physical attackers that boost their Attack stats to get around Tablets of Ruin while threatening both Calyrex formes. Wo-Chien generally runs Leftovers but can also run Sitrus Berry to avoid getting 2HKOed by Moonblast from Booster Energy Flutter Mane. The Speed EVs allow Wo-Chien to outspeed bulky Kyogre; this allows it to boost Kyogre's Water Spout damage by using Pollen Puff on it before it can move. With 44 Defense EVs, Wo-Chien almost always survives Adamant Close Combat from Urshifu, and the rest of its EVs are invested in Special Defense. Tera Poison gives Wo-Chien resistances to Fighting-, Fairy-, and Bug-type moves that would normally threaten it and a strong defensive typing. Tera Water gives Wo-Chien resistances to Fire- and Ice-type moves and a similarly useful typing.

Wo-Chien struggles into special attackers that can hit it super-effectively such as Tornadus, Flutter Mane, and Amoonguss. It is also chipped heavily by U-turn from Pokemon such as Rillaboom and Urshifu-R. Wo-Chien is almost always paired with Kyogre, which appreciates Tablets of Ruin boosting its Defense and getting its Water Spouts powered up by fast Pollen Puffs. Wo-Chien is also often partnered with Incineroar and Grimmsnarl; Grimmsnarl can boost Wo-Chien's defenses further through its screens and weaken special attackers with Spirit Break, while Incineroar helps Wo-Chien stay on the field longer with Fake Out, Intimidate, and Parting Shot and matches up favorably into several Pokemon Wo-Chien struggles with, such as Amoonguss and Chien-Pao.

Glass Cannon.description:
Chien-Pao is a fast physical attacker that uses its good Speed tier and strong STAB attacks to threaten popular Pokemon like Koraidon, Miraidon, and Calyrex-S. Ice Spinner is used as a consistent Ice-type STAB move that can remove Terrains that Pokemon like Indeedee-F, Miraidon, and Rillaboom set up. Removing Psychic Terrain can allow Chien-Pao to threaten Calyrex-S with a super effective Sucker Punch. Alternatively, Icicle Crash hits less consistently, but it avoids Rocky Helmet damage, can cause foes to flinch, and keeps up Terrains that would benefit Chien-Pao. Sucker Punch gives Chien-Pao a priority option that can KO faster Pokemon such as Speed Booster Energy Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle. Sacred Sword allows Chien-Pao to hit Pokemon that resist its STAB moves like Incineroar and Zamazenta-C. Chien-Pao can run Throat Chop as a consistent Dark-type STAB attack that can hit Lunala and Calyrex-S even if they didn't use an attacking move. Throat Chop also prevents Incineroar from using Parting Shot. Focus Sash allows Chien-Pao to survive at least one attack and to give it the opportunity to use another move due to its high Speed. Chien-Pao can use Tera Ghost to become immune to Fighting while also avoiding priority attacks like Fake Out and Extreme Speed that would otherwise break its Focus Sash. Tera Stellar is a more offensive option that allows Chien-Pao to pick up KOs that it would otherwise miss out on like bulky Flutter Mane.

The best check for Chien-Pao is Incineroar, as it resists both STAB types and packs Intimidate. Zacian-C also resists Chien-Pao's STAB moves and threatens it with all of its attacks. Choice Scarf Urshifu-R and Flutter Mane can threaten to bring Chien-Pao down to Focus Sash or OHKO it, with the former resisting Chien-Pao's STAB combination and the latter also threatening to slow it down with Icy Wind. Chien-Pao pairs well with physical attackers like Zacian-C and Rillaboom, as Sword of Ruin makes them even more potent threats and they can handle Urshifu-R and Flutter Mane for Chien-Pao. However, they also struggle against Incineroar and opposing Zacian-C. This makes Urshifu-R and Zamazenta-C also good options for Chien-Pao, since they can threaten Incineroar and Zacian-C while taking advantage of Sword of Ruin. Chien-Pao can threaten Grass- and Dragon-types that resist Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes such as Rillaboom and Raging Bolt, as well as making quick work of Ghost-types that are immune to Body Press such as Calyrex-S.

Support.description:
Ting-Lu finds its niche as a bulky support Pokemon due to Vessel of Ruin, impressive defenses, and great natural typing. It is able to slow down powerful special attackers like Terapagos with Snarl and use its typing to have a positive matchup against Calyrex-S, Miraidon, and Raging Bolt. Ruination provides constant damage, while Throat Chop can threaten to OHKO Calyrex-S and prevent Parting Shot from Incineroar. Stomping Tantrum allows it to threaten Incineroar, Miraidon, and Raging Bolt. Heavy Slam is used on Assault Vest sets to threaten Fairy-type Pokemon like Flutter Mane and Tera Fairy Calyrex-S, whereas Protect sees play on Rocky Helmet sets. Assault Vest allows Ting-Lu to bolster its special bulk even more, making special attacks like Flutter Mane's Moonblast and Calyrex-S's Draining Kiss a 4HKO. Rocky Helmet threatens constant chip damage on Pokemon like Urshifu-R. The EV investment allows Ting-Lu to survive a Wood Hammer from Assault Vest Rillaboom and take two Moonblast from Speed Booster Energy Flutter Mane for the Rocky Helmet set. The Attack investment allows Ting-Lu to OHKO Flutter Mane with Heavy Slam and to 2HKO Raging Bolt and bulky Farigiraf with Stomping Tantrum and Throat Chop, respectively. Tera Poison is utilized to resist the Urshifu formes's Close Combat, Rillaboom's STAB moves, and Flutter Mane's Moonblast. Tera Fairy sees usage thanks to its defensive nature, allowing Ting-Lu to have great matchup into the Urshifu formes while also becoming immune to Draco Meteor from Raging Bolt and Miraidon.

Ting-Lu sees usage with Restricted Pokemon like Calyrex-I and Zamazenta-C, allowing both to benefit from Ting-Lu's special damage reduction capabilities. Calyrex-I appreciates Ruination chip and Ting-Lu benefits from Trick Room set by Calyrex-I, while Zamazenta-C provides Wide Guard support, improving the matchup against opposing Calyrex-I. Ting-Lu can be slowed down by Pokemon like Incineroar, which makes Ting-Lu passive by reducing its damage output significantly thanks to Intimidate. Zamazenta-C helps in this regard because it can OHKO Incineroar with Body Press. Koraidon, Zamazenta-C, and Calyrex-I have a great matchup into Ting-Lu and are able to remove it from the field without taking much damage from its STAB moves. Therefore, Pelipper proves to be a great partner for Ting-Lu, providing rain support and Wide Guard, which slow down Pokemon like Koraidon and Calyrex-I, and threatening great damage on Incineroar with Weather Ball. Ting-Lu struggles against strong super effective attacks from Pokemon like Rillaboom, Kyogre, and the Urshifu formes. Raging Bolt is a great partner to Ting-Lu, as it can threaten Urshifu-R and Kyogre for super effective damage and resist Grass-type STAB moves from Rillaboom. Incineroar and Amoonguss are a great duo that support Ting-Lu well. Incineroar slows down Rillaboom thanks to Intimidate and threatens super effective damage with Flare Blitz. Amoonguss can redirect super effective moves like Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R and provide Pollen Puff healing. Ting-Lu, in return, checks Pokemon like Chi-Yu and Flutter Mane, which can be troublesome for Amoonguss.

Sand Tomb Support.description:
• Sand Tomb is able to trap in opponents so they can't escape disruption like Yawn. Ruination and Rocky Helmet act as the main damage dealing methods, with Stomping Tantrum used as its STAB move and Body Press as a consistent source of damage when Intimidated. Taunt can be used to shut down Amoonguss and other status moves.

  • The Special Defense investment allows Ting-Lu to live Moonblast from Choice Specs Tera Fairy Flutter Mane. The Defense investment allows Ting-Lu to survive Wood Hammer from Rillaboom and Ivy Cudgel from a Terastallized Ogerpon-W.

  • Tera Poison is the most consistent Tera type for Ting-Lu, as it provides a resistance to Flutter Mane's Moonblast, the STAB moves of Rillaboom, and Close Combat from the Urshifu formes.

Bulky Attacker.description:
• Heavy Slam allows Ting-Lu to OHKO Flutter Mane, while Ruination and Body Press provide consistent damage. Alternatively, Throat Chop can be used as a reliable Dark-Type STAB move that can also prevent Parting Shot from Incineroar and Hyper Voice from Ursaluna-B.

  • Ting-Lu uses Assault Vest to bolster its special bulk. The EV spread allows Ting-Lu to survive 3 Moonblasts from Flutter Mane, and it also almost always lives Surging Strikes from Tera Water Urshifu-R. The Attack investment ensures an OHKO on Flutter Mane with Heavy Slam.

  • Tera Poison is the most consistent Tera type for Ting-Lu, as it provides a resistance to Flutter Mane's Moonblast, the STAB moves of Rillaboom, and Close Combat from the Urshifu formes.

Choice Item Attacker.description:
Chi-Yu is a phenomenal glass cannon; it has a strong offensive typing and good Special Attack, aided by its ability. These qualities along with proper speed control allow it to pressure common metagame Pokemon including both Calyrex formes, Rillaboom, Amoonguss, and Zamazenta-C. Snarl threatens a common Restricted core that revolves around redirection—Calyrex and Clefairy—and it can be used to chip away and weaken the damage output of bulkier specially offensive threats like Raging Bolt and Terapagos. Choice Specs allows Chi-Yu to pick up OHKOs on Pokemon like Assault Vest Rillaboom and Calyrex-I with Heat Wave and bulky Pelipper with Dark Pulse. Choice Scarf enables Chi-Yu to outspeed common fast metagame staples such as Chien-Pao, Calyrex-S, and Flutter Mane without Protosynthesis Speed activated. The defensive investment guarantees that Chi-Yu survives Surging Strikes and Tera Water Aqua Jet from Urshifu-R when Chi-Yu has used Tera Ghost, High Horsepower from most Assault Vest Rillaboom, and Tera Starstorm from Terapagos-S at +2. The Speed EVs allow Chi-Yu to outspeed maximum Speed Adamant Urshifu formes, and it also outspeeds Caylrex-S if running Choice Scarf. Special Attack EVs allow Choice Scarf Chi-Yu to threaten an OHKO on Ogerpon-H with Overheat. Tera Ghost is absolutely necessary for Chi-Yu because it can avoid Fake Out and Fighting-type moves like Body Press from Zamazenta-C.

Incineroar completely walls Chi-Yu and is able to pivot in and out with Parting Shot, while Urshifu-R is able to simply tank a hit and OHKO Chi-Yu. Kyogre and Pelipper are also definite Chi-Yu answers, as they weaken its Fire-type moves with Drizzle and can retaliate with an OHKO with Water Spout or Origin Pulse and Weather Ball, respectively. Chi-Yu has a plethora of great partners; Choice Specs Terapagos and Miraidon both take great advantage of the power boost provided by Beads of Ruin and are able to pressure Pokemon like Kyogre and Incineroar. Koraidon is another good partner for it because it sets up the sun, overriding rain from Pelipper and Kyogre and boosting Chi-Yu's Fire-type attacks. This also mitigates its weakness to Water-type moves, aiding in Chi-Yu's matchup against the aforementioned threats. Chi-Yu can also function by itself with speed control from Prankster Tailwind setters like Whimsicott and Tornadus, which can also set up the sun.

Glass Cannon.description:
Chi-Yu is an incredibly strong special attacker, and because of its ability Beads of Ruin, it's able to support other special attacking teammates while still dealing a lot of damage. It matches up well against some common restricted Pokemon such as both Calyrex formes and Zamazenta-C and it can also pressure common Pokemon such as Rillaboom, Gholdengo, and Amoonguss with its STAB moves. Snarl keeps special attacking threats such as Calyrex-S and Terapagos in check and still does respectable spread damage, while Dark Pulse provides strong and consistent damage. Overheat is an instant burst of damage that allows Chi-Yu to OHKO even bulky threats like Rillaboom and Zamazenta-C while also getting around Wide Guard. Since it is very frail, Focus Sash helps Chi-Yu survive for longer, whereas Life Orb gives it a significant damage boost, allowing it to OHKO Flutter Mane with Overheat and 2HKO Miraidon with Dark Pulse. Tera Ghost allows it to avoid Fake Out and gain an immunity to otherwise threatening Fighting-type attacks from Koraidon and the Urshifu formes.

Chi-Yu pairs well with strong special attackers such as Flutter Mane and Terapagos, since both of them benefit a lot from Beads of Ruin. Chi-Yu struggles with its average Speed stat and appreciates speed control from Tornadus, since it allows Chi-Yu to outspeed threats such as Koraidon, Miraidon, Flutter Mane, and Calyrex-S and deal respectable amount of damage with Beads of Ruin-boosted Bleakwind Storm. Chi-Yu also has problems with Urshifu-R, since it can switch-in on both Heat Wave and Dark Pulse and OHKO Chi-Yu back with Surging Strikes. Amoonguss helps with that issue, by redirecting away Fighting- and Water-type attacks from Urshifu-R, letting Chi-Yu deal damage more consistently. Pelipper is a strong Chi-Yu answer, since it sets up rain and is able to protect teammates from Chi-Yu's attacks with Wide Guard. Incineroar and Assault Vest Raging Bolt can take hits from it easily, meaning that the former can pivot out with Parting Shot and the latter is able to use Snarl, do high damage to it, or take advantage of Beads of Ruin and attack its partner.

Offensive Support.description:
Chi-Yu's excellent damage output, Beads of Ruin support, and great tools in Snarl and Taunt allow it to be especially strong against Amoonguss, Terapagos, and the Calyrex formes and grant Chi-Yu a unique niche as a supportive Pokemon in Regulation G. Snarl is preferred to weaken threats such as Terapagos, Calyrex-S, Raging Bolt, and opposing Chi-Yu; however, Chi-Yu can opt instead for Dark Pulse for a more consistent STAB option against Farigiraf and Pelipper. Overheat is used for burst damage, enabling Chi-Yu to OHKO Calyrex-I and Assault Vest Rillaboom. Taunt is an excellent way for Chi-Yu to shut down Amoonguss as well as Trick Room from setters like Farigiraf and Calyrex-I. This is further enhanced by Covert Cloak's Fake Out immunity, and Covert Cloak also provides Chi-Yu with a valuable immunity to Snarl and Icy Wind stat drops. The EV spread allows Chi-Yu to survive Discharge from Choice Specs Miraidon, Earth Power from Choice Specs Terapagos, and after Terastallization, Close Combat from Urshifu-R. The Special Attack EVs with a Modest nature ensure an OHKO on Zamazenta-C with Overheat, and the Speed EVs enable Chi-Yu to outspeed Terapagos and Adamant Urshifu formes. Tera Water provides a resistance to Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes and Pelipper's Weather Ball while improving Chi-Yu's matchup against Calyrex-I.

Because Chi-Yu has relatively poor bulk and a mediocre Speed tier, it struggles with fast, powerful threats such as Miraidon, Choice Scarf Urshifu-R, Koraidon, and Chien-Pao. This makes Rillaboom an exceptional partner, as it can mitigate Miraidon's damage output and threaten Urshifu-R with Wood Hammer and priority Grassy Glide. Rillaboom also appreciates not only Chi-Yu's ability to threaten Steel- and Grass-types like Gholdengo and opposing Rillaboom but also its Taunt shutting down Will-O-Wisp and Parting Shot from Incineroar. Clefairy is also a good partner, enhancing Chi-Yu's bulk and redirecting away attacks to allow Chi-Yu to survive extra crucial turns against Urshifu-R and Chien-Pao. Calyrex-S is a great restricted partner, outspeeding and threatening Miraidon, Koraidon, and Chien-Pao, while also taking advantage of Beads of Ruin. Clefairy and Calyrex-S both appreciate how well Chi-Yu handles Amoonguss and Terapagos. Exceptionally bulky attackers like Kyogre and especially Assault Vest Iron Hands can exploit Chi-Yu's frail defenses, so the above mentioned Rillaboom can be a great help to threaten it and Iron Hands for major damage.

Choice Attacker.description:
• Snarl is used as utility and a way to check special attacking compositions such as Farigiraf + Ursaluna-B. Overheat is appreciated as a single target nuke, hitting almost twice as hard as Heat Wave.

  • Choice Specs is used to give Chi-Yu maximum offensive pressure and allow it to pick up OHKOes on Amoonguss and Kingambit with Heat Wave. Alternatively, Chi-Yu can opt for Choice Scarf to outspeed threats like Landorus, Chien-Pao, and Flutter Mane.

  • The HP EVs allow for Chi-Yu to avoid the 2HKO from Flutter Mane's Moonblast and once Terastallized into the Ghost-type, almost always survive -1 Adamant Chien-Pao's Sucker Punch. The Speed EVs allow Chi-Yu to outspeed the Adamant Urshifu formes.

  • Chi-Yu prefers Tera Ghost to remove its Fighting weakness and be immune to common priority moves like Fake Out and Extreme Speed, which is crucial to preserve momentum. Although Chi-Yu can utilize Tera Fire to significantly increase its damage output, allowing Choice Scarf Chi-Yu to OHKO Ogerpon-W and Flutter Mane with Overheat and Choice Specs variants to remove Assault Vest Kingambit and Rillaboom with Heat Wave.

Offensive Support.description:
Roaring Moon is a fast Tailwind user that utilizes its Speed, access to Knock Off, and Tera Flying Acrobatics to spread damage and check some of the most defining threats in the metagame such as both Urshifu formes, Calyrex-S, and Rillaboom. Its Speed with the Protosynthesis boost allows it to get the jump on Choice Scarf users such as Urshifu-R and Landorus and either remove their items with Knock Off or set up Tailwind so that its partners can outspeed and secure a KO. Its high special bulk allows it to function as a good check to special attacking Restricted Pokemon such as Kyogre, Terapagos, and Calyrex-S, with it being able to remove Leftovers on Calm Mind Kyogre or Terapagos and threaten to OHKO Calyrex-S with knock off before it Terastallizes. With the Speed investment, Roaring Moon outspeeds Timid Chi-Yu and Landorus as well as Modest Regieleki with Protosynthesis activated, and the Attack EVs allow Tera Flying Acrobatics to almost always OHKO the Urshifu formes. Finally, the bulk investment allows Terastallized Roaring Moon to survive two Astral Barrages from Calyrex-S, two Heat Waves from Chi-Yu, or Tera Water Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R. Tera Flying allows it to threaten an OHKO on Amoonguss, Rillaboom, and Ogerpon-H with STAB Acrobatics.

Roaring Moon has seen numerous top placements alongside Calm Mind Kyogre, which appreciates its fast Tailwind and Knock Off support, ability to hit Grass-types super effectively with Acrobatics, and capability to check Calyrex-S. It has also been used on Calyrex-S and Galarian Weezing compositions to help them work better against mirror matchups and as a fast Tailwind setter for Speed-invested Calyrex-I. Roaring Moon has a very hard time taking on Miraidon structures, with Choice Specs Miraidon being able to OHKO Roaring Moon with Dazzling Gleam before it Terastallizes, Electro Drift or Volt Switch after it Terastallizes, and Draco Meteor regardless. Roaring Moon also struggles with Iron Hands, as Iron Hands is able to take a hit and OHKO it in return. Speed Booster Energy Flutter Mane outspeeds Roaring Moon and threatens to OHKO it with Moonblast or reduce its Speed with Icy Wind and Thunder Wave. Roaring Moon also struggles defensively against Chien-Pao and Calyrex-I, which are able to hit it super effectively even if it's Terastallized, and Zamazenta-C, which OHKOs Roaring Moon with Body Press and does not take much damage from Tera Flying Acrobatics in return. Roaring Moon’s weakness to Zamazenta-C and Miraidon makes Landorus one of its premier partners for its ability to OHKO both Restricted Pokemon. Additionally, Roaring Moon appreciates strong offensive pieces such as Urshifu-R and Ogerpon-H that are able to handle Flutter Mane, Chien-Pao, and Calyrex-I when paired with its Tailwind or offensive support. Roaring Moon can also function alongside more defensive pieces such as Rillaboom, Incineroar, and Amoonguss that provide support in Fake Out, Intimidate, or Rage Powder and Spore, helping Roaring Moon to more effectively set Tailwind and spread damage safely.

Dragon Dance Sweeper.description:
• Dragon Dance allows Roaring Moon to be an effective sweeper and helps reset Intimidate Attack drops, making it harder to slow down.

  • Roaring Moon utilizes Attack Booster Energy to activate Acrobatics, allowing for an OHKO on many centralizing Fighting- and Grass-types, such as the various Urshifu and Ogerpon formes, as well as Amoonguss after Terastalization.

  • After Terastalization, the bulk investment allows Roaring Moon to always survive a Tera Water-boosted Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R and a Thunderclap from a Special Attack Booster Energy Raging Bolt. The Speed investment allows Roaring Moon to outspeed Adamant Urshifu formes.

  • Roaring Moon uses Tera Flying to obtain a resistance to Fighting-type moves and to gain STAB on Acrobatics.

Tailwind Support.description:
• Roaring Moon utilizes Breaking Swipe to weaken the metagame's plethora of physical attackers such as the Ogerpon formes and Rillaboom.

  • Roaring Moon uses Speed Booster Energy to outspeed the entire unboosted metagame and get off Tailwind and Breaking Swipe more consistently.

  • The HP combined with the Defense EVs allow for Roaring Moon to take Adamant Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash at -1. The Special Defense EVs allow Roaring Moon to almost always survive unboosted Flutter Mane's Dazzling Gleam, as well as a Dragon Pulse from Raging Bolt. The Speed investment lets Roaring Moon outspeed Speed Booster Energy Iron Crown, as well as Adamant Dragonite under Tailwind,

  • Roaring Moon uses Tera Poison to obtain resistances to Fairy- and Fighting-type moves it was originally weak to, which is also a great neutral typing into the metagame.

Disruptive Support.description:
Iron Valiant is a great support Pokemon that can make use of Quark Drive's Speed boost to use moves like Spirit Break, Coaching, and Encore before its foes can attack. These moves allow Iron Valiant to disrupt opposing teams while also benefitting its allies with Wide Guard and Coaching, giving it a strong supportive presence. Spirit Break reduces the damage of common special attackers like Miraidon, Calyrex-S, Terapagos, and Kyogre. Iron Valiant's fast Coaching increases the damage and bulk of allies such as Calyrex-I and Urshifu-R, allowing Calyrex-I to OHKO Flutter Mane and Calyrex-S with Glacial Lance and Urshifu-R to OHKO the same Pokemon as well as Chien-Pao and Ogerpon-C with Surging Strikes. The Defense boost allows Calyrex-I to live Ogerpon-C's Tera Rock Ivy Cudgel and Koraidon's Flare Blitz in the sun. Meanwhile, the boost lets Urshifu-R survive Iron Hands's Wild Charge and Roaring Moon's Tera Flying Acrobatics while making opposing Urshifu formes' Close Combat a 3HKO. Wide Guard is used to block spread moves like Astral Barrage from Calyrex-S, Glacial Lance from Calyrex-I,and Tera Starstorm from Terastallized Terapagos. Encore can make foes hesitate to use moves like Protect, Fake Out, and Nasty Plot, allowing its partners to function properly without being disrupted. This EV spread allows Iron Valiant to live Urshifu-R's Tera Water Surging Strikes, Calyrex-I's Glacial Lance at +1 Attack, Choice Scarf Landorus's Earth Power, Terapagos-S's Tera Stellar Tera Starstorm at +1 Special Attack, and Choice Specs Miraidon's Dazzling Gleam at -1 Special Attack. Tera Ghost allows Iron Valiant to become immune to Fake Out disruption, which is important because it doesn't have Protect.

Speed Booster Energy Flutter Mane is Iron Valiant's biggest threat, as it can move before it and OHKO with Moonblast. Taunt from Tornadus and Flutter Mane can prevent Iron Valiant from using its support moves. Fake Out from Pokemon much such as Rillaboom, Incineroar, and Iron Hands can disrupt Iron Valiant because it needs to Terastallize to avoid flinching, when other Pokemon would prefer to Terastallize. Iron Valiant pairs well with Pokemon that can take advantage of Coaching such as Calyrex-I and Urshifu-R. Iron Valiant also provides support for Amoonguss and Landorus because of its ability to weaken threats to them like Miraidon, Chi-Yu, and Calyrex-S while protecting them from spread moves like Glacial Lance and Origin Pulse.

Clear Amulet.description:
Koraidon is a strong and fast physical attacker that sets up sun to increase its damage and benefit its teammates. Thanks to its high Attack, it can threaten many Pokemon in the metagame such as Rillaboom, Urshifu-S, and Terapagos. Collision Course can threaten Incineroar and is Koraidon's preferred STAB move thanks to the lack of drawbacks. Flare Blitz can OHKO Amoonguss and Rillaboom. Flame Charge is used to deal chip damage and outspeed threats such as Calyrex-S and Choice Scarf Landorus. Clear Amulet blocks stat drops that would hinder or slow down Koraidon, such as Intimidate and Parting Shot from Incineroar and Icy Wind from Flutter Mane. The EV spread allows Koraidon to survive an Ice Spinner from Chien-Pao, a Glacial Lance from Calyrex-I, and a Helping Hand-boosted Astral Barrage from Spell Tag Calyrex-S. With a Jolly nature, Koraidon can outspeed maximum Speed Ogerpon, and with an Adamant nature, Koraidon can OHKO Zamazenta-C with Flare Blitz after Terastallizing. Tera Fire allows Koraidon to OHKO Calyrex-S while also granting defensive capabilities, allow Koraidon to resist Fairy- and Ice-type moves such as Moonblast from Flutter Mane and Glacial Lance from Calyrex-I.

Kyogre and Pelipper can replace Koraidon's sun with rain and threaten it with Ice Beam or Hurricane, respectively, or with Origin Pulse or Weather Ball if Koraidon has Terastallized. Flutter Mane outspeeds and threatens Koraidon via Moonblast and can also slow it down with Thunder Wave. Calyrex-I can Terastallize into a Fire-type to resist Flare Blitz or into a Fairy-type to resist Collision Course and remove its Fire weakness. Calyrex-I can also threaten Koraidon via Glacial Lance or, if Koraidon has Terastallized, High Horsepower. Flutter Mane is a solid partner for Koraidon, as Koraidon can boost its Speed under the sun, and Flutter Mane can help Koraidon outspeed foes with Icy Wind or Thunder Wave as well as reset sun with Sunny Day in the face of Kyogre and Pelipper. Raging Bolt resists both of Kyogre's and Pelipper's Water- and Flying-type moves while threatening them with its Electric-Type STAB attacks like Thunderbolt and Thunderclap. Ogerpon-C provides redirection and strong Rock- and Grass-type coverage that can pressure Calyrex-I and OHKO Kyogre and Pelipper. Entei can be used as a secondary single-target nuke that can OHKO Flutter Mane and threaten Calyrex-I with burns from Sacred Fire. Chi-Yu can support Koraidon with Snarl to devastate Calyrex-S or Taunt to deter status conditions such as Will-O-Wisp from Incineroar and Spore from Amoonguss while also launching powerful Heat Waves under sun. Ditto has a great matchup against the Calyrex formes, as it copies their potential stat boosts, reverses Trick Room in the face of Calyrex-I, and threatens Calyrex-S with an OHKO.

Life Orb.description: Life Orb and Close Combat are used on Koraidon to OHKO no bulk Miraidon.

Choice Specs.description:
Miraidon is a fast, hyper-offensive threat that can easily OHKO metagame staples such as Incineroar, Urshifu-R, and Raging Bolt while also dealing devastating spread damage with its high Special Attack further enhanced by Hadron Engine. Miraidon matches up well against Kyogre, Calyrex-I, and Zamazenta-C, threatening them before they can attack. Miraidon also shuts down Amoonguss with Electric Terrain from Hadron Engine, preventing disruption with Spore. Volt Switch, working in tandem with Miraidon's high Speed, allows it to pivot out before taking damage, increasing Miraidon's longevity and allowing it to reset Electric Terrain later against Rillaboom and Indeedee-F. Dazzling Gleam gives Miraidon an alternate spread damage attack that threatens Koraidon and Iron Hands. The given EV spread allows Miraidon to almost always survive Helping Hand-boosted Close Combat from Urshifu-R as well as +2 Astral Barrage from Calyrex-S. The Speed EVs allow Miraidon to outrun opposing Modest Miraidon, Adamant Koraidon, and Adamant Chien-Pao. Alternatively, an EV spread of 4 HP / 252 SpA / 252 Spe can be used with a Modest or Timid nature to maximize Miraidon's damage and Speed respectively. Choice Specs and Tera Electric further increases Miraidon's damage, with Tera Electric also removing weaknesses to attacks such as Glacial Lance and Moonblast from Calyrex-I and Flutter Mane, respectively. Tera Fairy removes Miraidon's weaknesses to Earth Power from Ursaluna-B and High Horsepower from Calyrex-I, provides it with a defensively neutral typing into most of the metagame, and boosts the damage of Dazzling Gleam.

Rillaboom is Miraidon's greatest adversary, capable of disrupting Miraidon with Fake Out and overriding Electric Terrain with Grassy Surge. Faster offensive Pokemon such as Calyrex-S, Zacian-C, and Chien-Pao also threaten Miraidon. Chi-Yu pairs well with Miraidon, threatening the aforementioned threats and increasing Miraidon's damage with Beads of Ruin. Farigiraf is an exceptional partner for Miraidon to block Fake Out from Rillaboom, Incineroar, and Iron Hands, allowing Miraidon to continue attacking without disruption, and it additionally takes little to no damage from Calyrex-S while threatening it with Foul Play. A partner Iron Hands threatens Chien-Pao and, thanks to having its damage increased by Miraidon's Electric Terrain, can significantly damage Incineroar even after Intimidate. Whimsicott supports Miraidon with priority Tailwind to boost Miraidon's Speed and Encore to threaten Fake Out users and setup Pokemon such as Nasty Plot Calyrex-S. Ursaluna-B is another good partner that threatens Calyrex-S and allows Miraidon to use Discharge safely thanks to its Ground typing. Volcarona also supports Miraidon well by threatening to OHKO or burn Zacian-C, Rillaboom, and Chien-Pao.

Walking Wake.overview:
• With an excellent typing and respectable stats, Walking Wake finds a place on sun teams using Protosynthesis to make up for its Speed tier while also 2HKOing most neutral targets with sun-boosted Hydro Steam and threatening common Pokemon like Incineroar and Landorus.

  • Walking Wake pairs well with Torkoal, which can set up sun and support it through moves like Helping Hand. It is commonly sighted with Ogerpon-C, which provides redirection, and Farigiraf, which blocks priority.

  • Walking Wake struggles against a common threat, Flutter Mane, which threatens it with its Fairy-type STAB moves and outspeeds it. Ogerpon-W also has a good matchup, since it can redirect Hydro Steam and threaten a 2HKO on Walking Wake with Horn Leech. It also consistently needs sun up, which can be advantageous to opposing Flutter Mane and Raging Bolt, as they can then threaten an OHKO on it.

Sun Sweeper.description:
• The EV spread allows Walking Wake to survive Special Attack Booster Energy Flutter Mane's Dazzling Gleam and Adamant Miracle Seed Rillaboom's Wood Hammer. It can also pick an OHKO on Amoonguss with Life Orb-boosted Flamethrower in sun.

  • Hydro Steam and Draco Meteor are Walking Wake's main STAB moves, while Flamethrower can threaten Pokemon that resist them, like Amoonguss and Kingambit. Dragon Pulse is a more spammable STAB move thanks to lack of drawbacks. Tera Blast can provide additional coverage when utilised with Tera Steel, threatening massive damage on Fairy-types like Flutter Mane.

  • Tera Fire and Steel are preferred to gain a resistance to Flutter Mane's and Rillaboom's STAB moves. Tera Fire also resists Ogerpon-H's STAB moves and boosts Flamethrower, which can threaten huge damage combined with the sun boost. On the other hand, Tera Steel grants crucial resistances, such as against Raging Bolt's Dragon-type STAB attacks, which normally threatens Walking Wake.

Ogerpon.overview:
• Ogerpon is a strong offensive Pokemon that is unique in being able to check many top Pokemon such as Incineroar and Flutter Mane thanks to its ability Defiant and Speed-boosting Embody Aspect after Terastallization. Combined with access to Follow Me and natural immunity to Spore, Ogerpon is capable of being a constant threat while still providing good supportive value.

  • Ogerpon is almost exclusively used on teams built around Dondozo. With its ability Defiant, Ogerpon can be used to punish Incineroar and Gouging Fire, disincentivizing them from weakening both Dondozo and Chien-Pao and even picking up a clean OHKO on Incineroar with Superpower. Once Terastallized, It can outspeed and OHKO Flutter Mane and both Urshifu formes, which are difficult for Dondozo and Chien-pao or Dragonite to handle.

  • Ogerpon struggles against Pokemon that resist Grass STAB as Tornadus and Raging Bolt as well as foes that outspeed it, either forcing Ogerpon to Terastallize or be unable to attack before fainting, such as Chien-Pao, which outspeeds and can survive one hit thanks to it usually holding a Focus Sash. Ogerpon's Grass typing means it's weak to common threats such as Chien-Pao and Gouging Fire, and its middling bulk makes it unable to take more than two attacks most of the time.

Offensive Redirector.description:
• Superpower is used as coverage to hit Steel- and the plethora of Dark-types that resist Ivy Cudgel, such as Kingambit or Chi-yu. Follow Me can be used to redirect attention from the frailer Chien-Pao and Glimmora, making both exponentially harder to deal with, especially so considering Ogerpon resists Urshifu-R Surging Strike's, one of the best counters to Chien-Pao and Glimmora

  • Covert Cloak is used to prevent a flinch from Fake Out, allowing Ogerpon to pressure Incineroar and its partner turn one. Additionally, blocking certain secondary effects such as Icy Wind's Speed drops from opposing Flutter Manes is useful.

  • The Attack investment is necessary to guarantee an OHKO on Incineroar with Superpower, on Flutter Mane once Ogerpon Terastallizes, and to have the highest chance of an OHKO on Urshifu-R. The Speed investment allows Ogerpon to outspeed Choice Scarf Landorus-T after Terastallization. The rest of the EVs are used to round out Ogerpon's bulk.

Ogerpon-W is often used to redirect attacks and threaten common Fire-types such as Incineroar and Chi-Yu and Ground-types such as Ursaluna-B and Landorus with Ivy Cudgel. Ogerpon-W has excellent matchups into Urshifu-R and Kyogre, both of which struggle to deal significant damage to Ogerpon-W while it can threaten them with Horn Leech or Wood Hammer. Horn Leech is used to deal consistent damage while boosting Ogerpon-W's longevity, while Wood Hammer allows Ogerpon-W to OHKO Flutter Mane and Kyogre. Ogerpon-W also matches up well into Calyrex-S and Ursaluna-B after it Terastallizes, threatening to 2HKO Calyrex-S and OHKO Ursaluna-B with Tera Water Ivy Cudgel. The HP and Defense investment allows Ogerpon-W to survive Collision Course in sun from Koraidon, Wood Hammer from Assault Vest Rillaboom, and two High Horsepowers from Calyrex-I after Terastallizing, and it gives it a high chance of surviving two Behemoth Blades from Zacian-C. The HP and Special Defense investment allows Ogerpon-W to survive Astral Barrage from Tera Ghost Choice Specs Calyrex-S, Discharge from Choice Specs Miraidon, and, when Terastallized, Blood Moon from Ursaluna-B; Ogerpon-W also has a high chance of surviving Overheat from Chi-Yu. The Attack investment allows Ogerpon-W to 2HKO Incineroar after Intimidate, and the Speed investment allows Ogerpon-W to outrun Landorus.

Ogerpon-W's redirection makes it an ideal partner for Pokemon that want to set up freely and frail offensive threats that can be KOed easily such as Calm Mind Terapagos and Choice Specs Calyrex-S, respectively. Ogerpon-W survives attacks such as Collision Course from Koraidon and Close Combat from Urshifu-R, which threaten Terapagos, and can redirect Sucker Punch from Chien-Pao, which threatens Calyrex-S. Ogerpon-W also threatens checks to Calyrex-S such as Incineroar and Chi-Yu. Ogerpon-W struggles against Miraidon, Raging Bolt, and Rillaboom, all of which wall and threaten it. Calyrex-I threatens all of these, making it an ideal partner for Ogerpon-W. Ogerpon-W benefits Calyrex-I by threatening Incineroar and redirecting attacks, such as Knock Off and Will-O-Wisp, that hinder Calyrex-I. A partner Incineroar also pairs well with Ogerpon-W, with Incineroar's Intimidate and Ogerpon-W's Embody Aspect working in tandem to make Ogerpon-W difficult to remove. Ogerpon-W supports Incineroar by redirecting attacks that threaten Incineroar such as Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R and Earth Power from Ursaluna-B.

Ogerpon-H is a spectacular Pokemon in Regulation G thanks to Follow Me combined with its offensive presence. Its STAB combination allows it to threaten many metagame staples, such as Rillaboom, Amoonguss, Calyrex-I, and Urshifu-R, for massive damage. Ogerpon-H prefers to use Wood Hammer to ensure OHKOs on Urshifu-R and bulky Kyogre; however, Horn Leech is used alongside the defensive sets for more survivability while still 2HKOing the aforementioned Water-types. Grassy Glide is a niche option, providing Ogerpon-H with a powerful priority move alongside Rillaboom and allowing Ogerpon-H to attack faster threats like Calyrex-S and Choice Scarf Urshifu-R before they move. The HP and Defense investment ensures that Ogerpon-H survives Tera Stellar Icicle Crash from Chien-Pao and almost always lives Tera Water Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R. The Speed EVs allow Ogerpon-H to outspeed Modest Landorus, and the rest is to maximize Attack. Ogerpon-H can use a much bulkier EV spread of 220 HP / 12 Atk / 252 Def / 4 SpD / 20 Spe with an Impish nature, which allows it to avoid the 2HKO from Chien-Pao's Ice Spinner, Calyrex-I's Glacial Lance, and Iron Hands's Quark Drive-boosted Drain Punch as well as surviving +1 Tera Fire Ivy Cudgel from opposing Ogerpon-H. The Speed investment allows Ogerpon-H to outspeed neutral-natured base 80 Speed Pokemon such as Regidrago.

Ogerpon-H especially struggles with Incineroar, which stomachs its attacks and weakens it with Intimidate and Parting Shot. Dragon-types like Raging Bolt and Roaring Moon are also problematic, taking its attacks and threatening massive damage with Draco Meteor and Acrobatics respectively. Landorus can also be threatening thanks to being able to threaten Ogerpon-H before and after it Terastallizes with Sludge Bomb and Earth Power respectively. Urshifu-R and Landorus make for excellent partners, as they threaten OHKOs on many of the aforementioned Pokemon with their STAB moves. The two also appreciate Ogerpon-H's support, as it can protect them from threatening Pokemon like Rillaboom and Chien-Pao with Follow Me. Miraidon makes excellent use of Ogerpon-H, as it appreciates Ogerpon-H threatening common checks like Rillaboom and Zacian-C with Ivy Cudgel and stomaching their attacks with Follow Me. Calyrex-I is another Restricted Pokemon that works well with Ogerpon-H, as it threatens Landorus and Raging Bolt with Glacial Lance. Calyrex-I has an easier time setting up Trick Room and dealing with disruptive status moves such as Amoonguss's Spore and Incineroar's Will-O-Wisp thanks to Ogerpon-H's Follow Me. Ogerpon-H also threatens foes that resist Glacial Lance like Zamazenta-C, Urshifu-R, and opposing Calyrex-I. Groudon also works particularly well with Ogerpon-H, threatening super effective damage on Incineroar and Raging Bolt with Precipice Blades, while bolstering Ogerpon-H's damage output with sun. Ogerpon-H can support Groudon by redirecting attacks from Rillaboom and Chien-Pao while also threatening Kyogre with its Grass-type STAB attacks, all of which are difficult matchups for Groudon. Powerful setup sweepers such as Calyex-S and Calm Mind Terapagos also make great use of Ogerpon-H. Ogerpon-H can help them set up by redirecting away powerful attacks such as Urshifu-S's Sucker Punch and Drain Punch from Iron Hands as well as disruptive moves like Amoonguss's Spore and Incineroar's Parting Shot. Ogerpon-H is also helpful offensively, as it can threaten otherwise problematic Pokemon like Chien-Pao and Urshifu-R with Ivy Cudgel and its Grass-type move of choice respectively.

Offensive.description:
• Horn Leech trades Wood Hammer's power for greater longevity.

  • Follow Me is by far the best third move on this Pokemon, but if the team does not require a redirector, Ogerpon-H can use Grassy Glide; if this is the case, it is almost always paired with Rillaboom to ensure Grassy Glide is a priority move. Alternatively, Stomping Tantrum allows it to hit opposing Fire-types such as Entei and Chi-Yu.

  • The Speed EVs allow Ogerpon-H to outspeed Modest Landorus and Adamant Urshifu-R. The Attack EVs with the Adamant nature allow it to OHKO Flutter Mane after Terastallization even when Ogerpon-H is Intimidated.

  • The bulk investment allows Ogerpon-H to live most Choice Scarf Urshifu-R's Tera Water Surging Strikes while having a favorable roll to survive Timid Landorus's Sludge Bomb.

Offensive Redirector.description:
Ogerpon-C is an offensive redirector, keeping allies such as Miraidon and Calyrex-I safe while eliminating common foes like Ogerpon-H, Tornadus, and Chi-Yu. Ogerpon-C has an excellent matchup into Amoonguss, as it can redirect Spore. Follow Me allows Ogerpon-C to keep its partner safe. Power Whip is used to do big damage to Pokemon like Groudon and Urshifu-R while keeping Sturdy intact. Alternatively, Horn Leech can be used to sacrifice power for recovery, allowing Ogerpon-C to reactivate Sturdy, while Wood Hammer is used for a burst of damage, but it breaks Sturdy.

Ogerpon-C struggles to damage common Steel-type Pokemon such as Zamazenta-C and Gholdengo, which can set up on it or threaten to bring Ogerpon-C down to Sturdy. Due to its great ability to redirect attacks, Ogerpon-C is commonly seen on hyper offense Tailwind or Trick Room teams supporting Restricted Pokemon like Miraidon and Calyrex-I. Ogerpon-C also adds a fast mode on Trick Room teams and has great damage output while removing problematic foes like Incineroar. Ogerpon-C pairs well with Koraidon, as it can effectively remove Pelipper and Tornadus and prevent them from disrupting Koraidon's weather. Ogerpon-C can also reliably redirect Spore from Amoonguss and threaten Calyrex-I regardless of Terastallization. In return, Koraidon can remove the plethora of opposing Steel-types. Some good partners for Ogerpon-C, aside from Calyrex-I, Miraidon, and Koraidon, are Whimsicott, Tornadus, and Farigiraf. Whimsicott or Tornadus can set Tailwind for Ogerpon-C to outspeed faster Pokemon like Flutter Mane, Choice Scarf Urshifu-R, and Chi-Yu, threatening to OHKO them. Finally, Farigiraf blocks Fake Out, letting Ogerpon-C deal a lot damage; Ogerpon-C can also help Farigiraf set Trick Room thanks to Follow Me support.

Redirection Support.description:
• Ivy Cudgel synergizes well with Ogerpon-C's Grass-type moves, hitting Fire- and Flying-types like Tornadus, Incineroar, and Chi-Yu.

  • Horn Leech provides Ogerpon-C with recovery, while Power Whip hits targets harder, threatening an OHKO on Urshifu-R.

  • Follow Me lets it redirect moves away from its teammates like Sucker Punch and Spore from Chien-Pao and Amoonguss, respectively.

  • Tera Rock bolsters Ivy Cudgel's damage, letting it guarantee an OHKO on Entei, and the Defense boost thanks to Embody Aspect can let it almost always survive Close Combat from Choice Scarf Urshifu-R.

Archaludon.comments:
Teambuilding

  • Assault Vest Archaludon is commonly used on rain-reliant teams, allowing it to use Electro Shot every turn. Rain teams also utilize powerful Water-types such as Basculegion-M, which threatens Ground-types like Ursaluna that threaten Archaludon. Assault Vest Archaludon also appreciates redirection and damage reduction, allowing it to set up freely while gaining boosts from Stamina. Power Herb Archaludon needs to deal as much damage as possible before fainting, so it is best paired with fast or priority-boosted forms of speed control like Whimsicott.
  • When it's used with rain, common partners alongside Archaludon are Pelipper, Basculegion-M and Amoonguss. Pelipper and Basculegion-M cover Archaludon's Ground- and Fighting-type weaknesses, while Amoonguss redirects damage with Rage Powder and can heal Archaludon with Pollen Puff. When using the Power Herb set, Archaludon is commonly paired with priority Tailwind users such as Whimsicott and Talonflame, allowing it to attack before its foes can, and it is used on balance teams paired with partners such as Rillaboom and Primarina that threaten Ground- and Fighting-types. Rillaboom can also disrupt opponents with Fake Out as well as healing Archaludon with Grassy Terrain. Incineroar also pairs well with both Archaludon sets, as it can disrupt opponents with Fake Out while providing damage reduction with Intimidate.
  • Before Terastallizing, Archaludon takes severe damage from Ground- and Fighting-types such as Ursaluna and Flamigo. Water- and Grass-type partners such as Pelipper, Primarina, and Rillaboom mitigate the Ground-type weakness, with Pelipper and Primarina also threatening Fighting-types. Archaludon struggles to damage Ghost-types, in particular Gholdengo with its additional Steel typing, so Dark- and Ghost-type partners such as Incineroar and Basculegion-M can threaten them. Haze is another great roadblock to Archaludon. With Primarina being the most common Haze user, Rillaboom can threaten Primarina before it is able to use it.

Strategy Comments

  • Archaludon is a sweeper capable of dealing significant damage to most foes after a +1 Special Attack boost from Electro Shot or with Body Press after gaining multiple Defense boosts from Stamina. Archaludon should often be sent out first in order to start setting up early when using the Assault Vest set, and it functions best when it's used on rain teams.
  • The Power Herb set can be used either early- or late-game. It mostly requires speed control through Tailwind in order to deal significant damage before fainting, making this set ideal on hyper offense teams. It can also be slotted onto balance teams that require a powerful special attacker or Steel- and Dragon-type coverage.
  • Ursaluna is a huge check to Archaludon, as it's capable of OHKOing it before it Terastallizes, while Archaludon can't OHKO it back. Archaludon is therefore reliant on partners that can KO or weaken Ursaluna such as Basculegion-M and Incineroar. Gholdengo walls Archaludon, so it relies on partners like Incineroar to survive attacks from Gholdengo and threaten it back. Removing rain prevents Assault Vest Archaludon from freely gaining boosts and attacking with Electro Shot, greatly hindering its setup. This forces Pelipper to be brought back onto the field to reset the weather. Haze also counters Assault Vest Archaludon, severly weakening its damage output and bulk, so partners such as Rillaboom that can KO Haze users like Primarina before they can attack help to mitigate this.

Bulky Setup Sweeper.description:
• When used as a bulky setup sweeper, Archaludon increases its Special Attack with Electro Shot, allowing it to easily snowball. Archaludon also aims to survive for a long time on the field while dealing significant damage by relying on Stamina to boost its Defense stat, increasing its longevity and the damage dealt by Body Press.
  • Electro Shot and Body Press are essential for Archaludon, with Electro Shot threatening Water-types such as Primarina and Basculegion-M. Body Press threatens Dark-types like Incineroar and Kingambit. Flash Cannon and Draco Meteor are used for consistent STAB attacks, with Dragon Pulse sometimes being used over Draco Meteor for more consistency at the cost of lower damage. Snarl, while less common, is used to hinder special threats such as Gholdengo and opposing Archaludon.
  • Tera Grass lets Archaludon resist Headlong Rush from Ursaluna as well as providing an immunity to Spore and Rage Powder. Tera Fairy inverts Archaludon's weakness to Close Combat from Sneasler, makes Archaludon immune to Draco Meteor from opposing Archaludon, and provides a solid overall defensive typing.
  • Archaludon's physical bulk investment lets it survive Close Combat from Sneasler, Headlong Rush and Facade from Ursaluna after Archaludon has Terastallized into a Grass-type, and Outrage from Choice Band Dragonite and Dragapult, with a high chance to survive Tera Dragon Choice Band Outrage from Dragapult. With the given special bulk investment, Archaludon can comfortably survive +2 Shadow Ball from Gholdengo, Draco Meteor from opposing Archaludon, and Earth Power from Ursaluna-B as well as allowing Archaludon to survive Ursaluna-B's Life Orb-boosted Tera Normal Blood Moon after Terastallizing.
  • This Archaludon set requires being on the field for the majority of the game in order to become fully set up, so it is not immediately threatening. Being on the field for a long time makes Archaludon susceptible to being double targeted and KOed easily, as the set lacks Protect or a way to heal itself. It can also be set back while attempting to set up by Haze as well as Parting Shot and Snarl.

Glass Cannon.description:
• The objective of glass cannon Archaludon is to attack once with Electro Shot to increase its Special Attack and proceed to deal as much damage as possible before it is KOed. With the help of Sturdy, Archaludon is guaranteed to survive one powerful attack, allowing it to deal significant damage before being KOed.
  • Electro Shot is mandatory for boosting Archaludon's Special Attack stat as well as dealing devastating damage to Water-types such as Primarina and Basculegion. Draco Meteor can be used over Dragon Pulse for more damage at the cost of weakening Archaludon's damage and lower accuracy. STAB Flash Cannon allows Archaludon to significantly damage Fairy-types like Clefable. Aura Sphere is sometimes used instead of Protect to significantly damage Dark-types such as Incineroar and Kingambit.
  • Power Herb allows Archaludon to use Electro Shot within a single turn without requiring rain.
  • Tera Stellar takes advantage of Archaludon's array of coverage attacks, increasing Archaludon's damage. This allows Archaludon to pick up vital OHKOs against Pokemon such as Ursaluna with +1 Draco Meteor.
  • This Archaludon set is significantly better at dealing a lot of damage early-game with the drawback of being unable to remain in play for a long time, since it is less bulky than Assault Vest sets and can't increase its defenses.

Rain Sweeper.description:
• Archaludon's Defense EVs allow it to survive Adamant Choice Scarf Urshifu-R's and Urshifu-S's Close Combat, meaning it can take a hit, boost itself with Electro Shot, and OHKO Urshifu-R on the same turn, provided rain is currently active. The Special Defense investment prevents it from being 2HKOed by Special Attack Booster Energy Flutter Mane's Moonblast.

  • Archaludon does not particularly require Special Attack investment thanks to Electro Shot boosting this stat, but 36 Special Attack EVs with a Modest nature give Archaludon an extra point in Special Attack because of how stat calculation works.

  • 28 Speed EVs are to outspeed Choice Scarf Urshifu-R, Urshifu-S and Landorus-T when Archaludon is under Tailwind.

  • Draco Meteor and Electro Shot OHKO Pokemon such as Raging Bolt, Urshifu-R, and Tornadus. Flash Cannon OHKOes Flutter Mane after one Electro Shot boost, and Body Press is good to threaten an OHKO on Chien-Pao, and significant damage on Incineroar, especially after a Stamina boost.

  • Tera Grass gives Archaludon a resistance to Ground-type moves such as Landorus's Sandsear Storm and Earth Power, and immunity to Spore and Rage Powder. Meanwhile, Tera Fairy gives it a Fighting resistance and Dragon immunity to beat Urshifu and opposing Dragon-types respectively.

Gouging Fire.overview:
• Gouging Fire is a solid offensive support Pokemon with a good defensive typing. Breaking Swipe and Burning Bulwark give it a great matchup against physical attackers such as Rillaboom and Chien-Pao.

  • Kingambit is one of the most prominent partners for Gouging Fire, because it prevents Incineroar from crippling Gouging Fire with Intimidate. Ogerpon-W fits well with Gouging Fire as well, as with Follow Me it can protect Gouging Fire from Ground- and Water-type moves, both of which Ogerpon-W resists.

  • The Urshifu formes counter Gouging Fire, since they ignore Burning Bulwark and Breaking Swipe. Incineroar is also a good counter to Gouging Fire, cycling Intimidate and Parting Shot repeatedly until Gouging Fire is a sitting duck. Gouging Fire also struggles against special attackers like Flutter Mane and Landorus, which can hit it for big damage, the latter threatening it for an OHKO.

Offensive Support.description:
• Heat Crash is a reliable way of dealing damage, and because Gouging Fire is so heavy, it will almost always do good damage against most of the metagame. Howl can be used to take advantage of passive playstyles and partially negate Intimidate, and with a Speed Booster Energy, it can support the Kingambit and Ogerpon-W in return.

  • 252 HP and 20 Defense EVs allow you to always live two Wicked Blows from Adamant Urshifu-S, and 164 Speed EVs with a Jolly Nature allow you to and outspeed Adamant Choice Scarf Landorus-T and Chien-Pao once the Booster Energy has been consumed.

  • Tera Grass is a good defensive Tera type for Gouging Fire, as it lets Gouging Fire resist Ground-type moves like Landorus's Earth Power and makes it immune to Spore, which is crucial since Burning Bulwark doesn't Protect Gouging Fire from status moves. Tera Fairy is also a good option as well, as it lets Gouging Fire resist both of Urshifu-S's STAB moves and take neutral damage from the majority of the metagame.

Bulky Attacker.description:
Raging Bolt is an incredibly bulky special attacker that can stay on the field and survive hits from Restricted Pokemon, and threaten them back with its huge Special Attack stat and weaken their team with stat reducing moves. It matches up incredibly well into Urshifu-R, keeping it in check with Thunderclap, Koraidon, since it commonly doesn't run Dragon-type moves, common Fire / Water / Grass cores, which usually have Incineroar, Rillaboom, and Urshifu-R or Ogerpon-W, and multiple strong special attackers with Snarl, such as Kyogre, Calyrex-S, and Terapagos. Electroweb gives Raging Bolt a solid speed control option while still dealing relevant damage. Thunderbolt is a consistent and strong STAB option, and Volt Switch gives it a strong way to reposition itself. Assault Vest allows it to survive hits more easily from strong special attackers such as Calyrex-S, Terapagos, Kyogre, Flutter Mane, and opposing Raging Bolt while punishing them with a Snarl, Electroweb, or stronger attacking move. The EV spread allows it to avoid the 2HKO from Choice Specs Astral Barrage from Calyrex-S, survive an Icicle Crash from Chien-Pao, and outspeed -1 Gholdengo and Adamant Urshifu. Tera Electric significantly increases the damage it does at the cost of remaining vulnerable to strong Ground-type attackers such as Landorus and Groudon, while Tera Fairy allows it to gain an immunity to threatening Dragon-type attacks from the likes of Miraidon and opposing Raging Bolt while still having a very strong defensive typing into the current metagame.

Raging Bolt synergizes well with multiple Pokemon and can work on many team structures, but some notable partners are Incineroar, since it can reduce the threat from physical moves that Raging Bolt cannot weaken, Koraidon, since it activates Raging Bolt's ability Protosynthesis by setting up sun, and Urshifu-R, which checks multiple strong threats to Raging Bolt like Calyrex-I, Flutter Mane, Chien-Pao, and Landorus. Another Pokemon that checks Raging Bolt is Amoonguss, since Raging Bolt can't stop a Spore from going off and Raging Bolt's attacks can be redirected by Rage Powder without many issues. It is also vulnerable to Fake Out, since Raging Bolt is unable to use Protect to block it because of its Assault Vest, and variants without Draco Meteor can't threaten Incineroar for high damage, allowing it to use Parting Shot and pivot out relatively safely.

Three Attacks.description:
Raging Bolt is a strong special attacker that uses its good natural bulk and offensive typing to survive attacks and respond with strong Electric- and Dragon-type moves. Draco Meteor gives Raging Bolt a one-time nuke, while Dragon Pulse is a more consistent option for Life Orb sets. Thunderclap allows Raging Bolt to threaten faster Pokemon like Choice Scarf Urshifu-R before they can move. Booster Energy and Life Orb both allow Raging Bolt to deal more damage at the cost of either losing its boost on switch or taking recoil. Life Orb is used on sun teams, as its boost can stack with the Protosynthesis boost. Tera Electric boosts Thunderbolt and Thunderclap, allowing Raging Bolt to OHKO Pokemon such as bulky Kyogre with Thunderbolt and Urshifu-R with Thunderclap if Urshifu-R Terastallizes into a neutral type, as well as 2HKOing Calyrex-I with Thunderbolt. Tera Fairy makes Raging Bolt immune to Dragon-type attacks like Miraidon's Draco Meteor in addition to being a good neutral type.

Raging Bolt struggles into bulky Pokemon such as Amoonguss and Ting-Lu that resist or are immune to Thunderbolt, survive Draco Meteor or Dragon Pulse, and respond with Spore or a super effective attack. Faster offensive Pokemon like Miraidon, Zacian-C, and Landorus are also a problem for Raging Bolt, as they can threaten to OHKO it. Calyrex-I threatens the Grass-, Ground-, and Dragon-types that resist Thunderbolt, as well as setting up Trick Room to help Raging Bolt with faster threats. Raging Bolt can also hit the Water-types that resist Glacial Lance with Thunderbolt or Thunderclap. Pokemon that can set up sun such as Koraidon also pair well with Raging Bolt, as they allow it to get a Protosynthesis boost in addition to Life Orb. Raging Bolt can support them by threatening Water-types that resist Flare Blitz or by removing Pelipper, which is a common check to sun teams.

Calm Mind.description:
Raging Bolt's good natural bulk allows it to function well as a bulky setup sweeper. It has good matchups against Kyogre and Urshifu-R due to STAB Thunderclap. Dragon Pulse is commonly used to break Pokemon that resist Thunderclap, like opposing Raging Bolt and Miraidon. Dragon Pulse may also aid against Pokemon with redirection like Ogerpon-W or Armor Tail Farigiraf that blocks Thunderclap. Leftovers is the preferred item on Calm Mind Raging Bolt due to the increased longevity, especially when paired with Grassy Terrain support from Rillaboom. Alternatively, Raging Bolt can use Booster Energy for an immediate power boost, threatening an OHKO on Miraidon and a 2HKO on Calyrex-S. 244 HP and 52 Defense EVs allow Raging Bolt to survive Adamant Chien-Pao's Ice Spinner. The HP and Special Defense EVs allow +1 Special Defense Terastallized Raging Bolt to survive two attacks from both Modest Flutter Mane's Moonblast and Landorus's Earth Power. 92 Speed EVs allow Raging Bolt to outspeed 4 Speed Rillaboom. Tera Fairy is the Tera type of choice because it provides Raging Bolt an even matchup into most of the format.

Good partners for Calm Mind Raging Bolt include Rillaboom because it can provide Grassy Terrain and create free turns with Fake Out, allowing Raging Bolt to set up more safely. Similarly, Incineroar is often paired with Raging Bolt, since it can offer damage reduction and Fake Out support. Redirection, such as Ogerpon-W's Follow Me, is greatly appreciated by Raging Bolt. Groudon and Koraidon are also good partners for Raging Bolt, since they can activate its Protosynthesis ability and check Pokemon like Amoonguss and Zacian-C, which are common checks for Raging Bolt. Amoonguss threatens Raging Bolt's Thunderclap via Rage Powder redirection and Spore. Zacian-C, Groudon, Choice Specs Flutter Mane, Calyrex-I, and Landorus can threaten Raging Bolt before and after it Terastallizes.

Assault Vest.description:
• Electroweb is sometimes run over Thunderbolt for speed control. Volt Switch allows for Raging Bolt to become a bulky pivot and pairs well with Draco Meteor, allowing it to switch out after the Special Attack drop. Snarl weakens opposing special attackers, enabling it to sit on the field for longer and deal damage. Tera Blast gives Raging Bolt a strong option into bulky Dark-types and Fighting-types like Ting-Lu and Iron Hands.

  • Assault Vest allows Raging Bolt to fully take advantage of its amazing bulk, letting it sit on the field and tank hit after hit all while dealing respectable damage and disrupting the foe with moves like Snarl and Electroweb.

  • The defensive investment allows Raging Bolt to always survive Icicle Crash from Adamant Chien-Pao and Moonblast from Choice Specs Flutter Mane. The Speed investment allows Raging Bolt to outspeed Glimmora and Modest Chi-Yu after an Electroweb. The rest of the EVs were put into offensive investment.

  • Tera Fairy is just an incredibly strong neutral Tera type, especially for a Pokemon with as much bulk as Raging Bolt has, and provides a resistance to Urshifu-S's STAB moves.

3 Attacks.description:
• Thunderbolt provides good consistent damage, especially with Tera Electric, while Thunderclap helps make up for Raging Bolt's middling Speed. Draco Meteor is a more powerful option, being able to OHKO Pokémon like Landorus when used with Booster Energy. However, it can be forced to switch out after a Special Attack drop and lose the boost.

  • Booster Energy is a strong option, as boosting Raging Bolt's already huge base Special Attack even further turns it into an absolute nuke. Safety Goggles prevents Amoonguss from redirecting Thunderclaps away from Urshifu-R.

  • The Speed investment allows Raging Bolt to outspeed Dragapult, Flutter Mane, and Chien-Pao while under Tailwind, allowing it to hit them with its stronger options like Thunderbolt and Draco Meteor.
